feed.title: AATF AI News Aggregator - Research (Full)
feed.subtitle: Research items from AI News Aggregator

author.name: AATF AI News Aggregator

entry.title: Research Summary: January 29, 2026

author.name: AATF AI News Aggregator

entry.summary:
Today's research spans AI's societal impact, alignment fundamentals, and practical training advances. An Anthropic researcher presents randomized experiments showing AI assistance impairs conceptual understanding during skill acquisition—critical findings for AI deployment strategy.

Alignment & Training Innovations:

  • Reward models inherit significant value biases from pretrained base LLMs, revealing hidden alignment risks in RLHF pipelines
  • Peer prediction methods from mechanism design enable truthful LLM training without ground truth labels
  • SDPO (Self-Distillation Policy Optimization) converts rich textual feedback into dense learning signals, addressing RLVR credit assignment
  • Failure-prefix conditioning rescues learning from saturated problems where standard RLVR stalls

Deployment & Evaluation:

  • NVIDIA's quantization-aware distillation recovers NVFP4 inference accuracy for production LLMs/VLMs
  • SokoBench exposes consistent degradation in LLM planning as horizon length increases
  • Harvard's MoE hyperparameter transfer enables scaling width, depth, and expert count without retuning
  • Multi-agent debate underperforms majority vote due to missing diversity and poor confidence calibration
  • PURGE introduces RL-based machine unlearning for GDPR/EU AI Act compliance

entry.title: How AI Impacts Skill Formation

author.name: Judy Hanwen Shen, Alex Tamkin

entry.summary: Randomized experiments studying how AI assistance affects skill development in programmers learning new libraries. Finds AI use impairs conceptual understanding, code reading, and debugging abilities without significant efficiency gains on average.

entry.title: Reward Models Inherit Value Biases from Pretraining

author.name: Brian Christian, Jessica A. F. Thompson, Elle Michelle Yang, Vincent Adam, Hannah Rose Kirk, Christopher Summerfield, Tsvetomira Dumbalska

entry.summary: Shows reward models inherit significant value biases from their base pretrained LLMs. Demonstrates robust differences along psychological value dimensions (agency vs communion) between Llama and Gemma RMs.

entry.title: Reinforcement Learning via Self-Distillation

author.name: Jonas H\"ubotter, Frederike L\"ubeck, Lejs Behric, Anton Baumann, Marco Bagatella, Daniel Marta, Ido Hakimi, Idan Shenfeld, Thomas Kleine Buening, Carlos Guestrin, Andreas Krause

entry.summary: Introduces Self-Distillation Policy Optimization (SDPO) for RLVR that converts rich textual feedback into dense learning signals without external teachers. Treats the model conditioned on feedback as its own teacher.

entry.title: SokoBench: Evaluating Long-Horizon Planning and Reasoning in Large Language Models

author.name: Sebastiano Monti, Carlo Nicolini, Gianni Pellegrini, Jacopo Staiano, Bruno Lepri

entry.summary: Proposes SokoBench, a benchmark based on Sokoban puzzles for evaluating long-horizon planning in Large Reasoning Models. Finds consistent degradation beyond 25 moves, suggesting fundamental planning constraints.

entry.title: Truthfulness Despite Weak Supervision: Evaluating and Training LLMs Using Peer Prediction

author.name: Tianyi Alex Qiu, Micah Carroll, Cameron Allen

entry.summary: Introduces peer prediction methods from mechanism design for LLM evaluation and post-training. Rewards honest and informative answers using mutual prediction between models, enabling evaluation without strong supervision.

entry.title: Quantization-Aware Distillation for NVFP4 Inference Accuracy Recovery

author.name: Meng Xin, Sweta Priyadarshi, Jingyu Xin, Bilal Kartal, Aditya Vavre, Asma Kuriparambil Thekkumpate, Zijia Chen, Ameya Sunil Mahabaleshwarkar, Ido Shahaf, Akhiad Bercovich, Kinjal Patel, Suguna Varshini Velury, Chenjie Luo, Zhiyu Cheng, Jenny Chen, Chen-Han Yu, Wei Ping, Oleg Rybakov, Nima Tajbakhsh, Oluwatobi Olabiyi, Dusan Stosic, Di Wu, Song Han, Eric Chung, Sharath Turuvekere Sreenivas, Bryan Catanzaro, Yoshi Suhara, Tijmen Blankevoort, Huizi Mao

entry.summary: Presents quantization-aware distillation (QAD) best practices for recovering accuracy of NVFP4-quantized LLMs and VLMs. Shows effectiveness for models with complex post-training pipelines (SFT+RL+merging) where traditional QAT fails.

entry.title: Demystifying Multi-Agent Debate: The Role of Confidence and Diversity

author.name: Xiaochen Zhu, Caiqi Zhang, Yizhou Chi, Tom Stafford, Nigel Collier, Andreas Vlachos

entry.summary: Analyzes why multi-agent debate often underperforms majority vote despite higher compute cost. Identifies missing diversity and confidence calibration, proposing lightweight interventions that significantly improve outcomes.

entry.title: Training Reasoning Models on Saturated Problems via Failure-Prefix Conditioning

author.name: Minwu Kim, Safal Shrestha, Keith Ross

entry.summary: Proposes failure-prefix conditioning to improve learning from saturated problems where standard RLVR stalls. Conditions training on prefixes from rare incorrect trajectories to expose models to failure-prone states.

entry.title: Hyperparameter Transfer with Mixture-of-Expert Layers

author.name: Tianze Jiang, Blake Bordelon, Cengiz Pehlevan, Boris Hanin

entry.summary: Proposes new parameterization for MoE transformers enabling hyperparameter transfer when scaling width, depth, number of experts, and expert size. Justified by dynamical mean field theory analysis.

entry.title: The Grammar of Transformers: A Systematic Review of Interpretability Research on Syntactic Knowledge in Language Models

author.name: Nora Graichen, Iria de-Dios-Flores, Gemma Boleda

entry.summary: Systematic review of 337 articles evaluating syntactic abilities of Transformer language models, analyzing 1,015 model results across syntactic phenomena and interpretability methods.

entry.title: Beyond the Needle's Illusion: Decoupled Evaluation of Evidence Access and Use under Semantic Interference at 326M-Token Scale

author.name: Tianwei Lin, Zuyi Zhou, Xinda Zhao, Chenke Wang, Xiaohong Li, Yu Chen, Chuanrui Hu, Jian Pei, Yafeng Deng

entry.summary: Introduces EverMemBench-S, an adversarial NIAH benchmark with 326M-token MemoryBank that tests evidence access and use separately. Features collision-tested hard negatives and multi-document gold evidence sets.

entry.title: Reinforcement Unlearning via Group Relative Policy Optimization

author.name: Efstratios Zaradoukas, Bardh Prenkaj, Gjergji Kasneci

entry.summary: Introduces PURGE for machine unlearning in LLMs using Group Relative Policy Optimization framework, formulating unlearning as verifiable problem with intrinsic reward penalizing mentions of target data.

entry.title: Scaling Medical Reasoning Verification via Tool-Integrated Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Hang Zhang, Ruheng Wang, Yuelyu Ji, Mingu Kwak, Xizhi Wu, Chenyu Li, Li Zhang, Wenqi Shi, Yifan Peng, Yanshan Wang

entry.summary: Introduces an agentic framework for medical reasoning verification that trains verifiers to iteratively query external medical corpora during evaluation, combining tool-augmented verification with iterative reinforcement learning.

entry.title: Evolutionary Strategies lead to Catastrophic Forgetting in LLMs

author.name: Immanuel Abdi, Akshat Gupta, Micah Mok, Alexander Lu, Nicholas Lee, Gopala Anumanchipalli

entry.summary: Comprehensive analysis showing Evolutionary Strategies cause catastrophic forgetting in LLMs despite promising task-specific performance. ES reaches GRPO-like performance on math/reasoning but forgets other capabilities.

entry.title: Concept Component Analysis: A Principled Approach for Concept Extraction in LLMs

author.name: Yuhang Liu, Erdun Gao, Dong Gong, Anton van den Hengel, Javen Qinfeng Shi

entry.summary: Proposes Concept Component Analysis as principled approach for extracting interpretable concepts from LLM activations, addressing theoretical ambiguity in SAEs about correspondence between representations and human-interpretable concepts.

entry.title: Learning Contextual Runtime Monitors for Safe AI-Based Autonomy

author.name: Alejandro Luque-Cerpa, Mengyuan Wang, Emil Carlsson, Sanjit A. Seshia, Devdatt Dubhashi, Hazem Torfah

entry.summary: Introduces framework for learning context-aware runtime monitors that identify and exploit contextual strengths of individual ML controllers rather than blending outputs. Enables safer AI-based autonomy.

entry.title: Benchmarking LLAMA Model Security Against OWASP Top 10 For LLM Applications

author.name: Nourin Shahin, Izzat Alsmadi

entry.summary: Benchmarks Llama model variants against OWASP Top 10 for LLM Applications, finding Llama-Guard-3-1B achieves 76% detection rate while base models showed 0% detection for many vulnerability categories.

entry.title: Policy of Thoughts: Scaling LLM Reasoning via Test-time Policy Evolution

author.name: Zhengbo Jiao, Hongyu Xian, Qinglong Wang, Yunpu Ma, Zhebo Wang, Zifan Zhang, Dezhang Kong, Meng Han

entry.summary: Introduces Policy of Thoughts, recasting LLM reasoning as within-instance online optimization. Inspired by Popper's epistemology, PoT evolves the model's policy through learning from failed attempts using Group Relative optimization.

entry.title: Stingy Context: 18:1 Hierarchical Code Compression for LLM Auto-Coding

author.name: David Linus Ostby

entry.summary: Introduces Stingy Context, achieving 18:1 compression for LLM auto-coding tasks using hierarchical tree-based TREEFRAG decomposition, reducing 239k tokens to 11k while maintaining 94-97% success across 12 frontier models.

entry.title: VERGE: Formal Refinement and Guidance Engine for Verifiable LLM Reasoning

author.name: Vikash Singh, Darion Cassel, Nathaniel Weir, Nick Feng, Sam Bayless

entry.summary: Presents VERGE, a neurosymbolic framework combining LLMs with SMT solvers for verification-guided answers through iterative refinement, including multi-model consensus via formal semantic equivalence.

entry.title: Detecting and Mitigating Memorization in Diffusion Models through Anisotropy of the Log-Probability

author.name: Rohan Asthana, Vasileios Belagiannis

entry.summary: Proves norm-based memorization detection metrics are primarily effective under isotropic assumptions. Shows memorized samples exhibit strong angular alignment in anisotropic (low-noise) regime, enabling better detection and mitigation.

entry.title: Latent Object Permanence: Topological Phase Transitions, Free-Energy Principles, and Renormalization Group Flows in Deep Transformer Manifolds

author.name: Faruk Alpay, Bugra Kilictas

entry.summary: Analyzes multi-step reasoning in transformers through statistical physics, identifying a phase transition at normalized depth ~0.42 where effective dimensionality sharply reduces. Formalizes forward pass as discrete renormalization group flow on a learned manifold.

entry.title: On the Computational Complexity of Performative Prediction

author.name: Ioannis Anagnostides, Rohan Chauhan, Ioannis Panageas, Tuomas Sandholm, Jingming Yan

entry.summary: Establishes PPAD-completeness for computing performatively stable points when performative effects exceed 1+O(ε), even for quadratic loss with linear shifts. Proves sharp phase transition in computational complexity.

entry.title: Efficient Evaluation of LLM Performance with Statistical Guarantees

author.name: Skyler Wu, Yash Nair, Emmanuel J. Cand\'es

entry.summary: Introduces Factorized Active Querying (FAQ) for efficient LLM benchmarking with statistical guarantees, using Bayesian factor models and active learning to achieve up to 5x tighter confidence intervals under fixed query budgets. From Emmanuel Candès group at Stanford.

entry.title: Benchmarking Reward Hack Detection in Code Environments via Contrastive Analysis

author.name: Darshan Deshpande, Anand Kannappan, Rebecca Qian

entry.summary: Proposes TRACE benchmark with 517 testing trajectories across 54 reward exploit categories for detecting reward hacking in code RL, contrasting isolated classification with contrastive anomaly detection.

entry.title: Agent Benchmarks Fail Public Sector Requirements

author.name: Jonathan Rystr{\o}m, Chris Schmitz, Karolina Korgul, Jan Batzner, Chris Russell

entry.summary: Analyzes whether current LLM agent benchmarks meet public sector requirements. Defines criteria (process-based, realistic, public-sector-specific, appropriate metrics) and finds most benchmarks fall short.

entry.title: TABED: Test-Time Adaptive Ensemble Drafting for Robust Speculative Decoding in LVLMs

author.name: Minjae Lee, Wonjun Kang, Byeongkeun Ahn, Christian Classen, Kevin Galim, Seunghyuk Oh, Minghao Yan, Hyung Il Koo, Kangwook Lee

entry.summary: Proposes TABED for robust speculative decoding in Large Vision-Language Models, dynamically ensembling multiple drafts via batch inference by leveraging deviations from past ground truths.

entry.title: Supervised Guidance Training for Infinite-Dimensional Diffusion Models

author.name: Elizabeth L. Baker, Alexander Denker, Jes Frellsen

entry.summary: Proves infinite-dimensional diffusion models can be conditioned using Doob's h-transform extension, assuming prior in Cameron-Martin space or absolutely continuous w.r.t. Gaussian measure. Provides supervised guidance training approach.

entry.title: Membership Inference Attacks Against Fine-tuned Diffusion Language Models

author.name: Yuetian Chen, Kaiyuan Zhang, Yuntao Du, Edoardo Stoppa, Charles Fleming, Ashish Kundu, Bruno Ribeiro, Ninghui Li

entry.summary: First systematic investigation of Membership Inference Attack vulnerabilities in Diffusion Language Models, introducing SAMA that exploits multiple maskable configurations for improved detection.

entry.title: QueerGen: How LLMs Reflect Societal Norms on Gender and Sexuality in Sentence Completion Tasks

author.name: Mae Sosto, Delfina Sol Martinez Pandiani, Laura Hollink

entry.summary: Examines how LLMs reproduce heterocisnormativity in sentence completions across queer-marked, non-queer-marked, and unmarked subject categories. Finds MLMs produce less favorable sentiment and higher toxicity for queer-marked subjects.

entry.title: Spectral Ghost in Representation Learning: from Component Analysis to Self-Supervised Learning

author.name: Bo Dai, Na Li, Dale Schuurmans

entry.summary: Provides theoretical unification of self-supervised learning methods from component analysis to contrastive learning through spectral analysis. Identifies common principles across dramatically different SSL objectives.

entry.title: Continual GUI Agents

author.name: Ziwei Liu, Borui Kang, Hangjie Yuan, Zixiang Zhao, Wei Li, Yifan Zhu, Tao Feng

entry.summary: Introduces Continual GUI Agents task requiring continual learning under shifted domains/resolutions. Proposes GUI-AiF framework with Anchoring Point Reward and Anchoring Region Reward for stable grounding.

entry.title: Advancing Open-source World Models

author.name: Robbyant Team, Zelin Gao, Qiuyu Wang, Yanhong Zeng, Jiapeng Zhu, Ka Leong Cheng, Yixuan Li, Hanlin Wang, Yinghao Xu, Shuailei Ma, Yihang Chen, Jie Liu, Yansong Cheng, Yao Yao, Jiayi Zhu, Yihao Meng, Kecheng Zheng, Qingyan Bai, Jingye Chen, Zehong Shen, Yue Yu, Xing Zhu, Yujun Shen, Hao Ouyang

entry.summary: Presents LingBot-World, an open-source world simulator with high fidelity, minute-level horizon with long-term memory, and real-time interactivity (<1s latency for 16fps), providing code and model access.

entry.title: Harder Is Better: Boosting Mathematical Reasoning via Difficulty-Aware GRPO and Multi-Aspect Question Reformulation

author.name: Yanqi Dai, Yuxiang Ji, Xiao Zhang, Yong Wang, Xiangxiang Chu, Zhiwu Lu

entry.summary: Proposes MathForge framework addressing GRPO's implicit bias against harder questions through difficulty-aware policy optimization and multi-aspect question reformulation to systematically increase problem difficulty.

entry.title: HEART: A Unified Benchmark for Assessing Humans and LLMs in Emotional Support Dialogue

author.name: Laya Iyer, Kriti Aggarwal, Sanmi Koyejo, Gail Heyman, Desmond C. Ong, Subhabrata Mukherjee

entry.summary: Introduces HEART, the first framework directly comparing humans and LLMs on identical multi-turn emotional support conversations with blinded evaluation across five interpersonal communication dimensions.

entry.title: Gap-K%: Measuring Top-1 Prediction Gap for Detecting Pretraining Data

author.name: Minseo Kwak, Jaehyung Kim

entry.summary: Proposes Gap-K%, a pretraining data detection method analyzing discrepancy between model's top-1 prediction and target token, grounded in optimization dynamics during LLM training.

entry.title: LinguaMap: Which Layers of LLMs Speak Your Language and How to Tune Them?

author.name: J. Ben Tamo, Daniel Carlander-Reuterfelt, Jonathan Rubin, Dezhi Hong, Mingxian Wang, Oleg Poliannikov

entry.summary: Introduces LinguaMap analyzing which LLM layers handle different languages, identifying multilingual transfer and language consistency bottlenecks with layer-by-layer logit lens analysis.

entry.title: Beyond Speedup -- Utilizing KV Cache for Sampling and Reasoning

author.name: Zeyu Xing, Xing Li, Hui-Ling Zhen, Mingxuan Yuan, Sinno Jialin Pan

entry.summary: Proposes repurposing KV cache beyond inference speedup for embedding extraction and adaptive reasoning switching. Demonstrates applications in Chain-of-Embedding and Fast/Slow Thinking on Qwen3 and DeepSeek-R1.

entry.title: Decomposing multimodal embedding spaces with group-sparse autoencoders

author.name: Chiraag Kaushik, Davis Barch, Andrea Fanelli

entry.summary: Addresses the 'split dictionary' problem in multimodal SAEs where learned features become unimodal. Proposes group-sparse autoencoders to decompose CLIP embeddings while maintaining cross-modal semantic alignment.

entry.title: An Accounting Identity for Algorithmic Fairness

author.name: Hadi Elzayn, Jacob Goldin

entry.summary: Derives accounting identity linking model accuracy to fairness criteria, showing for globally calibrated models the budget for unfairness equals MSE times group prevalence difference. Nests impossibility results as special cases.

entry.title: When More Data Doesn't Help: Limits of Adaptation in Multitask Learning

author.name: Steve Hanneke, Mingyue Xu

entry.summary: Establishes stronger impossibility result for multitask learning adaptation, showing without distributional information no algorithm can guarantee optimal risk when sample size per task is bounded.

entry.title: PatchFormer: A Patch-Based Time Series Foundation Model with Hierarchical Masked Reconstruction and Cross-Domain Transfer Learning for Zero-Shot Multi-Horizon Forecasting

author.name: Olaf Yunus Laitinen Imanov, Derya Umut Kulali, Taner Yilmaz

entry.summary: Proposes PatchFormer, a patch-based time series foundation model with hierarchical masked reconstruction for self-supervised pretraining and cross-domain knowledge distillation for zero-shot multi-horizon forecasting.

entry.title: SERA: Soft-Verified Efficient Repository Agents

author.name: Ethan Shen, Danny Tormoen, Saurabh Shah, Ali Farhadi, Tim Dettmers

entry.summary: Presents SERA, an efficient method for training coding agents specialized to private codebases using only supervised finetuning. Achieves state-of-the-art among fully open-source models, matching Devstral-Small-2 performance.

entry.title: Towards a Mechanistic Understanding of Large Reasoning Models: A Survey of Training, Inference, and Failures

author.name: Yi Hu, Jiaqi Gu, Ruxin Wang, Zijun Yao, Hao Peng, Xiaobao Wu, Jianhui Chen, Muhan Zhang, Liangming Pan

entry.summary: Comprehensive survey on mechanistic understanding of Large Reasoning Models (LRMs), organizing findings into training dynamics, reasoning mechanisms, and unintended behaviors. Aims to bridge black-box performance and mechanistic transparency.

entry.title: Hallucination Begins Where Saliency Drops

author.name: Xiaofeng Zhang, Yuanchao Zhu, Chaochen Gu, Xiaosong Yuan, Qiyan Zhao, Jiawei Cao, Feilong Tang, Sinan Fan, Yaomin Shen, Chen Shen, Hao Tang

entry.summary: Introduces LVLMs-Saliency, a gradient-aware framework for detecting hallucinations in large vision-language models by analyzing when visual grounding strength (saliency) drops, revealing that low saliency precedes hallucination.

entry.title: REASON: Accelerating Probabilistic Logical Reasoning for Scalable Neuro-Symbolic Intelligence

author.name: Zishen Wan, Che-Kai Liu, Jiayi Qian, Hanchen Yang, Arijit Raychowdhury, Tushar Krishna

entry.summary: Presents REASON, an integrated acceleration framework for probabilistic logical reasoning in neuro-symbolic AI, addressing inefficiencies characterized by irregular control flow and poor hardware utilization.

entry.title: VoxPrivacy: A Benchmark for Evaluating Interactional Privacy of Speech Language Models

author.name: Yuxiang Wang, Hongyu Liu, Dekun Chen, Xueyao Zhang, Zhizheng Wu

entry.summary: Introduces VoxPrivacy benchmark for evaluating Speech Language Model interactional privacy - the ability to manage information flow appropriately between different users in shared environments.

entry.title: Rewarding Intellectual Humility Learning When Not To Answer In Large Language Models

author.name: Abha Jha, Akanksha Mahajan, Ashwath Vaithinathan Aravindan, Praveen Saravanan, Sai Sailaja Policharla, Sonal Chaturbhuj Gehlot

entry.summary: Investigates RLVR for teaching LLMs abstention alongside correctness, finding moderate abstention rewards improve calibration without excessive refusal on medical and math benchmarks.

entry.title: Interpreting Emergent Extreme Events in Multi-Agent Systems

author.name: Ling Tang, Jilin Mei, Dongrui Liu, Chen Qian, Dawei Cheng, Jing Shao, Xia Hu

entry.summary: Proposes framework for explaining emergent extreme events in LLM-powered multi-agent systems using adapted Shapley values to attribute events to agent actions across time steps.

entry.title: DeRaDiff: Denoising Time Realignment of Diffusion Models

author.name: Ratnavibusena Don Shahain Manujith, Yang Zhang, Teoh Tze Tzun, Kenji Kawaguchi

entry.summary: Proposes DeRaDiff for aligning diffusion models with human preferences, addressing the challenge of choosing regularization strength by realigning denoising timesteps to avoid reward hacking.

entry.title: Window-Diffusion: Accelerating Diffusion Language Model Inference with Windowed Token Pruning and Caching

author.name: Fengrui Zuo, Zhiwei Ke, Yiming Liu, Wenqi Lou, Chao Wang, Xvehai Zhou

entry.summary: Proposes Window-Diffusion for accelerating diffusion language model inference through windowed token pruning and caching, exploiting structural locality where decoding is driven by prefix-localized active tokens.

entry.title: Is Pure Exploitation Sufficient in Exogenous MDPs with Linear Function Approximation?

author.name: Hao Liang, Jiayu Cheng, Sean R. Sinclair, Yali Du

entry.summary: Proves exploration is unnecessary in Exogenous MDPs with linear function approximation, proposing Pure Exploitation Learning with first general finite-time regret guarantees without explicit exploration.

entry.title: OS-Marathon: Benchmarking Computer-Use Agents on Long-Horizon Repetitive Tasks

author.name: Jing Wu, Daphne Barretto, Yiye Chen, Nicholas Gyd\'e, Yanan Jian, Yuhang He, Vibhav Vineet

entry.summary: Introduces OS-Marathon, a benchmark of 242 long-horizon repetitive tasks across 2 domains for evaluating computer-use agents on workflows like expense report processing, including cost-effective demonstration construction.

entry.title: OmegaUse: Building a General-Purpose GUI Agent for Autonomous Task Execution

author.name: Le Zhang, Yixiong Xiao, Xinjiang Lu, Jingjia Cao, Yusai Zhao, Jingbo Zhou, Lang An, Zikan Feng, Wanxiang Sha, Yu Shi, Congxi Xiao, Jian Xiong, Yankai Zhang, Hua Wu, Haifeng Wang

entry.summary: Presents OmegaUse, a general-purpose GUI agent for autonomous task execution on mobile and desktop platforms, introducing a novel data-construction pipeline and decoupled training paradigm.

entry.title: Analysis of LLM Vulnerability to GPU Soft Errors: An Instruction-Level Fault Injection Study

author.name: Duo Chai, Zizhen Liu, Shuhuai Wang, Songwei Pei, Cheng Liu, Huawei Li, Shangguang Wang

entry.summary: First systematic instruction-level fault injection study analyzing LLM vulnerability to GPU soft errors, examining how soft errors affect modern large-scale language models differently from conventional networks.

entry.title: What's the plan? Metrics for implicit planning in LLMs and their application to rhyme generation and question answering

author.name: Jim Maar, Denis Paperno, Callum Stuart McDougall, Neel Nanda

entry.summary: Proposes simple metrics for assessing implicit planning in LLMs, demonstrating that rhymes and answers can be manipulated by steering intermediate generations, providing evidence of look-ahead planning.

entry.title: Scaling Next-Brain-Token Prediction for MEG

author.name: Richard Csaky

entry.summary: Presents large autoregressive model for source-space MEG predicting next brain tokens across 500+ hours of MEG data. Uses modified SEANet vector quantizer and Qwen2.5-VL backbone for generating minutes of MEG.

entry.title: Spark: Strategic Policy-Aware Exploration via Dynamic Branching for Long-Horizon Agentic Learning

author.name: Jinyang Wu, Shuo Yang, Changpeng Yang, Yuhao Shen, Shuai Zhang, Zhengqi Wen, Jianhua Tao

entry.summary: Introduces Spark framework for strategic exploration in long-horizon LLM agent tasks, selectively branching at critical decision states rather than indiscriminate compute allocation.

entry.title: A Foundation Model for Virtual Sensors

author.name: Leon G\"otz, Lars Frederik Peiss, Erik Sauer, Andreas Udo Sass, Thorsten Bagdonat, Stephan G\"unnemann, Leo Schwinn

entry.summary: Introduces first foundation model for virtual sensors that simultaneously predicts diverse virtual sensors exploiting task synergies while maintaining computational efficiency.

entry.title: Linear representations in language models can change dramatically over a conversation

author.name: Andrew Kyle Lampinen, Yuxuan Li, Eghbal Hosseini, Sangnie Bhardwaj, Murray Shanahan

entry.summary: Demonstrates that linear representations in language models can change dramatically over conversations - information represented as factual early can become non-factual later. From Google DeepMind authors including Andrew Lampinen.

entry.title: DeepSeek-OCR 2: Visual Causal Flow

author.name: Haoran Wei, Yaofeng Sun, Yukun Li

entry.summary: Introduces DeepSeek-OCR 2 with DeepEncoder V2, enabling dynamic visual token reordering based on image semantics rather than fixed raster-scan order, mimicking human visual perception with causal reasoning.

entry.title: Normative Equivalence in human-AI Cooperation: Behaviour, Not Identity, Drives Cooperation in Mixed-Agent Groups

author.name: Nico Mutzner, Taha Yasseri, Heiko Rauhut

entry.summary: Empirical study using a repeated Public Goods Game showing that AI agent behavior, not identity disclosure, drives cooperation in mixed human-AI groups. Finds behavior equivalence principle in cooperative norm emergence.

entry.title: On the Effectiveness of LLM-Specific Fine-Tuning for Detecting AI-Generated Text

author.name: Micha{\l} Gromadzki, Anna Wr\'oblewska, Agnieszka Kaliska

entry.summary: Comprehensive study of AI-generated text detection using 1B-token human corpus and 1.9B-token AI corpus across multiple LLMs, proposing novel training paradigms for detection models.

entry.title: GNN Explanations that do not Explain and How to find Them

author.name: Steve Azzolin, Stefano Teso, Bruno Lepri, Andrea Passerini, Sagar Malhotra

entry.summary: Identifies critical failure modes of Self-explainable GNNs where explanations can be completely unrelated to how models infer labels. Shows faithfulness metrics can fail to detect these degeneracies.

entry.title: Positive-Unlabeled Reinforcement Learning Distillation for On-Premise Small Models

author.name: Zhiqiang Kou, Junyang Chen, Xin-Qiang Cai, Xiaobo Xia, Ming-Kun Xie, Dong-Dong Wu, Biao Liu, Yuheng Jia, Xin Geng, Masashi Sugiyama, Tat-Seng Chua

entry.summary: Proposes positive-unlabeled RL distillation for on-premise small model deployment, distilling teacher's preference-optimization capabilities without human-labeled preferences or reward model.

entry.title: Should I Have Expressed a Different Intent? Counterfactual Generation for LLM-Based Autonomous Control

author.name: Amirmohammad Farzaneh, Salvatore D'Oro, Osvaldo Simeone

entry.summary: Introduces a framework for counterfactual reasoning in LLM-driven control scenarios, modeling user-agent-environment interactions as structural causal models with conformal guarantees on counterfactual outcomes.

entry.title: Mem2ActBench: A Benchmark for Evaluating Long-Term Memory Utilization in Task-Oriented Autonomous Agents

author.name: Yiting Shen, Kun Li, Wei Zhou, Songlin Hu

entry.summary: Introduces Mem2ActBench for evaluating whether agents proactively leverage long-term memory to execute tool-based actions, addressing gap where existing benchmarks only test passive retrieval.

entry.title: LLaTTE: Scaling Laws for Multi-Stage Sequence Modeling in Large-Scale Ads Recommendation

author.name: Lee Xiong, Zhirong Chen, Rahul Mayuranath, Shangran Qiu, Arda Ozdemir, Lu Li, Yang Hu, Dave Li, Jingtao Ren, Howard Cheng, Fabian Souto Herrera, Ahmed Agiza, Baruch Epshtein, Anuj Aggarwal, Julia Ulziisaikhan, Chao Wang, Dinesh Ramasamy, Parshva Doshi, Sri Reddy, Arnold Overwijk

entry.summary: Presents LLaTTE scaling laws for multi-stage sequence modeling in ads recommendation, demonstrating power-law scaling and finding that semantic features are prerequisite for scaling benefits.

entry.title: On the Impact of AGENTS.md Files on the Efficiency of AI Coding Agents

author.name: Jai Lal Lulla, Seyedmoein Mohsenimofidi, Matthias Galster, Jie M. Zhang, Sebastian Baltes, Christoph Treude

entry.summary: Studies the impact of AGENTS.md configuration files on AI coding agents' efficiency. Finds AGENTS.md reduces median runtime by 28.64% and output token consumption by 16.5% across 124 pull requests.

entry.title: In-Context Reinforcement Learning From Suboptimal Historical Data

author.name: Juncheng Dong, Moyang Guo, Ethan X. Fang, Zhuoran Yang, Vahid Tarokh

entry.summary: Proposes Decision Importance Transformer for in-context RL from suboptimal offline data. Addresses the limitation that standard autoregressive training becomes imitation learning when trajectories are suboptimal.

entry.title: Improving Diffusion Language Model Decoding through Joint Search in Generation Order and Token Space

author.name: Yangyi Shen, Tianjian Feng, Jiaqi Han, Wen Wang, Tianlang Chen, Chunhua Shen, Jure Leskovec, Stefano Ermon

entry.summary: Introduces Order-Token Search for diffusion language models, jointly searching over generation order and token values. Achieves consistent improvements on reasoning and coding benchmarks (3-8% gains) by better exploring the trajectory space.

entry.title: Counterfactual Cultural Cues Reduce Medical QA Accuracy in LLMs: Identifier vs Context Effects

author.name: Amirhossein Haji Mohammad Rezaei, Zahra Shakeri

entry.summary: Shows that counterfactual cultural cues significantly reduce medical QA accuracy in LLMs including GPT-5.2, even when clinically correct answers should remain invariant. Tests identifier tokens, contextual cues, and their combinations.

entry.title: AgentLongBench: A Controllable Long Benchmark For Long-Contexts Agents via Environment Rollouts

author.name: Shicheng Fang, Yuxin Wang, XiaoRan Liu, Jiahao Lu, Chuanyuan Tan, Xinchi Chen, Yining Zheng. Xuanjing Huang, Xipeng Qiu

entry.summary: Introduces AgentLongBench for evaluating agents through simulated environment rollouts using lateral thinking puzzles. Exposes critical weakness: models adept at static retrieval fail at dynamic long-context interaction (32K-4M tokens).

entry.title: When Flores Bloomz Wrong: Cross-Direction Contamination in Machine Translation Evaluation

author.name: David Tan, Pinzhen Chen, Josef van Genabith, Koel Dutta Chowdhury

entry.summary: Discovers that machine translation benchmark contamination can be cross-directional - training on one translation direction artificially boosts performance in unseen directions due to target-side memorization. This reveals a previously unknown contamination mechanism in multilingual LLMs.

entry.title: CtrlCoT: Dual-Granularity Chain-of-Thought Compression for Controllable Reasoning

author.name: Zhenxuan Fan, Jie Cao, Yang Dai, Zheqi Lv, Wenqiao Zhang, Zhongle Xie, Peng LU, Beng Chin Ooi

entry.summary: Proposes CtrlCoT, a dual-granularity Chain-of-Thought compression framework that harmonizes semantic abstraction and token-level pruning through hierarchical reasoning abstraction and logic-preserving distillation.

entry.title: Investigating the Development of Task-Oriented Communication in Vision-Language Models

author.name: Boaz Carmeli, Orr Paradise, Shafi Goldwasser, Yonatan Belinkov, Ron Meir

entry.summary: Investigates whether VLM-based agents develop task-oriented communication protocols with efficiency (concise information conveyance) and covertness (difficult to interpret externally) properties.

entry.title: Dynamics of Human-AI Collective Knowledge on the Web: A Scalable Model and Insights for Sustainable Growth

author.name: Buddhika Nettasinghe, Kang Zhao

entry.summary: Proposes dynamical model of human-AI collective knowledge co-evolution on the web, capturing feedback loops between archive quality, model skill, and human skill with implications for sustainable growth.

entry.title: Beyond GEMM-Centric NPUs: Enabling Efficient Diffusion LLM Sampling

author.name: Binglei Lou, Haoran Wu, Yao Lai, Jiayi Nie, Can Xiao, Xuan Guo, Rika Antonova, Robert Mullins, Aaron Zhao

entry.summary: Identifies that sampling in diffusion LLMs can account for 70% of inference latency. Proposes NPU architectural optimizations specifically for dLLM sampling with critical instruction set design.

entry.title: HE-SNR: Uncovering Latent Logic via Entropy for Guiding Mid-Training on SWE-BENCH

author.name: Yueyang Wang, Jiawei Fu, Baolong Bi, Xili Wang, Xiaoqing Liu

entry.summary: Proposes HE-SNR entropy-based metric for guiding mid-training on SWE-bench, arguing standard perplexity is compromised by 'Long-Context Tax'. Introduces Entropy Compression Hypothesis for intelligence measurement.

entry.title: Deep Neural Networks as Iterated Function Systems and a Generalization Bound

author.name: Jonathan Vacher (MAP5 - UMR 8145)

entry.summary: Shows deep architectures can be viewed as stochastic Iterated Function Systems, leveraging IFS theory for unified framework addressing stability and generalization in both discriminative and generative settings.

entry.title: Dissecting Multimodal In-Context Learning: Modality Asymmetries and Circuit Dynamics in modern Transformers

author.name: Yiran Huang, Karsten Roth, Quentin Bouniot, Wenjia Xu, Zeynep Akata

entry.summary: Studies how transformers learn to associate information across modalities through controlled experiments on synthetic tasks. Reveals fundamental learning asymmetry: text dominates during pretraining and retrieval from images relies on text representations.

entry.title: Everything in Its Place: Benchmarking Spatial Intelligence of Text-to-Image Models

author.name: Zengbin Wang, Xuecai Hu, Yong Wang, Feng Xiong, Man Zhang, Xiangxiang Chu

entry.summary: Introduces SpatialGenEval, a benchmark with 1,230 information-dense prompts across 25 real-world scenes to systematically evaluate spatial intelligence in text-to-image models, covering position, layout, occlusion, and more.

entry.title: AMA: Adaptive Memory via Multi-Agent Collaboration

author.name: Weiquan Huang, Zixuan Wang, Hehai Lin, Sudong Wang, Bo Xu, Qian Li, Beier Zhu, Linyi Yang, Chengwei Qin

entry.summary: Proposes Adaptive Memory via Multi-Agent collaboration to address limitations in LLM memory systems, moving beyond rigid retrieval granularity and accumulation-heavy maintenance to task-adaptive memory management.

entry.title: Perturbation-Induced Linearization: Constructing Unlearnable Data with Solely Linear Classifiers

author.name: Jinlin Liu, Wei Chen, Xiaojin Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes Perturbation-Induced Linearization for generating unlearnable examples using only linear surrogate models, achieving comparable performance to deep-network-based methods with dramatically reduced computation.

entry.title: Demonstration-Free Robotic Control via LLM Agents

author.name: Brian Y. Tsui, Alan Y. Fang, Tiffany J. Hwu

entry.summary: Introduces FAEA, applying general-purpose LLM agent frameworks (originally for software engineering) directly to embodied manipulation without modification or demonstrations. Enables reasoning through manipulation strategies.

entry.title: Domain Expansion: A Latent Space Construction Framework for Multi-Task Learning

author.name: Chi-Yao Huang, Khoa Vo, Aayush Atul Verma, Duo Lu, Yezhou Yang

entry.summary: Introduces Domain Expansion framework using orthogonal pooling to construct latent spaces where each objective occupies mutually orthogonal subspaces, preventing gradient conflicts in multi-task learning.

entry.title: Structurally Human, Semantically Biased: Detecting LLM-Generated References with Embeddings and GNNs

author.name: Melika Mobini, Vincent Holst, Floriano Tori, Andres Algaba, Vincent Ginis

entry.summary: Builds paired citation graphs comparing human vs GPT-4o-generated bibliographies for 10,000 papers. Shows structure alone doesn't distinguish GPT from human, but embeddings achieve 96% accuracy with GNNs.

entry.title: UnlearnShield: Shielding Forgotten Privacy against Unlearning Inversion

author.name: Lulu Xue, Shengshan Hu, Wei Lu, Ziqi Zhou, Yufei Song, Jianhong Cheng, Minghui Li, Yanjun Zhang, Leo Yu Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces UnlearnShield, the first defense against unlearning inversion attacks that reconstruct data intended to be erased, using directional perturbations with constraint module to preserve accuracy and forgetting efficacy.

entry.title: Endogenous Reprompting: Self-Evolving Cognitive Alignment for Unified Multimodal Models

author.name: Zhenchen Tang, Songlin Yang, Zichuan Wang, Bo Peng, Yang Li, Beibei Dong, Jing Dong

entry.summary: Proposes Endogenous Reprompting to bridge the understanding-generation gap in Unified Multimodal Models by generating self-aligned descriptors during generation. SEER framework achieves this with only 300 samples.

entry.title: OPT-Engine: Benchmarking the Limits of LLMs in Optimization Modeling via Complexity Scaling

author.name: Yitian Chen, Cheng Cheng, Yinan Sun, Zi Ling, Dongdong Ge

entry.summary: Introduces OPT-ENGINE, an extensible benchmark for evaluating LLMs on optimization modeling with controllable difficulty levels across 10 canonical LP and MIP tasks.

entry.title: Taming Toxic Talk: Using chatbots to intervene with users posting toxic comments

author.name: Jeremy Foote, Deepak Kumar, Bedadyuti Jha, Ryan Funkhouser, Loizos Bitsikokos, Hitesh Goel, Hsuen-Chi Chiu

entry.summary: Large-scale field experiment using generative AI chatbots to intervene with users posting toxic comments on Reddit, exploring rehabilitative rather than punitive approaches to online toxicity.

entry.title: Order-Optimal Sample Complexity of Rectified Flows

author.name: Hari Krishna Sahoo, Mudit Gaur, Vaneet Aggarwal

entry.summary: Proves that rectified flow models achieve order-optimal sample complexity of O(ε^-2), improving upon the previous O(ε^-4) bound for flow matching models and matching optimal rates for mean estimation.

entry.title: Loss Landscape Geometry and the Learning of Symmetries: Or, What Influence Functions Reveal About Robust Generalization

author.name: James Amarel, Robyn Miller, Nicolas Hengartner, Benjamin Migliori, Emily Casleton, Alexei Skurikhin, Earl Lawrence, Gerd J. Kunde

entry.summary: Studies how neural network emulators of PDEs learn physical symmetries via influence-based diagnostics measuring gradient coherence across group orbits. Shows orbit-wise gradient coherence enables generalization over symmetry transformations.

entry.title: CHIME: Chiplet-based Heterogeneous Near-Memory Acceleration for Edge Multimodal LLM Inference

author.name: Yanru Chen, Runyang Tian, Yue Pan, Zheyu Li, Weihong Xu, Tajana Rosing

entry.summary: Proposes CHIME, chiplet-based heterogeneous near-memory acceleration for edge MLLM inference using integrated M3D DRAM and RRAM, addressing KV cache data movement overheads.

entry.title: Less is More: Benchmarking LLM Based Recommendation Agents

author.name: Kargi Chauhan, Mahalakshmi Venkateswarlu

entry.summary: Benchmarks LLM recommendation agents across context lengths (5-50 items) and finds no significant quality improvement with longer histories. Shows 88% cost reduction possible by using shorter contexts without performance loss.

entry.title: Trajectory2Task: Training Robust Tool-Calling Agents with Synthesized Yet Verifiable Data for Complex User Intents

author.name: Ziyi Wang, Yuxuan Lu, Yimeng Zhang, Jing Huang, Jiri Gesi, Xianfeng Tang, Chen Luo, Yisi Sang, Hanqing Lu, Manling Li, Dakuo Wang

entry.summary: Presents Trajectory2Task, a verifiable data generation pipeline for training tool-calling agents on complex user scenarios including ambiguous, changing, and infeasible intents. Addresses gap between idealized benchmarks and real-world use.

entry.title: Artifact-Aware Evaluation for High-Quality Video Generation

author.name: Chen Zhu, Jiashu Zhu, Yanxun Li, Meiqi Wu, Bingze Song, Chubin Chen, Jiahong Wu, Xiangxiang Chu, Yangang Wang

entry.summary: Introduces GenVID, an 80k video dataset with artifact annotations across 10 categories (Appearance, Motion, Camera) for evaluating generated video quality, enabling detailed localization and categorization of generative failures.

entry.title: One Step Is Enough: Dispersive MeanFlow Policy Optimization

author.name: Guowei Zou, Haitao Wang, Hejun Wu, Yukun Qian, Yuhang Wang, Weibing Li

entry.summary: Proposes DMPO (Dispersive MeanFlow Policy Optimization), enabling true one-step action generation through MeanFlow inference, dispersive regularization, and RL fine-tuning for real-time robotic control.

entry.title: ECG-Agent: On-Device Tool-Calling Agent for ECG Multi-Turn Dialogue

author.name: Hyunseung Chung, Jungwoo Oh, Daeun Kyung, Jiho Kim, Yeonsu Kwon, Min-Gyu Kim, Edward Choi

entry.summary: Introduces ECG-Agent, the first LLM-based tool-calling agent for multi-turn ECG dialogue, along with ECG-MTD dataset. Develops on-device capable models addressing gaps in conversational ability and precise ECG measurement understanding.

entry.title: MemCtrl: Using MLLMs as Active Memory Controllers on Embodied Agents

author.name: Vishnu Sashank Dorbala, Dinesh Manocha

entry.summary: Proposes MemCtrl, using MLLMs as active memory controllers for embodied agents with a trainable memory head that gates which observations to retain, update, or discard during exploration.

entry.title: Quantifying non deterministic drift in large language models

author.name: Claire Nicholson

entry.summary: Quantifies non-deterministic output variability in LLMs under fixed parameters, testing gpt-4o-mini and llama3.1-8b across prompt categories to establish baseline behavioral drift metrics.

entry.title: Audio Deepfake Detection in the Age of Advanced Text-to-Speech models

author.name: Robin Singh, Aditya Yogesh Nair, Fabio Palumbo, Florian Barbaro, Anna Dyka, Lohith Rachakonda

entry.summary: Evaluates audio deepfake detection against three state-of-the-art TTS models (Dia2, Maya1, MeloTTS) using 12,000 synthetic samples. Finds significant detector variability across different TTS architectures.

entry.title: FAIRT2V: Training-Free Debiasing for Text-to-Video Diffusion Models

author.name: Haonan Zhong, Wei Song, Tingxu Han, Maurice Pagnucco, Jingling Xue, Yang Song

entry.summary: Presents FairT2V, a training-free debiasing framework for text-to-video generation that neutralizes encoder-induced gender bias via anchor-based spherical geodesic transformations.

entry.title: Distributional value gradients for stochastic environments

author.name: Baptiste Debes, Tinne Tuytelaars

entry.summary: Extends distributional RL to model distributions over both value functions and their gradients for stochastic environments. Uses conditional VAE for one-step world model of reward and transition distributions.

entry.title: DIVERSE: Disagreement-Inducing Vector Evolution for Rashomon Set Exploration

author.name: Gilles Eerlings, Brent Zoomers, Jori Liesenborgs, Gustavo Rovelo Ruiz, Kris Luyten

entry.summary: Proposes DIVERSE framework for exploring Rashomon sets of DNNs using FiLM layers and CMA-ES to generate functionally distinct models matching reference accuracy without retraining.

entry.title: Active Learning for Decision Trees with Provable Guarantees

author.name: Arshia Soltani Moakhar, Tanapoom Laoaron, Faraz Ghahremani, Kiarash Banihashem, MohammadTaghi Hajiaghayi

entry.summary: Provides first analysis of disagreement coefficient for decision trees under assumptions of distinct features per path and grid-like data structure. Shows assumptions necessary for polylogarithmic label complexity.

entry.title: StreamFusion: Scalable Sequence Parallelism for Distributed Inference of Diffusion Transformers on GPUs

author.name: Jiacheng Yang, Jun Wu, Yaoyao Ding, Zhiying Xu, Yida Wang, Gennady Pekhimenko

entry.summary: Introduces StreamFusion, optimized sequence parallelism for distributed inference of Diffusion Transformers addressing suboptimal communication patterns, latency bottlenecks, and GPU synchronization overheads.

entry.title: Tactile-Force Alignment in Vision-Language-Action Models for Force-aware Manipulation

author.name: Yuzhe Huang, Pei Lin, Wanlin Li, Daohan Li, Jiajun Li, Jiaming Jiang, Chenxi Xiao, Ziyuan Jiao

entry.summary: Introduces TaF-VLA, a framework shifting from tactile-vision to tactile-force alignment in VLA models, explicitly grounding tactile observations with interaction forces for contact-rich manipulation.

entry.title: PathWise: Planning through World Model for Automated Heuristic Design via Self-Evolving LLMs

author.name: Oguzhan Gungordu, Siheng Xiong, Faramarz Fekri

entry.summary: Proposes PathWise, a multi-agent reasoning framework for automated heuristic design that formulates heuristic generation as sequential decision-making over an entailment graph serving as stateful memory.

entry.title: Modeling Next-Token Prediction as Left-Nested Intuitionistic Implication

author.name: Paul Tarau

entry.summary: Introduces Arrow Language Model encoding prefixes as left-nested implication chains based on intuitionistic logic, where next-token prediction corresponds to modus ponens under Curry-Howard correspondence.

entry.title: SuperInfer: SLO-Aware Rotary Scheduling and Memory Management for LLM Inference on Superchips

author.name: Jiahuan Yu, Mingtao Hu, Zichao Lin, Minjia Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces SuperInfer, an LLM inference system for NVIDIA Superchips (GH200) with NVLink-C2C. Features RotaSched, a proactive SLO-aware rotary scheduling approach for handling head-of-line blocking.

entry.title: Open-Vocabulary Functional 3D Human-Scene Interaction Generation

author.name: Jie Liu, Yu Sun, Alpar Cseke, Yao Feng, Nicolas Heron, Michael J. Black, Yan Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes FunHSI, a training-free framework for generating functionally correct human-scene interactions from open-vocabulary task prompts by explicitly reasoning about object functionality and human-scene contact.

entry.title: Memory Retrieval in Transformers: Insights from The Encoding Specificity Principle

author.name: Viet Hung Dinh, Ming Ding, Youyang Qu, Kanchana Thilakarathna

entry.summary: Investigates transformer memory mechanisms through psychological lens, viewing queries as retrieval context, keys as memory trace indices, and attention as cue-based retrieval similar to human memory.

entry.title: Unsupervised Anomaly Detection in Multi-Agent Trajectory Prediction via Transformer-Based Models

author.name: Qing Lyu, Zhe Fu, Alexandre Bayen

entry.summary: Proposes unsupervised anomaly detection framework for autonomous driving using multi-agent transformer measuring prediction residual deviations. Introduces dual evaluation for detection stability and physical alignment.

entry.title: DenseGRPO: From Sparse to Dense Reward for Flow Matching Model Alignment

author.name: Haoyou Deng, Keyu Yan, Chaojie Mao, Xiang Wang, Yu Liu, Changxin Gao, Nong Sang

entry.summary: Proposes DenseGRPO for text-to-image generation alignment, addressing the sparse reward problem in GRPO by predicting step-wise reward gains as dense rewards for each denoising step, improving fine-grained credit assignment.

entry.title: Shallow-{\pi}: Knowledge Distillation for Flow-based VLAs

author.name: Boseong Jeon, Yunho Choi, Taehan Kim

entry.summary: Proposes Shallow-π, a knowledge distillation framework that aggressively reduces VLA transformer depth from 18 to 6 layers for both VLM backbone and flow-based action head, achieving 2x faster inference.

entry.title: Teaching LLMs to Ask: Self-Querying Category-Theoretic Planning for Under-Specified Reasoning

author.name: Shuhui Qu

entry.summary: Introduces Self-Querying Bidirectional Categorical Planning to handle LLM inference under partial observability by explicitly tracking precondition status and resolving unknowns through targeted queries or bridging hypotheses.

entry.title: LTS-VoiceAgent: A Listen-Think-Speak Framework for Efficient Streaming Voice Interaction via Semantic Triggering and Incremental Reasoning

author.name: Wenhao Zou, Yuwei Miao, Zhanyu Ma, Jun Xu, Jiuchong Gao, Jinghua Hao, Renqing He, Jingwen Xu

entry.summary: Proposes LTS-VoiceAgent, a Listen-Think-Speak framework for streaming voice interaction using semantic triggering and incremental reasoning to reduce latency over cascaded pipelines.

entry.title: How Much Progress Has There Been in NVIDIA Datacenter GPUs?

author.name: Emanuele Del Sozzo, Martin Fleming, Kenneth Flamm, Neil Thompson

entry.summary: Analyzes technical progress in NVIDIA datacenter GPUs, examining performance improvements over time with implications for AI hardware development and export controls.

entry.title: Meta-Cognitive Reinforcement Learning with Self-Doubt and Recovery

author.name: Zhipeng Zhang, Wenting Ma, Kai Li, Meng Guo, Lei Yang, Wei Yu, Hongji Cui, Yichen Zhang, Mo Zhang, Jinzhe Lin, Zhenjie Yao

entry.summary: Introduces a meta-cognitive RL framework enabling agents to assess and regulate their own learning reliability using Value Prediction Error Stability (VPES). Implements fail-safe regulation and gradual trust recovery mechanisms.

entry.title: Inequality in Congestion Games with Learning Agents

author.name: Dimitris Michailidis, Sennay Ghebreab, Fernando P. Santos

entry.summary: Studies inequality in congestion games where RL agents with different learning rates represent unequal access to resources. Introduces Price of Learning metric and analyzes Braess's paradox with two-source nodes.

entry.title: HESTIA: A Hessian-Guided Differentiable Quantization-Aware Training Framework for Extremely Low-Bit LLMs

author.name: Guoan Wang, Feiyu Wang, Zongwei Lv, Yikun Zong, Tong Yang

entry.summary: Proposes HESTIA, a Hessian-guided QAT framework for extremely low-bit LLMs using temperature-controlled softmax relaxation instead of hard rounding with STE to maintain gradient flow during early training.

entry.title: Emergent Specialization in Learner Populations: Competition as the Source of Diversity

author.name: Yuhao Li

entry.summary: Demonstrates that competition alone induces emergent specialization in learner populations without explicit diversity incentives, validated across six real-world domains. Introduces NichePopulation algorithm achieving mean Specialization Index of 0.75.

entry.title: Minimum-Cost Network Flow with Dual Predictions

author.name: Zhiyang Chen, Hailong Yao, Xia Yin

entry.summary: Proposes first minimum-cost network flow algorithm augmented with dual predictions, providing time complexity bounds that are both consistent and robust with PAC-learning guarantees.

entry.title: Less is More: Clustered Cross-Covariance Control for Offline RL

author.name: Nan Qiao, Sheng Yue, Shuning Wang, Yongheng Deng, Ju Ren

entry.summary: Shows TD cross-covariance causes harmful effects in offline RL, proposing C4 using partitioned buffer sampling to restrict updates to localized replay partitions, attenuating irregular covariance effects.

entry.title: Global Plane Waves From Local Gaussians: Periodic Charge Densities in a Blink

author.name: Jonas Elsborg, Felix {\AE}rtebjerg, Luca Thiede, Al\'an Aspuru-Guzik, Tejs Vegge, Arghya Bhowmik

entry.summary: Introduces ELECTRAFI for predicting periodic charge densities using anisotropic Gaussians with closed-form Fourier transforms, achieving up to 633x speedup over competing methods.

entry.title: Minimax Rates for Hyperbolic Hierarchical Learning

author.name: Divit Rawal, Sriram Vishwanath

entry.summary: Proves an exponential separation in sample complexity between Euclidean and hyperbolic representations for hierarchical data learning. Shows hyperbolic space enables O(1)-Lipschitz functions while Euclidean requires exponentially scaling Lipschitz constants.

entry.title: Lowest Span Confidence: A Zero-Shot Metric for Efficient and Black-Box Hallucination Detection in LLMs

author.name: Yitong Qiao, Licheng Pan, Yu Mi, Lei Liu, Yue Shen, Fei Sun, Zhixuan Chu

entry.summary: Introduces Lowest Span Confidence (LSC), a zero-shot hallucination detection metric requiring only single forward pass with output probabilities. Evaluates joint likelihood of semantically meaningful spans rather than individual tokens.

entry.title: AgentIF-OneDay: A Task-level Instruction-Following Benchmark for General AI Agents in Daily Scenarios

author.name: Kaiyuan Chen, Qimin Wu, Taiyu Hou, Tianhao Tang, Xueyu Hu, Yuchen Hou, Bikun Li, Chengming Qian, Guoyin Wang, Haolin Chen, Haotong Tian, Haoye Zhang, Haoyu Bian, Hongbing Pan, Hongkang Zhang, Hongyi Zhou, Jiaqi Cai, Jiewu Rao, Jiyuan Ren, Keduan Huang, Lucia Zhu Huang, Mingyu Yuan, Naixu Guo, Qicheng Tang, Qinyan Zhang, Shuai Chen, Siheng Chen, Ting Ting Li, Xiaoxing Guo, Yaocheng Zuo, Yaoqi Guo, Yinan Wang, Yinzhou Yu, Yize Wang, Yuan Jiang, Yuan Tian, Yuanshuo Zhang, Yuxuan Liu, Yvette Yan Zeng, Zenyu Shan, Zihan Yin, Xiaobo Hu, Yang Liu, Yixin Ren, Yuan Gong

entry.summary: Introduces AgentIF-OneDay, a benchmark evaluating whether AI agents can complete diverse daily tasks for general users via natural language. Covers daily work, life, and learning activities across broad demographics.

entry.title: Sparse CLIP: Co-Optimizing Interpretability and Performance in Contrastive Learning

author.name: Chuan Qin, Constantin Venhoff, Sonia Joseph, Fanyi Xiao, Stefan Scherer

entry.summary: Introduces Sparse CLIP, training CLIP with enforced sparsity to co-optimize interpretability and performance rather than using post-hoc methods like Sparse Autoencoders. Shows sparsity can be achieved without sacrificing multimodal capabilities.

entry.title: DiffVC-RT: Towards Practical Real-Time Diffusion-based Perceptual Neural Video Compression

author.name: Wenzhuo Ma, Zhenzhong Chen

entry.summary: Proposes DiffVC-RT, the first real-time diffusion-based neural video compression framework addressing information loss, latency, and temporal consistency through efficient architecture and explicit/implicit consistency modeling.

entry.title: DABench-LLM: Standardized and In-Depth Benchmarking of Post-Moore Dataflow AI Accelerators for LLMs

author.name: Ziyu Hu, Zhiqing Zhong, Weijian Zheng, Zhijing Ye, Xuwei Tan, Xueru Zhang, Zheng Xie, Rajkumar Kettimuthu, Xiaodong Yu

entry.summary: Introduces DABench-LLM, the first benchmarking framework for evaluating LLM training workloads on dataflow-based accelerators, combining intra-chip profiling with inter-chip scalability analysis.

entry.title: Large language models accurately predict public perceptions of support for climate action worldwide

author.name: Nattavudh Powdthavee, Sandra J. Geiger

entry.summary: Preregistered experiment showing LLMs (especially Claude) can accurately predict public perceptions of climate action support worldwide, performing comparably to statistical models.

entry.title: Can Continuous-Time Diffusion Models Generate and Solve Globally Constrained Discrete Problems? A Study on Sudoku

author.name: Mariia Drozdova

entry.summary: Studies whether continuous-time diffusion models can represent distributions over discrete, globally constrained sets using Sudoku as a testbed. Finds stochastic sampling and DDPM-style approaches outperform deterministic flows.

entry.title: Regime-Adaptive Bayesian Optimization via Dirichlet Process Mixtures of Gaussian Processes

author.name: Yan Zhang, Xuefeng Liu, Sipeng Chen, Sascha Ranftl, Chong Liu, Shibo Li

entry.summary: Proposes RAMBO, using Dirichlet Process Mixtures of GPs for Bayesian optimization to automatically discover latent regimes. Uses collapsed Gibbs sampling with analytically marginalized latent functions.

entry.title: Optimal Transport Group Counterfactual Explanations

author.name: Enrique Valero-Leal, Bernd Bischl, Pedro Larra\~naga, Concha Bielza, Giuseppe Casalicchio

entry.summary: Proposes optimal transport approach for group counterfactual explanations learning explicit map from any group instance to counterfactual without re-optimization, minimizing total transport cost.

entry.title: Exploiting the Final Component of Generator Architectures for AI-Generated Image Detection

author.name: Yanzhu Liu, Xiao Liu, Yuexuan Wang, Mondal Soumik

entry.summary: Proposes detecting AI-generated images by exploiting common final architectural components shared across different generators (diffusion, autoregressive), 'contaminating' real images with these components for training.

entry.title: TouchGuide: Inference-Time Steering of Visuomotor Policies via Touch Guidance

author.name: Zhemeng Zhang, Jiahua Ma, Xincheng Yang, Xin Wen, Yuzhi Zhang, Boyan Li, Yiran Qin, Jin Liu, Can Zhao, Li Kang, Haoqin Hong, Zhenfei Yin, Philip Torr, Hao Su, Ruimao Zhang, Daolin Ma

entry.summary: Introduces TouchGuide, a cross-policy visuo-tactile fusion paradigm that guides pre-trained visuomotor policies at inference time using Contact Physical Models learned through contrastive learning on limited tactile data.

entry.title: Dialogical Reasoning Across AI Architectures: A Multi-Model Framework for Testing AI Alignment Strategies

author.name: Gray Cox

entry.summary: Introduces a multi-model dialogue framework for empirically testing AI alignment strategies, using Claude, Gemini, and GPT-4o in structured debates drawing on Peace Studies traditions.

entry.title: Bench4HLS: End-to-End Evaluation of LLMs in High-Level Synthesis Code Generation

author.name: M Zafir Sadik Khan, Kimia Azar, Hadi Kamali

entry.summary: Presents Bench4HLS for end-to-end evaluation of LLM-generated High-Level Synthesis designs with 170 manually validated case studies spanning multiple design categories.

entry.title: Do we really need Self-Attention for Streaming Automatic Speech Recognition?

author.name: Youness Dkhissi (LIUM), Valentin Vielzeuf (LIUM), Elys Allesiardo (LIUM), Anthony Larcher (LIUM)

entry.summary: Questions the suitability of self-attention for streaming ASR, arguing that computational requirements and latency issues don't align well with streaming constraints. Promotes alternative strategies.

entry.title: Self Voice Conversion as an Attack against Neural Audio Watermarking

author.name: Yigitcan \"Ozer, Wanying Ge, Zhe Zhang, Xin Wang, Junichi Yamagishi

entry.summary: Investigates self voice conversion as an attack against audio watermarking systems. Shows that converting a speaker's voice to the same identity while altering acoustic characteristics can remove watermarks while preserving content.

entry.title: BayPrAnoMeta: Bayesian Proto-MAML for Few-Shot Industrial Image Anomaly Detection

author.name: Soham Sarkar, Tanmay Sen, Sayantan Banerjee

entry.summary: Proposes BayPrAnoMeta combining Proto-MAML with Bayesian inference using Normal-Inverse-Wishart priors for few-shot industrial anomaly detection. Produces Student-t predictive distributions for uncertainty-aware scoring.

entry.title: Implicit Hypothesis Testing and Divergence Preservation in Neural Network Representations

author.name: Kadircan Aksoy, Peter Jung, Protim Bhattacharjee

entry.summary: Studies neural classifier training through binary hypothesis testing lens, showing well-generalizing networks align with Neyman-Pearson optimal decision rules via monotonic KL divergence improvements.

entry.title: Smoothing the Black-Box: Signed-Distance Supervision for Black-Box Model Copying

author.name: Rub\'en Jim\'enez, Oriol Pujol

entry.summary: Proposes distance-based black-box model copying replacing hard-label supervision with signed distances to teacher's decision boundary, converting copying into smooth regression problem.

entry.title: SemBind: Binding Diffusion Watermarks to Semantics Against Black-Box Forgery Attacks

author.name: Xin Zhang, Zijin Yang, Kejiang Chen, Linfeng Ma, Weiming Zhang, Nenghai Yu

entry.summary: Introduces SemBind, the first defense framework against black-box watermark forgery attacks on latent diffusion models. Binds watermarks to image semantics via contrastive learning to prevent unauthorized watermark embedding.

entry.title: Beyond Accuracy: A Cognitive Load Framework for Mapping the Capability Boundaries of Tool-use Agents

author.name: Qihao Wang, Yue Hu, Mingzhe Lu, Jiayue Wu, Yanbing Liu, Yuanmin Tang

entry.summary: Introduces a Cognitive Load Theory framework for evaluating tool-use agents, decomposing task complexity into Intrinsic Load (solution structure via Tool Interaction Graph) and Extraneous Load (task presentation ambiguity).

entry.title: P2S: Probabilistic Process Supervision for General-Domain Reasoning Question Answering

author.name: Wenlin Zhong, Chengyuan Liu, Yiquan Wu, Bovin Tan, Changlong Sun, Yi Wang, Xiaozhong Liu, Kun Kuang

entry.summary: Introduces P2S (Probabilistic Process Supervision), a self-supervision framework providing fine-grained process rewards for general-domain reasoning without separate reward models. Extends RLVR beyond math/code.

entry.title: Efficient Autoregressive Video Diffusion with Dummy Head

author.name: Hang Guo, Zhaoyang Jia, Jiahao Li, Bin Li, Yuanhao Cai, Jiangshan Wang, Yawei Li, Yan Lu

entry.summary: Introduces Dummy Forcing for efficient autoregressive video diffusion, finding that ~25% of attention heads focus only on current frames and proposing heterogeneous memory allocation with dynamic head programming.

entry.title: Simulating Complex Multi-Turn Tool Calling Interactions in Stateless Execution Environments

author.name: Maxwell Crouse, Ibrahim Abdelaziz, Kshitij Fadnis, Siva Sankalp Patel, Kinjal Basu, Chulaka Gunasekara, Sadhana Kumaravel, Asim Munawar, Pavan Kapanipathi

entry.summary: Addresses synthetic data generation for multi-turn tool calling in stateless execution environments where state-based validity checking is unavailable, common in enterprise settings.

entry.title: MeanCache: From Instantaneous to Average Velocity for Accelerating Flow Matching Inference

author.name: Huanlin Gao, Ping Chen, Fuyuan Shi, Ruijia Wu, Li YanTao, Qiang Hui, Yuren You, Ting Lu, Chao Tan, Shaoan Zhao, Zhaoxiang Liu, Fang Zhao, Kai Wang, Shiguo Lian

entry.summary: Presents MeanCache, a training-free caching framework for efficient Flow Matching inference using average velocity perspective via Jacobian-vector products to reduce trajectory deviations.

entry.title: Assembling the Mind's Mosaic: Towards EEG Semantic Intent Decoding

author.name: Jiahe Li, Junru Chen, Fanqi Shen, Jialan Yang, Jada Li, Zhizhang Yuan, Baowen Cheng, Meng Li, Yang Yang

entry.summary: Introduces Semantic Intent Decoding (SID) and BrainMosaic for translating neural activity to natural language through compositional semantic units. Enables BCI communication via EEG.

entry.title: Post-Training Fairness Control: A Single-Train Framework for Dynamic Fairness in Recommendation

author.name: Weixin Chen, Li Chen, Yuhan Zhao

entry.summary: Proposes Cofair, enabling post-training fairness control in recommendations via shared representation with fairness-conditioned adapters. Avoids retraining for different fairness requirements.

entry.title: Local Duality for Sparse Support Vector Machines

author.name: Penghe Zhang, Naihua Xiu, Houduo Qi

entry.summary: Develops local duality theory for sparse SVMs, proving the derived SSVM is exactly dual to 0/1-loss SVM. Establishes linear representer theorem for local solutions and connections to hinge-loss and ramp-loss SVMs.

entry.title: E2HiL: Entropy-Guided Sample Selection for Efficient Real-World Human-in-the-Loop Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Haoyuan Deng, Yuanjiang Xue, Haoyang Du, Boyang Zhou, Zhenyu Wu, Ziwei Wang

entry.summary: Proposes E2HiL for sample-efficient human-in-the-loop RL using entropy-guided sample selection to reduce required human interventions while achieving convergence.

entry.title: MARE: Multimodal Alignment and Reinforcement for Explainable Deepfake Detection via Vision-Language Models

author.name: Wenbo Xu, Wei Lu, Xiangyang Luo, Jiantao Zhou

entry.summary: Proposes MARE for explainable deepfake detection using vision-language models with RLHF to generate text-spatially aligned reasoning content, enhancing both accuracy and interpretability.

entry.title: Real-Time Robot Execution with Masked Action Chunking

author.name: Haoxuan Wang, Gengyu Zhang, Yan Yan, Yuzhang Shang, Ramana Rao Kompella, Gaowen Liu

entry.summary: Identifies intra-chunk inconsistency as critical factor in asynchronous robot inference failure, proposing masked action chunking to achieve real-time execution with improved consistency.

entry.title: NeuroAI and Beyond

author.name: Jean-Marc Fellous, Gert Cauwenberghs, Cornelia Ferm\"uller, Yulia Sandamisrkaya, Terrence Sejnowski

entry.summary: Workshop report identifying synergies between neuroscience and AI across embodiment, language, robotics, and neuromorphic engineering. Advocates for NeuroAI as a paradigm to improve AI algorithms while advancing brain understanding.

entry.title: Deep Researcher with Sequential Plan Reflection and Candidates Crossover (Deep Researcher Reflect Evolve)

author.name: Saurav Prateek

entry.summary: Introduces Deep Researcher architecture using Sequential Research Plan Refinement via Reflection and Candidates Crossover algorithm for generating detailed research reports on complex topics.

entry.title: NCSAM Noise-Compensated Sharpness-Aware Minimization for Noisy Label Learning

author.name: Jiayu Xu, Junbiao Pang

entry.summary: Proposes Noise-Compensated Sharpness-Aware Minimization showing that carefully simulated label noise enhances both generalization and robustness to noisy labels.

entry.title: Semi-Supervised Masked Autoencoders: Unlocking Vision Transformer Potential with Limited Data

author.name: Atik Faysal, Mohammad Rostami, Reihaneh Gh. Roshan, Nikhil Muralidhar, Huaxia Wang

entry.summary: Proposes SSMAE, semi-supervised framework for Vision Transformers with limited labels, using validation-driven gating that activates pseudo-labeling only after achieving reliable predictions.

entry.title: Causal-Driven Feature Evaluation for Cross-Domain Image Classification

author.name: Chen Cheng, Ang Li

entry.summary: Addresses out-of-distribution generalization by evaluating learned representations based on causal necessity and sufficiency rather than just domain invariance. Introduces a segment-level framework measuring causal effectiveness across domains.

entry.title: Towards Compact and Robust DNNs via Compression-aware Sharpness Minimization

author.name: Jialuo He, Huangxun Chen

entry.summary: Proposes C-SAM, integrating sharpness-aware minimization with pruning to maintain robustness under compression. Addresses the gap between flatness in continuous parameter space and robustness under discrete structural changes.

entry.title: CCMamba: Selective State-Space Models for Higher-Order Graph Learning on Combinatorial Complexes

author.name: Jiawen Chen, Qi Shao, Mingtong Zhou, Duxin Chen, Wenwu Yu

entry.summary: Proposes CCMamba, the first Mamba-based neural framework for learning on combinatorial complexes. Reformulates message passing as selective state-space modeling for higher-order graph learning.

entry.title: LEMON: How Well Do MLLMs Perform Temporal Multimodal Understanding on Instructional Videos?

author.name: Zhuang Yu, Lei Shen, Jing Zhao, Shiliang Sun

entry.summary: Introduces LEMON, a benchmark for temporal multimodal understanding on STEM lecture videos with 2,277 segments and 4,181 QA pairs requiring long-horizon reasoning and cross-modal integration.

entry.title: Classifier Calibration at Scale: An Empirical Study of Model-Agnostic Post-Hoc Methods

author.name: Valery Manokhin, Daniel Gr{\o}nhaug

entry.summary: Comprehensive benchmark of 21 classifiers and 5 calibration methods on tabular data, emphasizing Venn-Abers predictors and conformal approaches with distribution-free guarantees. Uses TabArena-v0.1 benchmark.

entry.title: TINNs: Time-Induced Neural Networks for Solving Time-Dependent PDEs

author.name: Chen-Yang Dai, Che-Chia Chang, Te-Sheng Lin, Ming-Chih Lai, Chieh-Hsin Lai

entry.summary: Proposes TINNs parameterizing network weights as learned functions of time for solving time-dependent PDEs, allowing effective spatial representation to evolve while maintaining shared structure.

entry.title: PiC-BNN: A 128-kbit 65 nm Processing-in-CAM-Based End-to-End Binary Neural Network Accelerator

author.name: Yuval Harary, Almog Sharoni, Esteban Garz\'on, Marco Lanuzza, Adam Teman, Leonid Yavits

entry.summary: Proposes PiC-BNN, a true end-to-end binary in-CAM BNN accelerator manufactured in 65nm, implementing all network layers (including batch norm, softmax) in binary.

entry.title: One Word is Enough: Minimal Adversarial Perturbations for Neural Text Ranking

author.name: Tanmay Karmakar, Sourav Saha, Debapriyo Majumdar, Surjyanee Halder

entry.summary: Demonstrates that neural ranking models are vulnerable to single-word adversarial attacks that can achieve up to 91% success rate by inserting semantically aligned 'query center' words. Shows minimal edits can significantly boost document rankings.

entry.title: Context-Augmented Code Generation Using Programming Knowledge Graphs

author.name: Shahd Seddik, Fahd Seddik, Iman Saberi, Fatemeh Fard, Minh Hieu Huynh, Patanamon Thongtanunam

entry.summary: Proposes Programming Knowledge Graph (PKG) for context-augmented code generation with fine-grained retrieval and re-ranking to mitigate hallucinations. Shows up to 20% pass@1 gains on HumanEval and MBPP.

entry.title: PaperAudit-Bench: Benchmarking Error Detection in Research Papers for Critical Automated Peer Review

author.name: Songjun Tu, Yiwen Ma, Jiahao Lin, Qichao Zhang, Xiangyuan Lan, Junfeng. Li, Nan Xu, Linjing Li, Dongbin Zhao

entry.summary: Introduces PaperAudit-Bench for evaluating LLM error detection in research papers, covering both within-section and cross-section reasoning errors. Pairs dataset with automated review framework integrating structured error detection.

entry.title: SoftHateBench: Evaluating Moderation Models Against Reasoning-Driven, Policy-Compliant Hostility

author.name: Xuanyu Su, Diana Inkpen, Nathalie Japkowicz

entry.summary: Introduces SoftHateBench, a benchmark for 'soft hate speech' that appears reasonable but uses framing to steer audiences toward blaming target groups. Integrates argumentation and relevance theory for generation.

entry.title: SAPO: Self-Adaptive Process Optimization Makes Small Reasoners Stronger

author.name: Kaiyuan Chen, Guangmin Zheng, Jin Wang, Xiaobing Zhou, Xuejie Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces SAPO (Self-Adaptive Process Optimization) for improving reasoning in small language models through adaptive process supervision signals. Inspired by Error-Related Negativity cognitive mechanism.

entry.title: PEARL: Plan Exploration and Adaptive Reinforcement Learning for Multihop Tool Use

author.name: Qihao Wang, Mingzhe Lu, Jiayue Wu, Yue Hu, Yanbing Liu

entry.summary: Introduces PEARL, a framework enhancing LLM tool use through offline exploration learning and online GRPO-based planner training. Provides distinct reward signals for planning vs execution.

entry.title: OSDEnhancer: Taming Real-World Space-Time Video Super-Resolution with One-Step Diffusion

author.name: Shuoyan Wei, Feng Li, Chen Zhou, Runmin Cong, Yao Zhao, Huihui Bai

entry.summary: Introduces OSDEnhancer, a one-step diffusion framework for real-world space-time video super-resolution, handling both spatial upsampling and frame interpolation with unknown degradations.

entry.title: HINT: Hierarchical Interaction Modeling for Autoregressive Multi-Human Motion Generation

author.name: Mengge Liu, Yan Di, Gu Wang, Yun Qu, Dekai Zhu, Yanyan Li, Xiangyang Ji

entry.summary: Introduces HINT, the first autoregressive framework for multi-human motion generation with hierarchical interaction modeling in diffusion, using disentangled motion representation in canonicalized latent space.

entry.title: Compression Tells Intelligence: Visual Coding, Visual Token Technology, and the Unification

author.name: Xin Jin, Jinming Liu, Yuntao Wei, Junyan Lin, Zhicheng Wang, Jianguo Huang, Xudong Yang, Yanxiao Liu, Wenjun Zeng

entry.summary: Presents a comprehensive analysis connecting compression efficiency in visual coding with visual token technology in LLMs/MLLMs, arguing that compression ability correlates with intelligence.

entry.title: Spectral Diffusion Models on the Sphere

author.name: Pierpaolo Brutti, Claudio Durastanti, Francesco Mari

entry.summary: Extends diffusion models to spherical data by working directly with spherical harmonic representations, addressing geometric and stochastic challenges absent in Euclidean settings. The framework maps spatial Brownian motion to constrained Gaussian processes in the frequency domain with modified forward/reverse SDEs.

entry.title: Structural Compositional Function Networks: Interpretable Functional Compositions for Tabular Discovery

author.name: Fang Li

entry.summary: Proposes StructuralCFN for tabular data, imposing Relation-Aware Inductive Bias via differentiable structural prior that models each feature as composition of others through Differentiable Adaptive Gating.

entry.title: LLM-AutoDP: Automatic Data Processing via LLM Agents for Model Fine-tuning

author.name: Wei Huang, Anda Cheng, Yinggui Wang, Lei Wang, Tao Wei

entry.summary: Proposes LLM-AutoDP, using LLM agents to automatically generate and optimize data processing strategies for fine-tuning without exposing raw data, addressing privacy concerns in domains like healthcare.

entry.title: ACFormer: Mitigating Non-linearity with Auto Convolutional Encoder for Time Series Forecasting

author.name: Gawon Lee, Hanbyeol Park, Minseop Kim, Dohee Kim, Hyerim Bae

entry.summary: Proposes ACFormer using convolutional layers as feature extractors that mirror channel-wise attention while being robust to non-linear fluctuations, based on systematic receptive field analysis.

entry.title: GraphAllocBench: A Flexible Benchmark for Preference-Conditioned Multi-Objective Policy Learning

author.name: Zhiheng Jiang, Yunzhe Wang, Ryan Marr, Ellen Novoseller, Benjamin T. Files, Volkan Ustun

entry.summary: Introduces GraphAllocBench, a flexible benchmark for Preference-Conditioned Policy Learning in Multi-Objective RL built on CityPlannerEnv resource allocation sandbox.

entry.title: Context Tokens are Anchors: Understanding the Repetition Curse in dMLLMs from an Information Flow Perspective

author.name: Qiyan Zhao, Xiaofeng Zhang, Shuochen Chang, Qianyu Chen, Xiaosong Yuan, Xuhang Chen, Luoqi Liu, Jiajun Zhang, Xu-Yao Zhang, Da-Han Wang

entry.summary: Analyzes the 'Repeat Curse' in diffusion-based MLLMs through information flow, finding that context tokens serve as anchors and repetition occurs when these anchors dominate information aggregation in deeper layers.

entry.title: STORM: Slot-based Task-aware Object-centric Representation for robotic Manipulation

author.name: Alexandre Chapin (LIRIS), Emmanuel Dellandr\'ea (LIRIS), Liming Chen (LIRIS)

entry.summary: Proposes STORM, a lightweight object-centric adaptation module using semantic-aware slots to augment frozen visual foundation models for robotic manipulation with multi-phase training strategy.

entry.title: Online Risk-Averse Planning in POMDPs Using Iterated CVaR Value Function

author.name: Yaacov Pariente, Vadim Indelman

entry.summary: Develops online planning algorithms for risk-sensitive decision-making under partial observability using Iterated CVaR. Extends Sparse Sampling, PFT-DPW, and POMCPOW with finite-time performance guarantees.

entry.title: FastWhisper: Adaptive Self-knowledge Distillation for Real-time Automatic Speech Recognition

author.name: Junseok Lee, Nahoon Kim, Sangyong Lee, Chang-Jae Chun

entry.summary: Proposes FastWhisper using adaptive self-knowledge distillation that dynamically reduces teacher model dependence to improve student model generalization for real-time ASR.

entry.title: Automated Benchmark Generation from Domain Guidelines Informed by Bloom's Taxonomy

author.name: Si Chen, Le Huy Khiem, Annalisa Szymanski, Ronald Metoyer, Ting Hua, Nitesh V. Chawla

entry.summary: Framework for automatically generating LLM benchmarks from expert guidelines using Bloom's Taxonomy. Converts expert practices into violation-based scenarios and auto-graded questions across cognitive levels.

entry.title: Guiding the Recommender: Information-Aware Auto-Bidding for Content Promotion

author.name: Yumou Liu, Zhenzhe Zheng, Jiang Rong, Yao Hu, Fan Wu, Guihai Chen

entry.summary: Addresses content promotion in recommendation systems, showing that promotion can harm high-quality content by forcing suboptimal audience exposure. Introduces gradient coverage metric based on Fisher Information.

entry.title: $\mathbb{R}^{2k}$ is Theoretically Large Enough for Embedding-based Top-$k$ Retrieval

author.name: Zihao Wang, Hang Yin, Lihui Liu, Hanghang Tong, Yangqiu Song, Ginny Wong, Simon See

entry.summary: Derives tight bounds on minimal embedding dimension for subset membership problems, proving 2k dimensions suffice for top-k retrieval with various similarity notions including L2, inner product, and cosine.

entry.title: MAPLE: Self-supervised Learning-Enhanced Nonlinear Dimensionality Reduction for Visual Analysis

author.name: Zeyang Huang, Takanori Fujiwara, Angelos Chatzimparmpas, Wandrille Duchemin, Andreas Kerren

entry.summary: Proposes MAPLE, enhancing UMAP with self-supervised learning using maximum manifold capacity representations (MMCRs) for better cluster separation in high-dimensional data with curved manifold structures.

entry.title: TimeCatcher: A Variational Framework for Volatility-Aware Forecasting of Non-Stationary Time Series
