author.name: Zhiyu Chen, Minhao Liu, Yanru Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes TimeCatcher variational forecasting framework with volatility-aware enhancement mechanism for non-stationary time series, detecting and amplifying significant fluctuations for web traffic monitoring.

entry.title: Efficient Token Pruning for LLaDA-V

author.name: Zhewen Wan, Tianchen Song, Chen Lin, Zhiyong Zhao, Xianpeng Lang

entry.summary: Analyzes attention patterns in LLaDA-V (diffusion-based multimodal model) finding that cross-modal information aggregation happens in middle-to-late layers, enabling efficient visual token pruning without significant performance loss.

entry.title: AnomalyVFM -- Transforming Vision Foundation Models into Zero-Shot Anomaly Detectors

author.name: Matic Fu\v{c}ka, Vitjan Zavrtanik, Danijel Sko\v{c}aj

entry.summary: Proposes AnomalyVFM, a framework to turn pretrained vision foundation models like DINOv2 into zero-shot anomaly detectors through three-stage synthetic data generation and VFM adaptation.

entry.title: ProSkill: Segment-Level Skill Assessment in Procedural Videos

author.name: Michele Mazzamuto, Daniele Di Mauro, Gianpiero Francesca, Giovanni Maria Farinella, Antonino Furnari

entry.summary: Introduces ProSkill, first benchmark for action-level skill assessment in procedural videos with absolute skill annotations enabled by novel annotation methodology, addressing limitations of pairwise/binary labels.

entry.title: GPO: Growing Policy Optimization for Legged Robot Locomotion and Whole-Body Control

author.name: Shuhao Liao, Peizhuo Li, Xinrong Yang, Linnan Chang, Zhaoxin Fan, Qing Wang, Lei Shi, Yuhong Cao, Wenjun Wu, Guillaume Sartoretti

entry.summary: Introduces GPO (Growing Policy Optimization), an RL training framework using time-varying action transformations to restrict effective action space early in training, improving exploration for legged robots.

entry.title: Fuzzy Categorical Planning: Autonomous Goal Satisfaction with Graded Semantic Constraints

author.name: Shuhui Qu

entry.summary: Proposes Fuzzy Category-theoretic Planning to handle vague predicates in natural language planning by annotating actions with graded degrees and composing plan quality via t-norms while maintaining crisp executability checks.

entry.title: From Intuition to Expertise: Rubric-Based Cognitive Calibration for Human Detection of LLM-Generated Korean Text

author.name: Shinwoo Park, Yo-Sub Han

entry.summary: Studies whether expert detection of LLM-generated Korean text can be improved through structured calibration, introducing LREAD rubric and demonstrating significant improvement through a three-phase longitudinal protocol.

entry.title: Cross-Session Decoding of Neural Spiking Data via Task-Conditioned Latent Alignment

author.name: Canyang Zhao, Bolin Peng, J. Patrick Mayo, Ce Ju, Bing Liu

entry.summary: Proposes TCLA framework for cross-session neural decoding in BCIs, using task-conditioned latent alignment to address nonstationarity when only limited data available from new sessions.

entry.title: ProFlow: Zero-Shot Physics-Consistent Sampling via Proximal Flow Guidance

author.name: Zichao Yu, Ming Li, Wenyi Zhang, Difan Zou, Weiguo Gao

entry.summary: Presents ProFlow, a framework for zero-shot physics-consistent sampling that enforces PDE constraints without retraining generative models. Uses proximal guidance to reconcile physical consistency with learned priors.

entry.title: MobileBench-OL: A Comprehensive Chinese Benchmark for Evaluating Mobile GUI Agents in Real-World Environment

author.name: Qinzhuo Wu, Zhizhuo Yang, Hanhao Li, Pengzhi Gao, Wei Liu, Jian Luan

entry.summary: Proposes MobileBench-OL, an online benchmark with 1080 tasks from 80 Chinese apps for evaluating mobile GUI agents. Measures task execution, complex reasoning, and noise robustness.

entry.title: Meeting SLOs, Slashing Hours: Automated Enterprise LLM Optimization with OptiKIT

author.name: Nicholas Santavas, Kareem Eissa, Patrycja Cieplicka, Piotr Florek, Matteo Nulli, Stefan Vasilev, Seyyed Hadi Hashemi, Antonios Gasteratos, Shahram Khadivi

entry.summary: Presents OptiKIT, a distributed framework for enterprise LLM optimization that automates model compression and tuning workflows for non-expert teams with dynamic resource allocation.

entry.title: Unsupervised Ensemble Learning Through Deep Energy-based Models

author.name: Ariel Maymon, Yanir Buznah, Uri Shaham

entry.summary: Proposes a deep energy-based method for unsupervised ensemble learning that constructs meta-learners from individual learner predictions only, capturing complex dependence structures without labeled data.

entry.title: Li-ViP3D++: Query-Gated Deformable Camera-LiDAR Fusion for End-to-End Perception and Trajectory Prediction

author.name: Matej Halinkovic, Nina Masarykova, Alexey Vinel, Marek Galinski

entry.summary: Proposes Li-ViP3D++ for end-to-end perception and trajectory prediction using Query-Gated Deformable Fusion to integrate camera and LiDAR without heuristic alignment steps.

entry.title: PASS: Ambiguity Guided Subsets for Scalable Classical and Quantum Constrained Clustering

author.name: Pedro Chumpitaz-Flores, My Duong, Ying Mao, Kaixun Hua

entry.summary: Proposes PASS framework for pairwise-constrained clustering that preserves must-link/cannot-link constraints while enabling scalability for quantum/hybrid quantum clustering methods.

entry.title: ScatterFusion: A Hierarchical Scattering Transform Framework for Enhanced Time Series Forecasting

author.name: Wei Li

entry.summary: Introduces ScatterFusion combining scattering transforms with hierarchical attention for time series forecasting, extracting multi-scale invariant features with trend-seasonal-residual decomposition.

entry.title: SA-PEF: Step-Ahead Partial Error Feedback for Efficient Federated Learning

author.name: Dawit Kiros Redie, Reza Arablouei, Stefan Werner

entry.summary: Proposes SA-PEF combining step-ahead correction with partial error feedback for efficient federated learning under non-IID data and partial client participation.

entry.title: LogSieve: Task-Aware CI Log Reduction for Sustainable LLM-Based Analysis

author.name: Marcus Emmanuel Barnes, Taher A. Ghaleb, Safwat Hassan

entry.summary: Introduces LogSieve, a task-aware technique for reducing CI log verbosity while preserving content relevant for LLM-based root cause analysis. Achieves significant log reduction on 20 open-source projects while maintaining diagnostic utility.

entry.title: PsychePass: Calibrating LLM Therapeutic Competence via Trajectory-Anchored Tournaments

author.name: Zhuang Chen, Dazhen Wan, Zhangkai Zheng, Guanqun Bi, Xiyao Xiao, Binghang Li, Minlie Huang

entry.summary: Introduces PsychePass, a framework for evaluating LLM therapeutic competence through trajectory-anchored tournaments. Addresses 'unanchored defect' in current evaluation with controlled client simulation and stable scoring.

entry.title: Exact Graph Learning via Integer Programming

author.name: Lucas Kook, S{\o}ren Wengel Mogensen

entry.summary: Introduces a nonparametric graph learning framework using integer programming to find globally optimal solutions for causal discovery. Addresses limitations of greedy algorithms and restrictive assumptions in existing methods.

entry.title: PILOT: Planning via Internalized Latent Optimization Trajectories for Large Language Models

author.name: Haoyu Zheng, Yun Zhu, Yuqian Yuan, Bo Yuan, Wenqiao Zhang, Siliang Tang, Jun Xiao

entry.summary: Proposes PILOT, a framework for internalizing strategic planning from large teacher models into compact LLMs via lightweight Latent Guidance modules. Improves multi-step reasoning without modifying backbone weights.

entry.title: Attribution Techniques for Mitigating Hallucinated Information in RAG Systems: A Survey

author.name: Yuqing Zhao, Ziyao Liu, Yongsen Zheng, Kwok-Yan Lam

entry.summary: Surveys attribution-based techniques for mitigating hallucinations in RAG systems. Provides taxonomy and systematic comparison of methods ensuring responses are verifiably supported by retrieved content.

entry.title: MiLorE-SSL: Scaling Multilingual Capabilities in Self-Supervised Models without Forgetting

author.name: Jing Xu, Minglin Wu, Xueyuan Chen, Xixin Wu, Helen Meng

entry.summary: Proposes MiLorE-SSL combining LoRA with soft mixture-of-experts for efficient continual multilingual training of SSL speech models. Reduces forgetting through limited replay data and gradient projection.

entry.title: CE-RM: A Pointwise Generative Reward Model Optimized via Two-Stage Rollout and Unified Criteria

author.name: Xinyu Hu, Yancheng He, Weixun Wang, Tao Feng, Li Lin, Jiashun Liu, Wenbo Su, Bo Zheng, Xiaojun Wan

entry.summary: Proposes CE-RM, a pointwise generative reward model trained via two-stage rollout with unified evaluation criteria. Addresses gap between benchmark performance and actual RL effectiveness.

entry.title: BMAM: Brain-inspired Multi-Agent Memory Framework

author.name: Yang Li, Jiaxiang Liu, Yusong Wang, Yujie Wu, Mingkun Xu

entry.summary: Introduces BMAM, a brain-inspired multi-agent memory framework decomposing memory into episodic, semantic, salience-aware, and control-oriented components. Addresses 'soul erosion' in long-horizon agent interactions.

entry.title: Beyond Divergent Creativity: A Human-Based Evaluation of Creativity in Large Language Models

author.name: Kumiko Nakajima, Jan Zuiderveld, Sandro Pezzelle

entry.summary: Critiques Divergent Association Task for LLM creativity evaluation, showing baselines without creative ability score higher than LLMs. Introduces Conditional DAT (CDAT) incorporating appropriateness alongside novelty.

entry.title: Look in the Middle: Structural Anchor Pruning for Scalable Visual RAG Indexing

author.name: Zhuchenyang Liu, Ziyu Hu, Yao Zhang, Yu Xiao

entry.summary: Introduces Structural Anchor Pruning (SAP), a training-free method for pruning visual tokens in Vision-Language models like ColPali by identifying key patches from middle layers. Achieves high compression rates (>80%) while maintaining retrieval performance.

entry.title: Say Cheese! Detail-Preserving Portrait Collection Generation via Natural Language Edits

author.name: Zelong Sun, Jiahui Wu, Ying Ba, Dong Jing, Zhiwu Lu

entry.summary: Introduces CHEESE, first large-scale Portrait Collection Generation dataset with 24K collections and 573K samples, enabling coherent portrait collection generation through natural language editing of reference images.

entry.title: TRACER: Texture-Robust Affordance Chain-of-Thought for Deformable-Object Refinement

author.name: Wanjun Jia, Kang Li, Fan Yang, Mengfei Duan, Wenrui Chen, Yiming Jiang, Hui Zhang, Kailun Yang, Zhiyong Li, Yaonan Wang

entry.summary: Proposes TRACER, a texture-robust affordance prediction framework for deformable object manipulation using tree-structured affordance chain-of-thought reasoning with appearance-robust refinement.

entry.title: Vibro-Sense: Robust Vibration-based Impulse Response Localization and Trajectory Tracking for Robotic Hands

author.name: Wadhah Zai El Amri, Nicol\'as Navarro-Guerrero

entry.summary: Presents Vibro-Sense, whole-body touch localization using 7 piezoelectric microphones and Audio Spectrogram Transformer, achieving under 5mm localization error through vibrational signatures.

entry.title: End-to-end example-based sim-to-real RL policy transfer based on neural stylisation with application to robotic cutting

author.name: Jamie Hathaway, Alireza Rastegarpanah, Rustam Stolkin

entry.summary: This paper proposes a novel sim-to-real transfer method for reinforcement learning that repurposes neural style transfer techniques to synthesize training data from unpaired real-world datasets. The approach uses a variational autoencoder for joint self-supervised feature learning and style transfer, applied specifically to robotic cutting tasks.

entry.title: STELLAR: Structure-guided LLM Assertion Retrieval and Generation for Formal Verification

author.name: Saeid Rajabi, Chengmo Yang, Satwik Patnaik

entry.summary: Presents STELLAR, the first framework guiding LLM-based SystemVerilog Assertion generation with structural similarity using AST fingerprints and structure-guided prompts.

entry.title: Table-BiEval: A Self-Supervised, Dual-Track Framework for Decoupling Structure and Content in LLM Evaluation

author.name: Boxiang Zhao, Qince Li, Zhonghao Wang, Zelin Cao, Yi Wang, Peng Cheng, Bo Lin

entry.summary: Proposes Table-BiEval, a self-supervised framework for evaluating LLMs' ability to translate natural language to structured formats, decoupling structure and content assessment.

entry.title: CiMRAG: Cim-Aware Domain-Adaptive and Noise-Resilient Retrieval-Augmented Generation for Edge-Based LLMs

author.name: Shih-Hsuan Chiu, Ming-Syan Chen

entry.summary: Proposes CiMRAG for edge-based RAG with Computing-in-Memory awareness, addressing noise susceptibility that degrades retrieval precision in dynamic multi-domain scenarios.

entry.title: MALLOC: Benchmarking the Memory-aware Long Sequence Compression for Large Sequential Recommendation

author.name: Qihang Yu, Kairui Fu, Zhaocheng Du, Yuxuan Si, Kaiyuan Li, Weihao Zhao, Zhicheng Zhang, Jieming Zhu, Quanyu Dai, Zhenhua Dong, Shengyu Zhang, Kun Kuang, Fei Wu

entry.summary: Proposes MALLOC, a benchmark for evaluating memory-aware long sequence compression in large-scale recommender systems. Addresses the overlooked space overhead from pre-storing intermediate states for user behavior sequences.

entry.title: CURVE: Learning Causality-Inspired Invariant Representations for Robust Scene Understanding via Uncertainty-Guided Regularization

author.name: Yue Liang, Jiatong Du, Ziyi Yang, Yanjun Huang, Hong Chen

entry.summary: Proposes CURVE, a causality-inspired framework for scene graph generation that uses variational uncertainty modeling and prototype-conditioned debiasing to suppress spurious correlations.

entry.title: Fair Recourse for All: Ensuring Individual and Group Fairness in Counterfactual Explanations

author.name: Fatima Ezzeddine, Obaida Ammar, Silvia Giordano, Omran Ayoub

entry.summary: Addresses fairness in counterfactual explanations by ensuring individuals with similar attributes and those from different protected groups receive similar actionable recourse options.

entry.title: Decoupling Perception and Calibration: Label-Efficient Image Quality Assessment Framework

author.name: Xinyue Li, Zhichao Zhang, Zhiming Xu, Shubo Xu, Xiongkuo Min, Yitong Chen, Guangtao Zhai

entry.summary: Proposes LEAF, a label-efficient IQA framework that distills perceptual priors from MLLM teachers into lightweight regressors. Argues perception capacity is not the bottleneck, but MOS calibration is.

entry.title: AWGformer: Adaptive Wavelet-Guided Transformer for Multi-Resolution Time Series Forecasting

author.name: Wei Li

entry.summary: Proposes AWGformer with adaptive wavelet decomposition dynamically selecting optimal wavelet bases and frequency-aware multi-head attention weighting for time series prediction.

entry.title: MuRAL-CPD: Active Learning for Multiresolution Change Point Detection

author.name: Stefano Bertolasi, Diego Carrera, Diego Stucchi, Pasqualina Fragneto, Luigi Amedeo Bianchi

entry.summary: Proposes MuRAL-CPD integrating active learning into multiresolution wavelet-based change point detection, incorporating user feedback to iteratively optimize hyperparameters.

entry.title: MK-SGC-SC: Multiple Kernel guided Sparse Graph Construction in Spectral Clustering for Unsupervised Speaker Diarization

author.name: Nikhil Raghav, Avisek Gupta, Swagatam Das, Md Sahidullah

entry.summary: Proposes MK-SGC-SC using multiple kernel similarities with sparse graph spectral clustering for unsupervised speaker diarization, achieving SOTA in fully unsupervised setting.

entry.title: CPiRi: Channel Permutation-Invariant Relational Interaction for Multivariate Time Series Forecasting

author.name: Jiyuan Xu, Wenyu Zhang, Xin Jing, Shuai Chen, Shuai Zhang, Jiahao Nie

entry.summary: Proposes CPiRi, a channel permutation-invariant framework for multivariate time series forecasting that infers cross-channel structure from data rather than memorizing fixed ordering, enabling deployment without retraining when channels change.

entry.title: Latent Temporal Discrepancy as Motion Prior: A Loss-Weighting Strategy for Dynamic Fidelity in T2V

author.name: Meiqi Wu, Bingze Song, Ruimin Lin, Chen Zhu, Xiaokun Feng, Jiahong Wu, Xiangxiang Chu, Kaiqi Huang

entry.summary: Introduces Latent Temporal Discrepancy (LTD) as motion prior for video generation loss weighting, assigning larger penalties to dynamic regions while maintaining regular optimization for stable regions.

entry.title: Hardware-Aware Model Design and Training of Silicon-based Analog Neural Networks

author.name: Giulio Filippeschi, Mirko Brazzini, Cristhopher Mosquera, Marco Lanuzza, Alessandro Catania, Sebastiano Strangio, Giuseppe Iannaccone

entry.summary: Demonstrates that retraining neural networks with physics-informed hardware-aware models can fully recover inference accuracy of analog neural networks despite significant non-idealities, avoiding expensive calibration.

entry.title: The Forecast After the Forecast: A Post-Processing Shift in Time Series

author.name: Daojun Liang, Qi Li, Yinglong Wang, Jing Chen, Hu Zhang, Xiaoxiao Cui, Qizheng Wang, Shuo Li

entry.summary: Proposes δ-Adapter, a lightweight post-processing module that improves deployed time series forecasters without retraining. Learns bounded input nudging and output residual corrections.

entry.title: WFR-MFM: One-Step Inference for Dynamic Unbalanced Optimal Transport

author.name: Xinyu Wang, Ruoyu Wang, Qiangwei Peng, Peijie Zhou, Tiejun Li

entry.summary: Proposes WFR-MFM for one-step inference in dynamic unbalanced optimal transport under Wasserstein-Fisher-Rao geometry. Enables fast generation without trajectory simulation for single-cell biology.

entry.title: Adapting the Behavior of Reinforcement Learning Agents to Changing Action Spaces and Reward Functions

author.name: Raul de la Rosa, Ivana Dusparic, Nicolas Cardozo

entry.summary: Introduces MORPHIN, a self-adaptive Q-learning framework handling changes in reward functions and action space expansions via concept drift detection and dynamic hyperparameter adjustment.

entry.title: An Empirical Investigation of Neural ODEs and Symbolic Regression for Dynamical Systems

author.name: Panayiotis Ioannou, Pietro Li\`o, Pietro Cicuta

entry.summary: Empirically investigates Neural ODEs and Symbolic Regression for dynamical systems discovery, showing NODEs can extrapolate to new boundary conditions if trajectories share dynamic similarity with training.

entry.title: C3Box: A CLIP-based Class-Incremental Learning Toolbox

author.name: Hao Sun, Da-Wei Zhou

entry.summary: Introduces C3Box, a unified toolbox for CLIP-based Class-Incremental Learning addressing scattered codebases and inconsistent configurations that hinder reproducibility.

entry.title: Youtu-Parsing: Perception, Structuring and Recognition via High-Parallelism Decoding

author.name: Kun Yin, Yunfei Wu, Bing Liu, Zhongpeng Cai, Xiaotian Li, Huang Chen, Xin Li, Haoyu Cao, Yinsong Liu, Deqiang Jiang, Xing Sun, Yunsheng Wu, Qianyu Li, Antai Guo, Yanzhen Liao, Yanqiu Qu, Haodong Lin, Chengxu He, Shuangyin Liu

entry.summary: Presents Youtu-Parsing, a document parsing model using native ViT with dynamic resolution and high-parallelism decoding that generates up to 64 candidate tokens per inference step with verification.

entry.title: FreeFix: Boosting 3D Gaussian Splatting via Fine-Tuning-Free Diffusion Models

author.name: Hongyu Zhou, Zisen Shao, Sheng Miao, Pan Wang, Dongfeng Bai, Bingbing Liu, Yiyi Liao

entry.summary: Introduces FreeFix, a fine-tuning-free approach to enhance 3D Gaussian Splatting with pretrained diffusion models through interleaved 2D-3D refinement strategy for extrapolated views.

entry.title: GTAC: A Generative Transformer for Approximate Circuits

author.name: Jingxin Wang, Shitong Guo, Ruicheng Dai, Wenhui Liang, Ruogu Ding, Xin Ning, Weikang Qian

entry.summary: Introduces GTAC, a generative Transformer model for producing approximate circuits by integrating error thresholds into the design process, achieving 6.4% area reduction over state-of-the-art.

entry.title: Evaluating Large Language Models for Abstract Evaluation Tasks: An Empirical Study

author.name: Yinuo Liu, Emre Sezgin, Eric A. Youngstrom

entry.summary: Evaluates ChatGPT-5, Gemini-3-Pro, and Claude-Sonnet-4.5 on abstract evaluation tasks, comparing consistency and reliability against human reviewers using multiple metrics.

entry.title: DecHW: Heterogeneous Decentralized Federated Learning Exploiting Second-Order Information

author.name: Adnan Ahmad, Chiara Boldrini, Lorenzo Valerio, Andrea Passarella, Marco Conti

entry.summary: Proposes DecHW for decentralized federated learning addressing data and model heterogeneity through second-order information and evidential credence-based aggregation.

entry.title: Robust SDE Parameter Estimation Under Missing Time Information Setting

author.name: Long Van Tran, Truyen Tran, Phuoc Nguyen

entry.summary: Addresses SDE parameter estimation when temporal ordering information is corrupted, missing, or hidden. Proposes a framework that simultaneously reconstructs temporal information and estimates parameters using score-matching.

entry.title: Structure-constrained Language-informed Diffusion Model for Unpaired Low-dose Computed Tomography Angiography Reconstruction

author.name: Genyuan Zhang, Zihao Wang, Zhifan Gao, Lei Xu, Zhen Zhou, Haijun Yu, Jianjia Zhang, Xiujian Liu, Weiwei Zhang, Shaoyu Wang, Huazhu Fu, Fenglin Liu, Weiwen Wu

entry.summary: Proposes SLDM for reconstructing normal-dose CT angiography images from low-dose contrast media using structure-constrained language-informed diffusion models with unpaired training.

entry.title: Regularized Gradient Temporal-Difference Learning

author.name: Hyunjun Na, Donghwan Lee

entry.summary: Proposes regularized GTD algorithms that guarantee convergence even when the feature interaction matrix is singular, addressing a restrictive assumption in existing convergence analyses.

entry.title: Conditional PED-ANOVA: Hyperparameter Importance in Hierarchical & Dynamic Search Spaces

author.name: Kaito Baba, Yoshihiko Ozaki, Shuhei Watanabe

entry.summary: Proposes condPED-ANOVA for estimating hyperparameter importance in conditional search spaces where hyperparameter presence or domain depends on other hyperparameters.

entry.title: oculomix: Hierarchical Sampling for Retinal-Based Systemic Disease Prediction

author.name: Hyunmin Kim, Yukun Zhou, Rahul A. Jonas, Lie Ju, Sunjin Hwang, Pearse A. Keane, Siegfried K. Wagner

entry.summary: Proposes Oculomix, a hierarchical sampling strategy for mixed sample augmentation in retinal imaging that accounts for patient-specific attributes when using transformers for predicting systemic diseases. Addresses the limitation that standard augmentations like CutMix perturb medical comorbidity information.

entry.title: A Reinforcement Learning Based Universal Sequence Design for Polar Codes

author.name: David Kin Wai Ho, Arman Fazeli, Mohamad M. Mansour, Louay M. A. Jalloul

entry.summary: Develops RL-based universal sequence design framework for Polar codes scalable to length 2048 for 6G applications. Achieves competitive performance with 5G NR sequence and up to 0.2 dB gain over baselines.

entry.title: Deep Semi-Supervised Survival Analysis for Predicting Cancer Prognosis

author.name: Anchen Sun, Zhibin Chen, Xiaodong Cai

entry.summary: Develops Cox-MT using Mean Teacher framework for semi-supervised survival analysis of cancer prognosis, utilizing both labeled and unlabeled data with single- and multi-modal ANNs.

entry.title: The Sound of Noise: Leveraging the Inductive Bias of Pre-trained Audio Transformers for Glitch Identification in LIGO

author.name: Suyash Deshmukh, Chayan Chatterjee, Abigail Petulante, Tabata Aira Ferreira, Karan Jani

entry.summary: Applies pre-trained audio transformers to detect glitches in LIGO gravitational-wave data, treating strain data as audio signals. This cross-domain approach addresses the 'label bottleneck' in current supervised methods and improves generalization to new glitch types.

entry.title: Empirical Likelihood-Based Fairness Auditing: Distribution-Free Certification and Flagging

author.name: Jie Tang, Chuanlong Xie, Xianli Zeng, Lixing Zhu

entry.summary: Proposes an empirical likelihood-based framework for fairness auditing that provides distribution-free certification and demographic group flagging. Constructs robust statistical measures without restrictive distributional assumptions.

entry.title: Leveraging Second-Order Curvature for Efficient Learned Image Compression: Theory and Empirical Evidence

author.name: Yichi Zhang, Fengqing Zhu

entry.summary: Shows that second-order quasi-Newton optimizer SOAP dramatically improves training efficiency and rate-distortion performance for learned image compression by resolving gradient conflicts in multi-objective optimization.

entry.title: "Newspaper Eat" Means "Not Tasty": A Taxonomy and Benchmark for Coded Languages in Real-World Chinese Online Reviews

author.name: Ruyuan Wan, Changye Li, Ting-Hao 'Kenneth' Huang

entry.summary: Introduces CodedLang, a dataset of Chinese coded language in reviews where surface text differs from intended meaning. Develops seven-class taxonomy and benchmarks LLMs on detection, classification, and rating prediction.

entry.title: Me-Agent: A Personalized Mobile Agent with Two-Level User Habit Learning for Enhanced Interaction

author.name: Shuoxin Wang, Chang Liu, Gowen Loo, Lifan Zheng, Kaiwen Wei, Xinyi Zeng, Jingyuan Zhang, Yu Tian

entry.summary: Proposes Me-Agent, a personalized mobile agent with two-level user habit learning at prompt and weight levels. Incorporates Personal Reward Model for preference learning from interaction history.

entry.title: SpeechMapper: Speech-to-text Embedding Projector for LLMs

author.name: Biswesh Mohapatra, Marcely Zanon Boito, Ioan Calapodescu

entry.summary: Presents SpeechMapper, a cost-efficient speech-to-LLM embedding training approach. Pretrains without LLM then attaches via brief 1K-step instruction tuning, reducing overfitting and computational cost.

entry.title: ShieldedCode: Learning Robust Representations for Virtual Machine Protected Code

author.name: Mingqiao Mo, Yunlong Tan, Hao Zhang, Heng Zhang, Yangfan He

entry.summary: Introduces ShieldedCode, the first framework learning robust representations of VM-protected code. Builds paired datasets and models hierarchical dependencies for protection-aware code understanding.

entry.title: DiSa: Saliency-Aware Foreground-Background Disentangled Framework for Open-Vocabulary Semantic Segmentation

author.name: Zhen Yao, Xin Li, Taotao Jing, Shuai Zhang, Mooi Choo Chuah

entry.summary: Proposes DiSa, a saliency-aware framework for open-vocabulary semantic segmentation that addresses CLIP's foreground bias and limited spatial localization by explicitly disentangling foreground and background using saliency cues.

entry.title: Quartet of Diffusions: Structure-Aware Point Cloud Generation through Part and Symmetry Guidance

author.name: Chenliang Zhou, Fangcheng Zhong, Weihao Xia, Albert Miao, Canberk Baykal, Cengiz Oztireli

entry.summary: Presents Quartet of Diffusions, a structure-aware point cloud generation framework using four coordinated diffusion models to explicitly model part composition and symmetry for guaranteed structural properties.

entry.title: GRTX: Efficient Ray Tracing for 3D Gaussian-Based Rendering

author.name: Junseo Lee, Sangyun Jeon, Jungi Lee, Junyong Park, Jaewoong Sim

entry.summary: Presents GRTX, software and hardware optimizations for efficient ray tracing of 3D Gaussian Splatting, addressing bloated acceleration structures and redundant node traversals.

entry.title: RF-MatID: Dataset and Benchmark for Radio Frequency Material Identification

author.name: Xinyan Chen, Qinchun Li, Ruiqin Ma, Jiaqi Bai, Li Yi, Jianfei Yang

entry.summary: Presents RF-MatID, first open-source large-scale wide-band RF dataset for fine-grained material identification with 16 categories and 5 superclasses, enabling RF-based material recognition research.

entry.title: Probabilistic Sensing: Intelligence in Data Sampling

author.name: Ibrahim Albulushi, Saleh Bunaiyan, Suraj S. Cheema, Hesham ElSawy, Feras Al-Dirini

entry.summary: Presents a probabilistic sensing paradigm using probabilistic neurons for intelligent data sampling decisions, achieving microsecond response times for real-time autonomous activation.

entry.title: Taxonomy of the Retrieval System Framework: Pitfalls and Paradigms

author.name: Deep Shah, Sanket Badhe, Nehal Kathrotia

entry.summary: Presents taxonomy of retrieval system design decisions as vertical traversal through representation, granularity, and orchestration layers, analyzing trade-offs between efficiency and effectiveness.

entry.title: Switchcodec: Adaptive residual-expert sparse quantization for high-fidelity neural audio coding

author.name: Xiangbo Wang, Wenbin Jiang, Jin Wang, Yubo You, Sheng Fang, Fei Wen

entry.summary: Introduces SwitchCodec, a neural audio codec using Residual Experts Vector Quantization (REVQ) with dynamically routed expert quantizers for variable-bitrate audio compression.

entry.title: Ranking-aware Reinforcement Learning for Ordinal Ranking

author.name: Aiming Hao, Chen Zhu, Jiashu Zhu, Jiahong Wu, Xiangxiang Chu

entry.summary: Proposes RARL, an RL framework for ordinal regression that integrates regression and Learning-to-Rank via ranking-aware verifiable rewards and Response Mutation Operations for exploration.

entry.title: Harnessing Large Language Models for Precision Querying and Retrieval-Augmented Knowledge Extraction in Clinical Data Science

author.name: Juan Jose Rubio Jan, Jack Wu, Julia Ive

entry.summary: Applies LLMs to EHR data science tasks: structured data querying via Python/Pandas and information extraction from clinical text via RAG. Proposes flexible evaluation framework with synthetic QA pairs.

entry.title: Exploring Transformer Placement in Variational Autoencoders for Tabular Data Generation

author.name: An\'ibal Silva, Mois\'es Santos, Andr\'e Restivo, Carlos Soares

entry.summary: Empirically investigates integrating Transformers into different VAE components for tabular data generation across 57 datasets. Finds positioning affects fidelity-diversity tradeoffs.

entry.title: Delayed Feedback Modeling for Post-Click Gross Merchandise Volume Prediction: Benchmark, Insights and Approaches

author.name: Xinyu Li, Sishuo Chen, Guipeng Xv, Li Zhang, Mingxuan Luo, Zhangming Chan, Xiang-Rong Sheng, Han Zhu, Jian Xu, Chen Lin

entry.summary: Establishes TRACE benchmark for GMV prediction with delayed feedback in e-commerce, addressing challenges where single clicks lead to multiple purchases forming cumulative labels.

entry.title: An explainable framework for the relationship between dementia and glucose metabolism patterns

author.name: C. V\'azquez-Garc\'ia, F. J. Mart\'inez-Murcia, F. Segovia Rom\'an, A. Forte, J. Ram\'irez, I. Ill\'an, A. Hern\'andez-Segura, C. Jim\'enez-Mesa, Juan M. G\'orriz

entry.summary: Proposes semi-supervised VAE framework with similarity regularization aligning latent variables with clinical measures of dementia progression, enabling explainable analysis of PET scans.

entry.title: GVGS: Gaussian Visibility-Aware Multi-View Geometry for Accurate Surface Reconstruction

author.name: Mai Su, Qihan Yu, Zhongtao Wang, Yilong Li, Chengwei Pan, Yisong Chen, Guoping Wang

entry.summary: Introduces GVGS, a Gaussian visibility-aware constraint for 3D Gaussian Splatting surface reconstruction that aggregates visibility of shared Gaussian primitives across views for more accurate depth supervision.

entry.title: MeCo: Enhancing LLM-Empowered Multi-Robot Collaboration via Similar Task Memoization

author.name: Baiqing Wang, Helei Cui, Bo Zhang, Xiaolong Zheng, Bin Guo, Zhiwen Yu

entry.summary: Proposes MeCo, a similarity-aware multi-robot collaboration method using LLMs with task memoization to avoid replanning from scratch when encountering similar tasks.

entry.title: Text-to-State Mapping for Non-Resolution Reasoning: The Contradiction-Preservation Principle

author.name: Kei Saito

entry.summary: Introduces text-to-state mapping for Non-Resolution Reasoning framework, formalizing the Contradiction-Preservation Principle for maintaining semantic ambiguity in LLM processing.

entry.title: Cheap2Rich: A Multi-Fidelity Framework for Data Assimilation and System Identification of Multiscale Physics -- Rotating Detonation Engines

author.name: Yuxuan Bao, Jan Zajac, Megan Powers, Venkat Raman, J. Nathan Kutz

entry.summary: Presents Cheap2Rich, a multi-fidelity data assimilation framework for reconstructing high-fidelity states from sparse sensors by combining fast low-fidelity priors with learned discrepancy corrections. Applied to rotating detonation engines.

entry.title: FedRD: Reducing Divergences for Generalized Federated Learning via Heterogeneity-aware Parameter Guidance

author.name: Kaile Wang, Jiannong Cao, Yu Yang, Xiaoyin Li, Mingjin Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes FedRD addressing optimization and performance divergence in federated domain generalization through parameter-guided global aggregation and local debiased classification.

entry.title: Let's Roll a BiFTA: Bi-refinement for Fine-grained Text-visual Alignment in Vision-Language Models

author.name: Yuhao Sun, Chengyi Cai, Jiacheng Zhang, Zesheng Ye, Xingliang Yuan, Feng Liu

entry.summary: Proposes BiFTA for improving CLIP zero-shot performance through view refinement (removing redundant patches via IoU) and description refinement for fine-grained text-visual alignment.

entry.title: A New Dataset and Framework for Robust Road Surface Classification via Camera-IMU Fusion

author.name: Willams de Lima Costa, Thifany Ketuli Silva de Souza, Jonas Ferreira Silva, Carlos Gabriel Bezerra Pereira, Bruno Reis Vila Nova, Leonardo Silvino Brito, Rafael Raider Leoni, Juliano Silva, Valter Ferreira, Sibele Miguel Soares Neto, Samantha Uehara, Daniel Giacomo, Jo\~ao Marcelo Teixeira, Veronica Teichrieb, Cristiano Coelho de Ara\'ujo

entry.summary: Introduces ROAD dataset for road surface classification with camera-IMU fusion. Proposes lightweight bidirectional cross-attention module with adaptive gating for domain shift handling.

entry.title: C2:Cross learning module enhanced decision transformer with Constraint-aware loss for auto-bidding

author.name: Jinren Ding, Xuejian Xu, Shen Jiang, Zhitong Hao, Jinhui Yang, Peng Jiang

entry.summary: Proposes C2 framework enhancing Decision Transformer for auto-bidding with Cross Learning Block for inter-sequence correlation and Constraint-aware Loss incorporating budget/CPA constraints.

entry.title: Physics-informed Blind Reconstruction of Dense Fields from Sparse Measurements using Neural Networks with a Differentiable Simulator

author.name: Ofek Aloni, Barak Fishbain

entry.summary: Presents a physics-informed neural network method for reconstructing dense physical fields from sparse measurements without requiring dense training examples. Uses differentiable numerical simulator during training.

entry.title: Demystifying Prediction Powered Inference

author.name: Yilin Song, Dan M. Kluger, Harsh Parikh, Tian Gu

entry.summary: Provides a tutorial-style overview of Prediction-Powered Inference (PPI) methods that leverage ML predictions to improve statistical efficiency while maintaining valid inference. Clarifies distinctions between growing PPI variants.

entry.title: Unit-Based Agent for Semi-Cascaded Full-Duplex Dialogue Systems

author.name: Haoyuan Yu, Yuxuan Chen, Minjie Cai

entry.summary: Presents a framework for full-duplex dialogue systems decomposing conversations into minimal units for independent processing. Implements semi-cascaded system with MLLM core, achieving second place in Human-like Spoken Dialogue Systems Challenge.

entry.title: Efficient Multimodal Planning Agent for Visual Question-Answering

author.name: Zhuo Chen, Xinyu Geng, Xinyu Wang, Yong Jiang, Zhen Zhang, Pengjun Xie, Kewei Tu

entry.summary: Proposes training a multimodal planning agent that dynamically decomposes RAG pipelines for efficient VQA. Optimizes trade-off between efficiency and effectiveness through learned decomposition.

entry.title: Like a Therapist, But Not: Reddit Narratives of AI in Mental Health Contexts

author.name: Elham Aghakhani, Rezvaneh Rezapour

entry.summary: Analyzes 5,126 Reddit posts about AI use for emotional support/therapy, examining evaluative language and adoption attitudes. Finds engagement shaped by narrated outcomes, trust, and response quality.

entry.title: Visual Prompt-Agnostic Evolution

author.name: Junze Wang, Lei Fan, Dezheng Zhang, Weipeng Jing, Donglin Di, Yang Song, Sidong Liu, Cong Cong

entry.summary: Introduces Prompt-Agnostic Evolution (PAE) to address unstable training dynamics in Visual Prompt Tuning, using frequency-domain analysis to show shallow prompts stagnate while deep prompts oscillate, and proposes solutions.

entry.title: StructAlign: Structured Cross-Modal Alignment for Continual Text-to-Video Retrieval

author.name: Shaokun Wang, Weili Guan, Jizhou Han, Jianlong Wu, Yupeng Hu, Liqiang Nie

entry.summary: Proposes StructAlign for continual text-to-video retrieval, using simplex Equiangular Tight Frame geometry as unified prior to mitigate intra-modal and cross-modal feature drift in continual learning.

entry.title: Game-Theoretic Autonomous Driving: A Graphs of Convex Sets Approach

author.name: Nikolaj K\"afer, Ahmed Khalil, Edward Huynh, Efstathios Bakolas, David Fridovich-Keil

entry.summary: IBR-GCS introduces a game-theoretic framework for multi-vehicle autonomous driving that combines Iterative Best Response with Graphs of Convex Sets to model highway driving as a generalized noncooperative game. The approach unifies combinatorial maneuver reasoning, trajectory planning, and strategic interaction in a single framework.

entry.title: Size Matters: Reconstructing Real-Scale 3D Models from Monocular Images for Food Portion Estimation

author.name: Gautham Vinod, Bruce Coburn, Siddeshwar Raghavan, Jiangpeng He, Fengqing Zhu

entry.summary: Proposes method to recover true-to-scale 3D reconstructed objects from monocular images for food portion estimation, bridging 3D vision and digital health.

entry.title: DiagLink: A Dual-User Diagnostic Assistance System by Synergizing Experts with LLMs and Knowledge Graphs

author.name: Zihan Zhou, Yinan Liu, Yuyang Xie, Bin Wang, Xiaochun Yang, Zezheng Feng

entry.summary: Presents DiagLink, a dual-user diagnostic assistance system combining LLMs with knowledge graphs for both patients and physicians. Features guided dialogues and physician oversight for knowledge validation.

entry.title: Robust Distributed Learning under Resource Constraints: Decentralized Quantile Estimation via (Asynchronous) ADMM

author.name: Anna van Elst, Igor Colin, Stephan Cl\'emen\c{c}on

entry.summary: Proposes AsylADMM, a gossip algorithm for decentralized median and quantile estimation that is memory-efficient, communication-efficient, and robust to data corruption.

entry.title: TPGDiff: Hierarchical Triple-Prior Guided Diffusion for Image Restoration

author.name: Yanjie Tu, Qingsen Yan, Axi Niu, Jiacong Tang

entry.summary: Proposes TPGDiff for all-in-one image restoration, using degradation priors throughout diffusion while introducing structural priors in shallow layers and semantic priors in deep layers to prevent artifacts.

entry.title: FD-MAD: Frequency-Domain Residual Analysis for Face Morphing Attack Detection

author.name: Diogo J. Paulo, Hugo Proen\c{c}a, Jo\~ao C. Neves

entry.summary: Introduces FD-MAD, a region-aware frequency-based approach to face morphing attack detection that improves cross-dataset and cross-morph generalization using lightweight frequency domain analysis.

entry.title: Implementing Metric Temporal Answer Set Programming

author.name: Arvid Becker, Pedro Cabalar, Martin Di\'eguez, Susana Hahn, Javier Romero, Torsten Schaub

entry.summary: Develops computational approach to Metric Answer Set Programming for expressing quantitative temporal constraints like durations and deadlines, addressing scalability through difference constraints.

entry.title: Benchmarking von ASR-Modellen im deutschen medizinischen Kontext: Eine Leistungsanalyse anhand von Anamnesegespr\"achen

author.name: Thomas Schuster, Julius Tr\"ogele, Nico D\"oring, Robin Kr\"uger, Matthieu Hoffmann, Holger Friedrich

entry.summary: Benchmarks 29 ASR models including Whisper, Voxtral, and commercial APIs on German medical conversations with dialects, evaluating with WER, CER, and BLEU.

entry.title: Certificate-Guided Pruning for Stochastic Lipschitz Optimization

author.name: Ibne Farabi Shihab, Sanjeda Akter, Anuj Sharma

entry.summary: Introduces Certificate-Guided Pruning for black-box Lipschitz optimization with noisy evaluations. Maintains explicit certificates of optimality via confidence-adjusted Lipschitz envelopes with provable sample complexity bounds.

entry.title: Physically Guided Visual Mass Estimation from a Single RGB Image

author.name: Sungjae Lee, Junhan Jeong, Yeonjoo Hong, Kwang In Kim

entry.summary: Proposes a physically structured framework for estimating object mass from a single RGB image by recovering 3D geometry via monocular depth and extracting material semantics via vision-language models.

entry.title: CLEAR-Mamba:Towards Accurate, Adaptive and Trustworthy Multi-Sequence Ophthalmic Angiography Classification

author.name: Zhuonan Wang, Wenjie Yan, Wenqiao Zhang, Xiaohui Song, Jian Ma, Ke Yao, Yibo Yu, Beng Chin Ooi

entry.summary: Proposes CLEAR-Mamba for multi-sequence ophthalmic angiography classification, building on MedMamba with optimizations for accuracy, adaptability, and trustworthiness across imaging devices.

entry.title: Modeling Cascaded Delay Feedback for Online Net Conversion Rate Prediction: Benchmark, Insights and Solutions

author.name: Mingxuan Luo, Guipeng Xv, Sishuo Chen, Xinyu Li, Li Zhang, Zhangming Chan, Xiang-Rong Sheng, Han Zhu, Jian Xu, Bo Zheng, Chen Lin

entry.summary: Addresses NetCVR prediction (conversion rate minus refunds) with cascaded delayed feedback, introducing benchmark and online training schemes for recommender systems. First systematic study of this industry-relevant problem.

entry.title: Parametric and Generative Forecasts of Day-Ahead Market Curves for Storage Optimization

author.name: Julian Gutierrez, Redouane Silvente

entry.summary: Presents ML frameworks for forecasting day-ahead electricity market curves and optimizing storage using parametric Chebyshev models and generative models for order-level submissions.

entry.title: COMET-SG1: Lightweight Autoregressive Regressor for Edge and Embedded AI

author.name: Shakhyar Gogoi

entry.summary: Proposes COMET-SG1, lightweight autoregressive regression model for edge/embedded AI using linear behavior-space encoding and memory-anchored transition estimation for bounded long-horizon behavior.

entry.title: Neural Quantum States in Mixed Precision

author.name: Massimo Solinas, Agnes Valenti, Nawaf Bou-Rabee, Roeland Wiersema

entry.summary: Investigates mixed-precision arithmetic in neural network variational Monte Carlo for quantum many-body systems. Derives analytical error bounds and shows reduced precision can maintain accuracy while improving efficiency.

entry.title: Semantic Uncertainty Quantification of Hallucinations in LLMs: A Quantum Tensor Network Based Method

author.name: Pragatheeswaran Vipulanandan, Kamal Premaratne, Dilip Sarkar

entry.summary: Proposes quantum tensor network-based uncertainty quantification for hallucination detection, using quantum physics-inspired framework for semantic equivalence clustering. Introduces entropy maximization for reliable output selection.

entry.title: FFE-Hallu:Hallucinations in Fixed Figurative Expressions:Benchmark of Idioms and Proverbs in the Persian Language

author.name: Faezeh Hosseini, Mohammadali Yousefzadeh, Yadollah Yaghoobzadeh

entry.summary: Introduces FFEHallu, the first benchmark for figurative hallucination in LLMs focusing on Persian idioms and proverbs. Tests whether LLMs generate or endorse non-existent but plausible-sounding expressions.

entry.title: Single-Nodal Spontaneous Symmetry Breaking in NLP Models

author.name: Shalom Rosner, Ronit D. Gross, Ella Koresh, Ido Kanter

entry.summary: Demonstrates spontaneous symmetry breaking in NLP models during training, where individual attention heads and nodes acquire capacity to learn limited token/label sets. Applies statistical mechanics framework to NLP.

entry.title: Persona Prompting as a Lens on LLM Social Reasoning

author.name: Jing Yang, Moritz Hechtbauer, Elisabeth Khalilov, Evelyn Luise Brinkmann, Vera Schmitt, Nils Feldhus

entry.summary: Studies how persona prompting affects LLM rationales for hate speech detection. Finds PP can improve classification alignment with specific demographic groups but effects vary by model and persona.

entry.title: BLENDER: Blended Text Embeddings and Diffusion Residuals for Intra-Class Image Synthesis in Deep Metric Learning

author.name: Jan Niklas Kolf, Ozan Tezcan, Justin Theiss, Hyung Jun Kim, Wentao Bao, Bhargav Bhushanam, Khushi Gupta, Arun Kejariwal, Naser Damer, Fadi Boutros

entry.summary: Introduces BLENDER, a diffusion sampling method using set-theory inspired union and intersection operations on denoising residuals to increase intra-class diversity for deep metric learning.

entry.title: RAW-Flow: Advancing RGB-to-RAW Image Reconstruction with Deterministic Latent Flow Matching

author.name: Zhen Liu, Diedong Feng, Hai Jiang, Liaoyuan Zeng, Hao Wang, Chaoyu Feng, Lei Lei, Bing Zeng, Shuaicheng Liu

entry.summary: Proposes RAW-Flow, reformulating RGB-to-RAW reconstruction as deterministic latent transport using flow matching, addressing detail inconsistency and color deviation in inverse ISP modeling.

entry.title: IOTA: Corrective Knowledge-Guided Prompt Learning via Black-White Box Framework

author.name: Shaokun Wang, Yifan Yu, Yuhang He, Weili Guan, Yihong Gong

entry.summary: Proposes IOTA, a black-white box prompt learning framework that integrates data-driven optimization with knowledge-driven corrective knowledge derived from contrasting wrong predictions with correct cognition.

entry.title: Learning From a Steady Hand: A Weakly Supervised Agent for Robot Assistance under Microscopy

author.name: Huanyu Tian, Martin Huber, Lingyun Zeng, Zhe Han, Wayne Bennett, Giuseppe Silvestri, Gerardo Mendizabal-Ruiz, Tom Vercauteren, Alejandro Chavez-Badiola, Christos Bergeles

entry.summary: Presents a weakly supervised framework for robot assistance under microscopy using calibration-aware perception from warm-up trajectories, achieving ~49μm lateral accuracy without manual depth annotation.

entry.title: GuideAI: A Real-time Personalized Learning Solution with Adaptive Interventions

author.name: Ananya Shukla, Chaitanya Modi, Satvik Bajpai, Siddharth Siddharth

entry.summary: Introduces GuideAI, a multimodal framework enhancing LLM-driven learning by integrating real-time biosensor feedback including eye tracking, heart rate, posture, and note-taking behavior.

entry.title: GDCNet: Generative Discrepancy Comparison Network for Multimodal Sarcasm Detection

author.name: Shuguang Zhang, Junhong Lian, Guoxin Yu, Baoxun Xu, Xiang Ao

entry.summary: Proposes GDCNet for multimodal sarcasm detection using MLLM-generated image captions as stable semantic anchors to reduce noise from diverse LLM-generated sarcastic cues.

entry.title: Nonlinear Dimensionality Reduction with Diffusion Maps in Practice

author.name: S\"onke Beier, Paula Pirker-D\'iaz, Friedrich Pagenkopf, Karoline Wiesner

entry.summary: Provides practice-oriented review of Diffusion Maps for nonlinear dimensionality reduction, illustrating pitfalls in preprocessing, parameter settings, and component selection with recent technique for relevant component identification.

entry.title: Reversible Efficient Diffusion for Image Fusion

author.name: Xingxin Xu, Bing Cao, DongDong Li, Qinghua Hu, Pengfei Zhu

entry.summary: Proposes Reversible Efficient Diffusion (RED) for multi-modal image fusion, addressing detail loss in diffusion-based fusion through reversible transformations that reduce accumulated noise errors.

entry.title: MMSF: Multitask and Multimodal Supervised Framework for WSI Classification and Survival Analysis

author.name: Chengying She, Chengwei Chen, Xinran Zhang, Ben Wang, Lizhuang Liu, Chengwei Shao, Yun Bian

entry.summary: Proposes MMSF, a multitask multimodal framework for whole-slide image classification and survival analysis that fuses graph-based tissue topology features with clinical data using linear-complexity MIL.

entry.title: Comparative evaluation of training strategies using partially labelled datasets for segmentation of white matter hyperintensities and stroke lesions in FLAIR MRI

entry.title: NeuraLSP: An Efficient and Rigorous Neural Left Singular Subspace Preconditioner for Conjugate Gradient Methods

author.name: Alexander Benanti, Xi Han, Hong Qin

entry.summary: Proposes NeuraLSP, a neural preconditioner using graph neural networks for solving PDEs that leverages the left singular subspace of system matrices. Addresses rank inflation issues in existing GNN-based numerical methods for large sparse linear systems.

entry.title: Person Re-ID in 2025: Supervised, Self-Supervised, and Language-Aligned. What Works?

entry.title: Quantum statistics from classical simulations via generative Gibbs sampling

entry.summary: Presents GG-PI, combining generative modeling with Gibbs sampling to recover quantum statistics from classical simulation data. Significantly reduces computational cost compared to path integral molecular dynamics while allowing temperature transfer without retraining.

entry.title: Convergence Analysis of Randomized Subspace Normalized SGD under Heavy-Tailed Noise

entry.summary: Proves high-probability convergence bounds for randomized subspace SGD under heavy-tailed noise. Proposes RS-NSGD with direction normalization for better convergence under bounded p-th moments.

entry.title: Improving X-Codec-2.0 for Multi-Lingual Speech: 25 Hz Latent Rate and 24 kHz Sampling

entry.summary: Improves X-Codec-2.0 for multilingual speech by reducing latent rate from 50Hz to 25Hz and increasing sampling rate to 24kHz through simple pooling and hop size modifications. Achieves 0.29 MOS improvement.

entry.title: MuVaC: AVariational Causal Framework for Multimodal Sarcasm Understanding in Dialogues

entry.title: A Dialectic Pipeline for Improving LLM Robustness

entry.title: TeleStyle: Content-Preserving Style Transfer in Images and Videos

entry.title: Primitive-Driven Acceleration of Hyperdimensional Computing for Real-Time Image Classification

entry.summary: Proposes primitive-driven FPGA acceleration for Hyperdimensional Computing image classification, developing an image-encoding algorithm similar to CNNs and optimizing core HDC operations for real-time performance.

entry.title: Concentration Inequalities for Exchangeable Tensors and Matrix-valued Data

entry.summary: Develops Hoeffding and Bernstein-type concentration inequalities for structured weighted sums under exchangeability, including tensor inner products and sequential matrix sums. The bounds recover known results for special cases with optimal constants while extending to new settings.

entry.title: Spectral Bayesian Regression on the Sphere

author.name: Claudio Durastanti

entry.summary: Presents a fully intrinsic Bayesian framework for nonparametric regression on the sphere using isotropic Gaussian field priors and spherical harmonics. Derives closed-form posteriors, optimal spectral truncation schemes, and sharp posterior contraction rates for spherical Matérn priors.

entry.title: Multimodal Multi-Agent Ransomware Analysis Using AutoGen

The method successfully rediscovers known physical constraints and probes previously unexplored regions.

author.name: Abdul Hasib, A. S. M. Ahsanul Sarkar Akib, Nihal Das Ankur, Anish Giri

entry.summary: Presents a dual-modality IoT framework combining RFID access control with environmental safety monitoring through a unified cloud architecture, with Google Sheets logging and multi-sensor integration.

entry.title: Research Summary: January 28, 2026

author.name: AATF AI News Aggregator

entry.summary:
Today's research spans AI security capabilities, safety empirics, and deep learning theory. AISLE's AI discovered all 12 OpenSSL zero-days, a landmark demonstration of automated vulnerability detection at a critical scale.

  • Disempowerment study analyzes 1.5M Claude conversations, finding severe disempowerment in <0.1% of interactions—first large-scale empirical safety research of this kind
  • Surgical sycophancy correction identifies the 3% of neurons responsible and removes the behavior while preserving capabilities via sparse autoencoders
  • Thought-Transfer (Google) reveals CoT reasoning models are vulnerable to indirect targeted poisoning attacks

Theoretical advances include the first rigorous grokking bounds in ridge regression and a proof that deep networks learn Random Hierarchy Models through hierarchical feature composition. Keel revives Post-LayerNorm by replacing residual paths with Legendre polynomials for stable training at depth. Differential voting connects RLHF reward aggregation to social choice theory, deriving loss functions satisfying specific voting axioms. VP-RL addresses PRM-RL mismatch by penalizing only from the first incorrect reasoning step.

entry.title: AI found 12 of 12 OpenSSL zero-days (while curl cancelled its bug bounty)

author.name: Stanislav Fort

entry.summary: Reports that AISLE's AI system discovered all 12 newly announced OpenSSL zero-day vulnerabilities. Demonstrates AI-based cybersecurity capabilities at unprecedented scale while curl's bug bounty was cancelled due to AI spam.

entry.title: Who's in Charge? Disempowerment Patterns in Real-World LLM Usage

author.name: Mrinank Sharma, Miles McCain, Raymond Douglas, David Duvenaud

entry.summary: First large-scale empirical analysis of disempowerment patterns in 1.5M Claude.ai conversations, finding severe disempowerment occurs in <0.1% of conversations with substantially higher rates in relationship-focused interactions.

entry.title: A Few Bad Neurons: Isolating and Surgically Correcting Sycophancy

author.name: Claire O'Brien, Jessica Seto, Dristi Roy, Aditya Dwivedi, Sunishchal Dev, Kevin Zhu, Sean O'Brien, Ashwinee Panda, Ryan Lagasse

entry.summary: Proposes surgical approach to fixing sycophancy in LLMs by identifying the 3% of neurons most responsible using sparse autoencoders and linear probes, then fine-tuning only those neurons with gradient masking.

entry.title: Visual Generation Unlocks Human-Like Reasoning through Multimodal World Models

author.name: Jialong Wu, Xiaoying Zhang, Hongyi Yuan, Xiangcheng Zhang, Tianhao Huang, Changjing He, Chaoyi Deng, Renrui Zhang, Youbin Wu, Mingsheng Long

entry.summary: Argues that visual generation capabilities unlock human-like reasoning through multimodal world models, enabling better performance in physical and spatial intelligence domains where verbal reasoning alone is insufficient.

entry.title: Save the Good Prefix: Precise Error Penalization via Process-Supervised RL to Enhance LLM Reasoning

author.name: Haolin Liu, Dian Yu, Sidi Lu, Yujun Zhou, Rui Liu, Zhenwen Liang, Haitao Mi, Chen-Yu Wei, Dong Yu

entry.summary: Proposes Verifiable Process-Supervised RL (VP-RL) that uses PRMs to detect first incorrect step and penalizes only from that point onward, bridging gap between PRM evaluation (error detection) and RL usage (raw rewards).

entry.title: Post-LayerNorm Is Back: Stable, ExpressivE, and Deep

author.name: Chen Chen, Lai Wei

entry.summary: Revisits Post-LayerNorm transformers which were abandoned due to training instability, proposing 'Keel' which replaces ResNet-style residual paths with Highway-style connections. Claims to solve the gradient vanishing problem enabling reliable training at extreme depths with superior expressivity.

entry.title: My favourite version of an international AGI project

entry.summary: Will MacAskill outlines proposal for international AGI development project giving non-US countries meaningful but circumscribed influence over key decisions. Modeled on Intelsat's international collaboration structure.

entry.title: Out-of-Distribution Generalization for Neural Physics Solvers

author.name: Zhao Wei, Chin Chun Ooi, Jian Cheng Wong, Abhishek Gupta, Pao-Hsiung Chiu, Yew-Soon Ong

entry.summary: Introduces NOVA for generalizable neural physics solvers achieving 1-2 orders of magnitude lower out-of-distribution errors by learning physics-aligned representations from sparse initial scenarios.

entry.title: Differential Voting: Loss Functions For Axiomatically Diverse Aggregation of Heterogeneous Preferences

author.name: Zhiyu An, Duaa Nakshbandi, Wan Du

entry.summary: Introduces differential voting framework connecting RLHF aggregation mechanisms to voting theory, deriving loss functions that satisfy different axiomatic properties beyond the default BTL/Borda count approach.

entry.title: GAVEL: Towards rule-based safety through activation monitoring

author.name: Shir Rozenfeld, Rahul Pankajakshan, Itay Zloczower, Eyal Lenga, Gilad Gressel, Yisroel Mirsky

entry.summary: Introduces GAVEL for rule-based activation safety, modeling activations as composable cognitive elements (CEs) like 'making a threat' and 'payment processing' inspired by cybersecurity rule-sharing practices.

entry.title: Axe: A Simple Unified Layout Abstraction for Machine Learning Compilers

author.name: Bohan Hou, Hongyi Jin, Guanjie Wang, Jinqi Chen, Yaxing Cai, Lijie Yang, Zihao Ye, Yaoyao Ding, Ruihang Lai, Tianqi Chen

entry.summary: Presents Axe Layout from Tianqi Chen's group, a hardware-aware abstraction mapping logical tensor coordinates to multi-axis physical space, unifying tiling, sharding, and replication across device meshes.

entry.title: LLM-VA: Resolving the Jailbreak-Overrefusal Trade-off via Vector Alignment

author.name: Haonan Zhang, Dongxia Wang, Yi Liu, Kexin Chen, Wenhai Wang

entry.summary: Proposes LLM-VA that aligns answer vectors with benign vectors through closed-form weight updates to resolve the jailbreak-overrefusal trade-off without fine-tuning.

entry.title: When Iterative RAG Beats Ideal Evidence: A Diagnostic Study in Scientific Multi-hop Question Answering

author.name: Mahdi Astaraki, Mohammad Arshi Saloot, Ali Shiraee Kasmaee, Hamidreza Mahyar, Soheila Samiee

entry.summary: First controlled diagnostic study showing iterative RAG can outperform providing all oracle evidence at once in scientific multi-hop QA. Benchmarks 11 SOTA LLMs under No Context, Gold Context, and Iterative RAG regimes.

entry.title: Provable Learning of Random Hierarchy Models and Hierarchical Shallow-to-Deep Chaining

author.name: Yunwei Ren, Yatin Dandi, Florent Krzakala, Jason D. Lee

entry.summary: Proves that deep networks trained by gradient methods can efficiently learn Random Hierarchy Models, demonstrating provable hierarchical learning separating deep from shallow networks.

entry.title: To Grok Grokking: Provable Grokking in Ridge Regression

author.name: Mingyue Xu, Gal Vardi, Itay Safran

entry.summary: Proves end-to-end grokking in ridge regression: overfitting, delayed poor generalization, then eventual generalization. Shows grokking can be amplified or eliminated through hyperparameter tuning.

entry.title: Thought-Transfer: Indirect Targeted Poisoning Attacks on Chain-of-Thought Reasoning Models

author.name: Harsh Chaudhari, Ethan Rathbum, Hanna Foerster, Jamie Hayes, Matthew Jagielski, Milad Nasr, Ilia Shumailov, Alina Oprea

entry.summary: Reveals vulnerability in Chain-of-Thought reasoning models to indirect targeted poisoning attacks that manipulate responses without explicit triggered queries with flawed reasoning in training data. Attacks the reasoning traces themselves.

entry.title: Thoughts on Claude's Constitution

author.name: Boaz Barak

entry.summary: Boaz Barak (OpenAI alignment team) compares Claude's Constitution to OpenAI's Model Spec. Notes Claude's document emphasizes foundational character/values while Model Spec focuses on principles with specific authorities.

entry.title: Agentic Design Patterns: A System-Theoretic Framework

author.name: Minh-Dung Dao, Quy Minh Le, Hoang Thanh Lam, Duc-Trong Le, Quoc-Viet Pham, Barry O'Sullivan, Hoang D. Nguyen

entry.summary: Proposes a system-theoretic framework for agentic AI design, deconstructing systems into five functional subsystems (Reasoning & World Model, Memory, Tools, etc.) to provide principled engineering methodology.

entry.title: FROST: Filtering Reasoning Outliers with Attention for Efficient Reasoning

author.name: Haozheng Luo, Zhuolin Jiang, Md Zahid Hasan, Yan Chen, Soumalya Sarkar

entry.summary: Proposes FROST, an attention-aware method that prunes uncritical reasoning paths as 'reasoning outliers', achieving 69.68% token reduction and 26.70% performance improvement over baselines.

entry.title: Benchmarks Saturate When The Model Gets Smarter Than The Judge

author.name: Marthe Ballon, Andres Algaba, Brecht Verbeken, Vincent Ginis

entry.summary: Presents Omni-MATH-2, a manually revised benchmark with 4,181 clean exact-answer problems and 247 tagged non-standard problems, arguing that benchmarks saturate when models outperform evaluation mechanisms.

entry.title: Selective Steering: Norm-Preserving Control Through Discriminative Layer Selection

author.name: Quy-Anh Dang, Chris Ngo

entry.summary: Proposes Selective Steering for LLM safety that addresses limitations of activation steering methods through discriminative layer selection and norm preservation.

entry.title: DART: Diffusion-Inspired Speculative Decoding for Fast LLM Inference

author.name: Fuliang Liu, Xue Li, Ketai Zhao, Yinxi Gao, Ziyan Zhou, Zhonghui Zhang, Zhibin Wang, Wanchun Dou, Sheng Zhong, Chen Tian

entry.summary: Proposes DART, diffusion-inspired speculative decoding that predicts logits for multiple masked positions in parallel within single forward pass. Eliminates autoregressive rollouts in draft model while preserving lightweight design.

entry.title: Beyond In-Domain Detection: SpikeScore for Cross-Domain Hallucination Detection

author.name: Yongxin Deng, Zhen Fang, Yixuan Li, Ling Chen

entry.summary: Addresses generalizable hallucination detection (GHD) by discovering that hallucination-initiated multi-turn dialogues show larger uncertainty fluctuations (spikes), proposing SpikeScore metric that generalizes across domains.

entry.title: Randomization Boosts KV Caching, Learning Balances Query Load: A Joint Perspective

author.name: Fangzhou Wu (Richard), Sandeep Silwal (Richard), Qiuyi (Richard), Zhang

entry.summary: Provides first unified mathematical model for KV cache eviction and query routing tradeoffs in multi-LLM serving, revealing theoretical limitations and deriving principled algorithms integrating randomization and learning.

entry.title: Group Distributionally Robust Optimization-Driven Reinforcement Learning for LLM Reasoning

author.name: Kishan Panaganti, Zhenwen Liang, Wenhao Yu, Haitao Mi, Dong Yu

entry.summary: Proposes Multi-Adversary Group Distributionally Robust Optimization (GDRO) for LLM reasoning that dynamically adapts training to heterogeneous, heavy-tailed reasoning data rather than uniform sampling.

entry.title: When Benchmarks Leak: Inference-Time Decontamination for LLMs

author.name: Jianzhe Chai, Yu Zhe, Jun Sakuma

entry.summary: Proposes inference-time decontamination for LLMs that preserves benchmark integrity while suppressing contaminated behavior without interfering with normal inference.

entry.title: Fixed Aggregation Features Can Rival GNNs

author.name: Celia Rubio-Madrigal, Rebekka Burkholz

entry.summary: Challenges GNN necessity by showing Fixed Aggregation Features (FAFs) with tabular methods rival or outperform SOTA GNNs on 12/14 benchmarks, often using only mean aggregation.

entry.title: Neural Neural Scaling Laws

author.name: Michael Y. Hu, Jane Pan, Ayush Rajesh Jhaveri, Nicholas Lourie, Kyunghyun Cho

entry.summary: Proposes Neural Neural Scaling Laws (NeuNeu) predicting downstream task performance using neural networks for time-series extrapolation, addressing diverse scaling behaviors beyond aggregate metrics.

entry.title: Self-Distillation Enables Continual Learning

author.name: Idan Shenfeld, Mehul Damani, Jonas H\"ubotter, Pulkit Agrawal

entry.summary: Introduces Self-Distillation Fine-Tuning (SDFT) for continual learning in foundation models, using in-context learning to create on-policy training signals from demonstrations. Enables learning new skills while preserving prior capabilities without explicit reward functions.

entry.title: Malicious Repurposing of Open Science Artefacts by Using Large Language Models

author.name: Zahra Hashemi, Zhiqiang Zhong, Jun Pang, Wei Zhao

entry.summary: Introduces pipeline for malicious repurposing of open science artifacts (datasets, methods, tools) using LLMs via persuasion-based jailbreaking. Demonstrates risks of LLMs identifying vulnerabilities in NLP papers for harmful research.

entry.title: The Claude Constitution’s Ethical Framework

author.name: Zvi

entry.summary: Zvi's detailed analysis of Claude Constitution's virtue ethics approach. Argues the focus on character and values rather than rules is a wise choice for AI alignment that mirrors effective human ethical development.

entry.title: Representational Homomorphism Predicts and Improves Compositional Generalization In Transformer Language Model

author.name: Zhiyu An, Wan Du

entry.summary: Introduces Homomorphism Error metric to quantify deviations from approximate homomorphisms between expression algebra and model representations, showing it predicts and improves compositional generalization.

entry.title: Pixel-Grounded Retrieval for Knowledgeable Large Multimodal Models

author.name: Jeonghwan Kim, Renjie Tao, Sanat Sharma, Jiaqi Wang, Kai Sun, Zhaojiang Lin, Seungwhan Moon, Lambert Mathias, Anuj Kumar, Heng Ji, Xin Luna Dong

entry.summary: Proposes PixSearch, an end-to-end segmenting LMM that unifies region-level perception with retrieval-augmented reasoning, generating pixel-level masks as visual queries without modular pipelines.

entry.title: RPO:Reinforcement Fine-Tuning with Partial Reasoning Optimization

author.name: Hongzhu Yi, Xinming Wang, Zhenghao zhang, Tianyu Zong, Yuanxiang Wang, Jun Xie, Tao Yu, Haopeng Jin, Zhepeng Wang, Kaixin Xu, Feng Chen, Jiahuan Chen, Yujia Yang, Zhenyu Guan, Bingkang Shi, Jungang Xu

entry.summary: Proposes RPO (Partial Reasoning Optimization), a plug-and-play RL fine-tuning algorithm that trains on reasoning path suffixes rather than full trajectories, reducing computational overhead during the rollout phase.

entry.title: LLMs versus the Halting Problem: Revisiting Program Termination Prediction

author.name: Oren Sultan, Jordi Armengol-Estape, Pascal Kesseli, Julien Vanegue, Dafna Shahaf, Yossi Adi, Peter O'Hearn

entry.summary: Evaluates LLMs on program termination prediction using benchmarks from the International Competition on Software Verification, connecting foundational CS theory to modern LLM capabilities.

entry.title: SHIELD: An Auto-Healing Agentic Defense Framework for LLM Resource Exhaustion Attacks

author.name: Nirhoshan Sivaroopan, Kanchana Thilakarathna, Albert Zomaya, Manu, Yi Guo, Jo Plested, Tim Lynar, Jack Yang, Wangli Yang

entry.summary: Proposes SHIELD, a multi-agent auto-healing defense framework against LLM resource exhaustion (sponge) attacks with self-updating knowledge base and prompt optimization.

entry.title: Innovator-VL: A Multimodal Large Language Model for Scientific Discovery

author.name: Zichen Wen, Boxue Yang, Shuang Chen, Yaojie Zhang, Yuhang Han, Junlong Ke, Cong Wang, Yicheng Fu, Jiawang Zhao, Jiangchao Yao, Xi Fang, Zhen Wang, Henxing Cai, Lin Yao, Zhifeng Gao, Yanhui Hong, Nang Yuan, Yixuan Li, Guojiang Zhao, Haoyi Tao, Nan Wang, Han Lyu, Guolin Ke, Ning Liao, Xiaoxing Wang, Kai Chen, Zhiyu Li, Feiyu Xiong, Sihan Hu, Kun Chen, Yanfeng Wang, Weinan E, Linfeng Zhang, Linfeng Zhang

entry.summary: Presents Innovator-VL, a scientific multimodal LLM with fully transparent, reproducible training pipeline covering data collection through evaluation, reducing data requirements through principled design.

entry.title: Revisiting Parameter Server in LLM Post-Training

author.name: Xinyi Wan, Penghui Qi, Guangxing Huang, Chaoyi Ruan, Min Lin, Jialin Li

entry.summary: Proposes On-Demand Communication (ODC) adapting parameter server paradigm to FSDP for handling imbalanced workloads in LLM post-training caused by variable sequence lengths.

entry.title: Safe Exploration via Policy Priors

author.name: Manuel Wendl, Yarden As, Manish Prajapat, Anton Pollak, Stelian Coros, Andreas Krause

entry.summary: Proposes SOOPER for safe RL exploration using conservative policy priors, with provable safety guarantees throughout learning and bounded cumulative regret.

entry.title: R^3: Replay, Reflection, and Ranking Rewards for LLM Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Zhizheng Jiang, Kang Zhao, Weikai Xu, Xinkui Lin, Wei Liu, Jian Luan, Shuo Shang, Peng Han

entry.summary: Proposes R³ for LLM reinforcement learning with cross-context replay, self-reflection, and ranking rewards to address advantage collapse in group-based policy optimization.

entry.title: RvB: Automating AI System Hardening via Iterative Red-Blue Games

author.name: Lige Huang, Zicheng Liu, Jie Zhang, Lewen Yan, Dongrui Liu, Jing Shao

entry.summary: Proposes RvB (Red vs Blue) framework formulating AI system hardening as training-free sequential game where red team attacks drive blue team to learn defensive principles.

entry.title: How Is Uncertainty Propagated in Knowledge Distillation?

author.name: Ziyao Cui, Jian Pei

entry.summary: Systematically studies uncertainty propagation through knowledge distillation across linear regression, neural networks, and LLMs, distinguishing inter-student and intra-student uncertainty and proposing corrections.

entry.title: On the Expressiveness of State Space Models via Temporal Logics

author.name: Eric Alsmann, Lowejatan Noori, Martin Lange

entry.summary: Investigates expressive power of State Space Models through temporal logic, showing capabilities vary substantially with gating mechanism. Distinguishes between fixed-width arithmetic (regular languages) and unbounded precision (counting properties).

entry.title: Automated Safety Benchmarking: A Multi-agent Pipeline for LVLMs

author.name: Xiangyang Zhu, Yuan Tian, Zicheng Zhang, Qi Jia, Chunyi Li, Renrui Zhang, Heng Li, Zongrui Wang, Wei Sun

entry.summary: Proposes VLSafetyBencher, first automated system for LVLM safety benchmarking using four collaborative agents. Addresses limitations of static benchmarks that fail to keep pace with evolving models and risks.

entry.title: Identifying and Transferring Reasoning-Critical Neurons: Improving LLM Inference Reliability via Activation Steering

author.name: Fangan Dong, Zuming Yan, Xuri Ge, Zhiwei Xu, Mengqi Zhang, Xuanang Chen, Ben He, Xin Xin, Zhumin Chen, Ying Zhou

entry.summary: Proposes AdaRAS framework identifying Reasoning-Critical Neurons (RCNs) in LLMs and adaptively steering activations during inference to improve reasoning reliability. Lightweight test-time intervention without post-training.

entry.title: Clarifying how our AI timelines forecasts have changed since AI 2027

author.name: elifland

entry.summary: Clarifies AI 2027 authors' views on AI timelines following media misrepresentation. Emphasizes continued uncertainty about AGI timing while noting evolution of forecasting models and methodology.

entry.title: GUIGuard: Toward a General Framework for Privacy-Preserving GUI Agents

author.name: Yanxi Wang, Zhiling Zhang, Wenbo Zhou, Weiming Zhang, Jie Zhang, Qiannan Zhu, Yu Shi, Shuxin Zheng, Jiyan He

entry.summary: Proposes GUIGuard, a three-stage framework (privacy recognition, protection, task execution) for privacy-preserving GUI agents, with GUIGuard-Bench benchmark of 630 trajectories across platforms.

entry.title: FloydNet: A Learning Paradigm for Global Relational Reasoning

author.name: Jingcheng Yu, Mingliang Zeng, Qiwei Ye

entry.summary: Introduces FloydNet, an architecture for global relational reasoning based on dynamic programming rather than local message passing, maintaining global all-pairs relationship tensors with learned DP operators.

entry.title: Neural Theorem Proving for Verification Conditions: A Real-World Benchmark

author.name: Qiyuan Xu, Xiaokun Luan, Renxi Wang, Joshua Ong Jun Leang, Peixin Wang, Haonan Li, Wenda Li, Conrad Watt

entry.summary: Creates first benchmark specifically targeting Neural Theorem Proving for Verification Conditions in program verification, addressing a critical bottleneck where automated provers fail and manual proofs are required.

entry.title: The Geometric Reasoner: Manifold-Informed Latent Foresight Search for Long-Context Reasoning

author.name: Ren Zhuang, Ben Wang, Shuifa Sun

entry.summary: Introduces The Geometric Reasoner (TGR), a training-free framework for long chain-of-thought reasoning using manifold-informed latent foresight search with chunk-wise KV cache resets for linear memory.

entry.title: Principled Fine-tuning of LLMs from User-Edits: A Medley of Preference, Supervision, and Reward

author.name: Dipendra Misra, Aldo Pacchiano, Ta-Chung Chi, Ge Gao

entry.summary: Provides theoretical investigation of learning from user edits in LLM fine-tuning, unifying preference, supervised, and reward feedback types and deriving bounds showing different algorithms have complementary strengths.

entry.title: Detecting and Correcting Hallucinations in LLM-Generated Code via Deterministic AST Analysis

author.name: Dipin Khati, Daniel Rodriguez-Cardenas, Paul Pantzer, Denys Poshyvanyk

entry.summary: Proposes a deterministic AST-based framework to detect and auto-correct code hallucinations (Knowledge Conflicting Hallucinations) in LLM-generated code by validating against a dynamically-built knowledge base via library introspection.

entry.title: StableQAT: Stable Quantization-Aware Training at Ultra-Low Bitwidths

author.name: Tianyi Chen, Sihan Chen, Xiaoyi Qu, Dan Zhao, Ruomei Yan, Jongwoo Ko, Luming Liang, Pashmina Cameron

entry.summary: Introduces StableQAT using a novel surrogate for backpropagation derived from discrete Fourier analysis of rounding operator, enabling stable quantization-aware training at ultra-low bitwidths.

entry.title: From Atoms to Chains: Divergence-Guided Reasoning Curriculum for Unlabeled LLM Domain Adaptation

author.name: Yongqi Wang, Xiaofeng Ji, Jie Wang, Qingbin Li, Xiao Xiong, Zheming Yang, Jian Xu, Minghui Qiu, Xinxiao Wu

entry.summary: Proposes Divergence-Guided Reasoning Curriculum (DGRC) for adapting LLMs to domains without labeled data by decomposing complex problems into atomic sub-problems where LLMs show high fidelity.

entry.title: Speed is Confidence

author.name: Joshua V. Dillon

entry.summary: Proposes using first-to-halt prediction in TRM ensembles as implicit confidence measure, achieving 97.2% on Sudoku-Extreme with 10x less compute than test-time augmentation.

entry.title: Native LLM and MLLM Inference at Scale on Apple Silicon

author.name: Wayner Barrios

entry.summary: Presents vllm-mlx for efficient LLM/MLLM inference on Apple Silicon, achieving 21-87% higher throughput than llama.cpp with continuous batching and content-based prefix caching for multimodal.

entry.title: Smoothing the Score Function for Generalization in Diffusion Models: An Optimization-based Explanation Framework

author.name: Xinyu Zhou, Jiawei Zhang, Stephen J. Wright

entry.summary: Develops theoretical framework explaining diffusion model memorization as weighted softmax over Gaussian score functions, showing neural network approximation smooths this and improves generalization.

entry.title: GraphDLG: Exploring Deep Leakage from Gradients in Federated Graph Learning

author.name: Shuyue Wei, Wantong Chen, Tongyu Wei, Chen Gong, Yongxin Tong, Lizhen Cui

entry.summary: First analysis of deep leakage from gradients in federated graph learning, showing graph structure recovery enables node feature extraction, proposing GraphDLG attack.

entry.title: Calibration without Ground Truth

author.name: Yuqing Kong, Mingyu Song, Yizhou Wang, Yifan Wu

entry.summary: Proposes label-free post-processing framework improving miscalibrated models using weaker but better-calibrated reference, guaranteeing strict improvement under any proper loss when models aren't mutually calibrated.

entry.title: How Do Transformers Learn to Associate Tokens: Gradient Leading Terms Bring Mechanistic Interpretability

author.name: Shawn Im, Changdae Oh, Zhen Fang, Sharon Li

entry.summary: Analyzes how semantic associations (e.g., 'bird'-'flew') emerge in attention-based language models through training dynamics. Derives closed-form expressions for weights at early training stages explaining association learning.

entry.title: Flatter Tokens are More Valuable for Speculative Draft Model Training

author.name: Jiaming Fan, Daming Cao, Xiangzhong Luo, Jiale Fu, Chonghan Liu, Xu Yang

entry.summary: Proposes data-centric approach to speculative decoding draft model training. Shows tokens with flatter target model distributions are more valuable, introduces flatness metric and dataset distillation approach SFDD.

entry.title: MetaGen: Self-Evolving Roles and Topologies for Multi-Agent LLM Reasoning

author.name: Yimeng Wang, Jiaxing Zhao, Hongbin Xie, Hexing Ma, Yuzhen Lei, Shuangxue Liu, Xuan Song, Zichen Zhang, Haoran Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces MetaGen, training-free framework that adapts both role space and collaboration topology of multi-agent LLM systems at inference time. Generates query-conditioned role specifications and rewrites them during reasoning.

entry.title: Towards Pixel-Level VLM Perception via Simple Points Prediction

author.name: Tianhui Song, Haoyu Lu, Hao Yang, Lin Sui, Haoning Wu, Zaida Zhou, Zhiqi Huang, Yiping Bao, Y. Charles, Xinyu Zhou, Limin Wang

entry.summary: Presents SimpleSeg, enabling MLLMs to perform pixel-level segmentation by predicting point sequences as text coordinates. Uses SF→RL training pipeline with IoU-based rewards, demonstrating inherent low-level perception capacity of standard MLLMs without specialized architecture.

entry.title: PROTEUS: SLA-Aware Routing via Lagrangian RL for Multi-LLM Serving Systems

author.name: Amit Singh Bhatti, Vishal Vaddina, Dagnachew Birru

entry.summary: Presents PROTEUS, an LLM router that accepts accuracy targets directly as runtime input using Lagrangian dual control, allowing operators to specify SLAs rather than tuning opaque parameters.

entry.title: Reducing False Positives in Static Bug Detection with LLMs: An Empirical Study in Industry

author.name: Xueying Du, Jiayi Feng, Yi Zou, Wei Xu, Jie Ma, Wei Zhang, Sisi Liu, Xin Peng, Yiling Lou
