entry.summary: Presents neuromorphic Braille reading pipeline using Evetac event-based tactile sensor with ResNet classifier. Achieves continuous reading mimicking human finger-scanning without discrete character scanning.

entry.title: Algorithmic Prompt-Augmentation for Efficient LLM-Based Heuristic Design for A* Search

author.name: Thomas B\"omer, Nico Koltermann, Max Disselnmeyer, Bastian Amberg, Anne Meyer

entry.summary: Extends Evolution of Heuristics framework with algorithmic prompt augmentation (A-CEoH) that includes A* code in prompts to leverage in-context learning for automated heuristic design.

entry.title: PCEvo: Path-Consistent Molecular Representation via Virtual Evolutionary

author.name: Kun Li, Longtao Hu, Yida Xiong, Jiajun Yu, Hongzhi Zhang, Jiameng Chen, Xiantao Cai, Jia Wu, Wenbin Hu

entry.summary: Introduces PCEvo, a path-consistent molecular representation method that learns from virtual evolutionary paths between similar molecules for few-shot property prediction.

entry.title: Learned split-spectrum metalens for obstruction-free broadband imaging in the visible

author.name: Seungwoo Yoon, Dohyun Kang, Eunsue Choi, Sohyun Lee, Seoyeon Kim, Minho Choi, Hyeonsu Heo, Dong-ha Shin, Suha Kwak, Arka Majumdar, Junsuk Rho, Seung-Hwan Baek

entry.summary: Introduces learned split-spectrum metalens combining hardware (metalens) and AI for broadband obstruction-free imaging by dividing spectrum into pass/stop bands.

entry.title: AI Cap-and-Trade: Efficiency Incentives for Accessibility and Sustainability

author.name: Marco Bornstein, Amrit Singh Bedi

entry.summary: Proposes market-based mechanisms (cap-and-trade) to incentivize AI efficiency, arguing that current hyper-scaling approach marginalizes smaller players and increases environmental costs.

entry.title: Latent Structural Similarity Networks for Unsupervised Discovery in Multivariate Time Series

author.name: Olusegun Owoeye

entry.summary: Proposes a task-agnostic discovery layer for multivariate time series that learns entity-level embeddings and induces sparse similarity networks without assuming linearity, stationarity, or downstream objectives.

entry.title: How Much Temporal Modeling is Enough? A Systematic Study of Hybrid CNN-RNN Architectures for Multi-Label ECG Classification

author.name: Alireza Jafari, Fatemeh Jafari

entry.summary: Systematic evaluation of CNN-RNN hybrid architectures for multi-label ECG classification, examining whether deep/stacked recurrent layers are necessary for capturing temporal dependencies in cardiac signals.

entry.title: One Global Model, Many Behaviors: Stockout-Aware Feature Engineering and Dynamic Scaling for Multi-Horizon Retail Demand Forecasting with a Cost-Aware Ordering Policy (VN2 Winner Report)

author.name: Bartosz Szab{\l}owski

entry.summary: Winning solution for VN2 Inventory Planning Challenge using two-stage predict-then-optimize pipeline with global multi-horizon forecasting and cost-aware ordering policy for retail demand.

entry.title: FSD-CAP: Fractional Subgraph Diffusion with Class-Aware Propagation for Graph Feature Imputation

author.name: Xin Qiao, Shijie Sun, Anqi Dong, Cong Hua, Xia Zhao, Longfei Zhang, Guangming Zhu, Liang Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes FSD-CAP for graph feature imputation using fractional diffusion on local subgraphs and class-aware propagation refinement, targeting high missing rate scenarios.

entry.title: Attention-Enhanced Graph Filtering for False Data Injection Attack Detection and Localization

author.name: Ruslan Abdulin, Mohammad Rasoul Narimani

entry.summary: Proposes attention-enhanced graph filtering for detecting false data injection attacks in power systems, addressing limitations of existing GNN approaches in capturing both local and global dependencies.

entry.title: Accelerated training of Gaussian processes using banded square exponential covariances

author.name: Emily C. Ehrhardt, Felipe Tobar

entry.summary: Proposes accelerated GP training by constructing banded approximations to SE covariance matrices, eliminating near-zero off-diagonal entries to reduce computational cost of inverse and determinant computation.

entry.title: Contrast-Source-Based Physics-Driven Neural Network for Inverse Scattering Problems

author.name: Yutong Du, Zicheng Liu

entry.summary: Proposes CSPDNN for inverse scattering problems predicting induced current distribution, incorporating adaptive total variation loss for robust reconstruction under varying contrast and noise.

entry.title: OSIRIS: Bridging Analog Circuit Design and Machine Learning with Scalable Dataset Generation

author.name: Giuseppe Chiari, Michele Piccoli, Davide Zoni

entry.summary: Introduces OSIRIS, a scalable framework for generating analog IC design datasets to enable ML-based automation, addressing limited data availability bottleneck.

entry.title: Advances in Diffusion-Based Generative Compression

author.name: Yibo Yang, Stephan Mandt

entry.summary: Provides a unifying review of diffusion-based methods for generative lossy compression, focusing on image compression. Surveys approaches where diffusion models iteratively refine encoded embeddings to produce realistic reconstructions at low bit-rates.

entry.title: Transparency-First Medical Language Models: Datasheets, Model Cards, and End-to-End Data Provenance for Clinical NLP

author.name: Olaf Yunus Laitinen Imanov, Taner Yilmaz, Ayse Tuba Tugrul, Melike Nesrin Zaman, Ozkan Gunalp, Duygu Erisken, Sila Burde Dulger, Rana Irem Turhan, Izzet Ozdemir, Derya Umut Kulali, Ozan Akbulut, Harun Demircioglu, Hasan Basri Kara, Berfin Tavan

entry.summary: Introduces TeMLM transparency artifacts for clinical language models including datasheets, model cards, and provenance tracking. Demonstrates on Technetium-I dataset with 498K synthetic clinical notes for PHI de-identification.

entry.title: Generalizable Equivariant Diffusion Models for Non-Abelian Lattice Gauge Theory

author.name: Gert Aarts, Diaa E. Habibi, Andreas Ipp, David I. M\"uller, Thomas R. Ranner, Lingxiao Wang, Wei Wang, Qianteng Zhu

entry.summary: Demonstrates gauge equivariant diffusion models can accurately model non-Abelian lattice gauge theory using Metropolis-adjusted annealed Langevin algorithm. Shows remarkable generalization to larger couplings and lattice sizes.

entry.title: PsyProbe: Proactive and Interpretable Dialogue through User State Modeling for Exploratory Counseling

author.name: Sohhyung Park, Hyunji Kang, Sungzoon Cho, Dongil Kim

entry.summary: Introduces PsyProbe dialogue system for counseling exploration phase with systematic psychological state tracking using PPPPPI framework and cognitive error detection. Combines multiple components for proactive therapeutic dialogue.

entry.title: DiaDem: Advancing Dialogue Descriptions in Audiovisual Video Captioning for Multimodal Large Language Models

author.name: Xinlong Chen, Weihong Lin, Jingyun Hua, Linli Yao, Yue Ding, Bozhou Li, Bohan Zeng, Yang Shi, Qiang Liu, Yuanxing Zhang, Pengfei Wan, Liang Wang, Tieniu Tan

entry.summary: Proposes DiaDem for accurate dialogue description in audiovisual video captioning using synthesized SFT dataset and difficulty-partitioned GRPO strategy. Introduces DiaDemBench for evaluating dialogue description capabilities.

entry.title: Formula-One Prompting: Adaptive Reasoning Through Equations For Applied Mathematics

author.name: Natapong Nitarach, Pittawat Taveekitworachai, Kunat Pipatanakul

entry.summary: Proposes Formula-One Prompting using mathematical equations as intermediate representation before adaptive solving strategy selection (CoT, PoT, or direct). Two-phase approach for applied mathematics problems.

entry.title: Rethinking Discrete Speech Representation Tokens for Accent Generation

author.name: Jinzuomu Zhong, Yi Wang, Korin Richmond, Peter Bell

entry.summary: Presents first systematic investigation of accent information in discrete speech representation tokens. Proposes Accent ABX evaluation task and analyzes how ASR supervision affects accent encoding in speech tokens.

entry.title: NC-Reg : Neural Cortical Maps for Rigid Registration

author.name: Ines Vati, Pierrick Bourgeat, Rodrigo Santa Cruz, Vincent Dore, Olivier Salvado, Clinton Fookes, L\'eo Lebrat

entry.summary: Introduces neural cortical maps as a continuous neural representation for cortical feature maps, achieving 30x faster runtimes than barycentric interpolation. Demonstrates NC-Reg algorithm for rigid registration of cortical surfaces.

entry.title: TIGaussian: Disentangle Gaussians for Spatial-Awared Text-Image-3D Alignment

author.name: Jiarun Liu, Qifeng Chen, Yiru Zhao, Minghua Liu, Baorui Ma, Sheng Yang

entry.summary: Proposes TIGaussian for text-image-3D alignment using 3D Gaussian Splatting characteristics. Uses multi-branch tokenizer to decouple 3DGS properties into compact latent representations for cross-modality alignment.

entry.title: HexFormer: Hyperbolic Vision Transformer with Exponential Map Aggregation

author.name: Haya Alyoussef, Ahmad Bdeir, Diego Coello de Portugal Mecke, Tom Hanika, Niels Landwehr, Lars Schmidt-Thieme

entry.summary: Introduces HexFormer, a hyperbolic vision transformer with exponential map aggregation for hierarchical image classification. Explores hyperbolic geometry for better modeling hierarchical visual structures.

entry.title: Learning the Pareto Space of Multi-Objective Autonomous Driving: A Modular, Data-Driven Approach

author.name: Mohammad Elayan, Wissam Kontar

entry.summary: Proposes empirical learning framework for deriving safety-efficiency-interaction trade-offs in autonomous driving from naturalistic trajectory data. Uses Pareto dominance to identify optimal driving states.

entry.title: Judgelight: Trajectory-Level Post-Optimization for Multi-Agent Path Finding via Closed-Subwalk Collapsing

author.name: Yimin Tang, Sven Koenig, Erdem B{\i}y{\i}k

entry.summary: Proposes Judgelight post-optimization for Multi-Agent Path Finding via closed-subwalk collapsing to remove redundant movements. Proves MAPF-Collapse is NP-hard and presents ILP formulation.

entry.title: Information-Theoretic Detection of Bimanual Interactions for Dual-Arm Robot Plan Generation

author.name: Elena Merlo, Marta Lagomarsino, Arash Ajoudani

entry.summary: Presents a one-shot method for generating dual-arm robot execution plans from a single RGB video of bimanual task demonstration. Uses information theory to detect hand coordination patterns and generates modular behavior trees.

entry.title: Prediction Markets as Bayesian Inverse Problems: Uncertainty Quantification, Identifiability, and Information Gain from Price-Volume Histories under Latent Types

author.name: Juan Pablo Madrigal-Cianci, Camilo Monsalve Maya, Lachlan Breakey

entry.summary: Formulates prediction markets as Bayesian inverse problems where event outcomes are inferred from price-volume histories. Introduces a mechanism-agnostic model accounting for heterogeneous trader types and microstructure noise.

entry.title: The Window for Political Revolution is Closing Soon

author.name: koanchuk

entry.summary: Argues that technological unemployment from AGI won't necessarily lead to social contracts protecting workers. Analyzes how historical revolutionary leverage requires numerical advantage that AI-enabled coercion could eliminate.

entry.title: Implicit Non-Causal Factors are Out via Dataset Splitting for Domain Generalization Object Detection

author.name: Zhilong Zhang, Lei Zhang, Qing He, Shuyin Xia, Guoyin Wang, Fuxiang Huang

entry.summary: Addresses domain generalization for object detection by tackling implicit non-causal factors through dataset splitting. Identifies limitations in domain adversarial learning approaches and proposes solutions for more robust generalization.

entry.title: Towards Gold-Standard Depth Estimation for Tree Branches in UAV Forestry: Benchmarking Deep Stereo Matching Methods

author.name: Yida Lin, Bing Xue, Mengjie Zhang, Sam Schofield, Richard Green

entry.summary: Presents first systematic zero-shot evaluation of eight stereo depth estimation methods on vegetation-dense environments using novel Canterbury Tree Branches dataset. Reveals scene-dependent performance patterns.

entry.title: SimTO: A simulation-based topology optimization framework for bespoke soft robotic grippers

author.name: Kurt Enkera, Josh Pinskier, Marcus Gallagher, David Howard

entry.summary: Proposes SimTO framework for topology optimization of bespoke soft robotic grippers tailored to feature-rich objects like gears and vegetables. Addresses grasping of geometrically complex objects.

entry.title: ComAgent: Multi-LLM based Agentic AI Empowered Intelligent Wireless Networks

author.name: Haoyun Li, Ming Xiao, Kezhi Wang, Robert Schober, Dong In Kim, Yong Liang Guan

entry.summary: Presents ComAgent, a multi-LLM framework for 6G network optimization using Perception-Planning-Action-Reflection cycles with specialized agents for literature search, coding, and scoring to generate solver-ready formulations.

entry.title: Bridging Visual and Wireless Sensing: A Unified Radiation Field for 3D Radio Map Construction

author.name: Chaozheng Wen, Jingwen Tong, Zehong Lin, Chenghong Bian, Jun Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes a unified radiation field framework bridging visual and wireless sensing for 3D radio map construction using principles governing both optical and electromagnetic propagation.

entry.title: Talos: Optimizing Top-$K$ Accuracy in Recommender Systems

author.name: Shengjia Zhang, Weiqin Yang, Jiawei Chen, Peng Wu, Yuegang Sun, Gang Wang, Qihao Shi, Can Wang

entry.summary: Proposes Talos, a loss function specifically designed to optimize Top-K recommendation accuracy while addressing distribution shifts in recommender systems.

entry.title: Instance-Guided Radar Depth Estimation for 3D Object Detection

author.name: Chen-Chou Lo, Patrick Vandewalle

entry.summary: Proposes InstaRadar framework for monocular 3D object detection using instance segmentation-guided radar point expansion and depth estimation.

entry.title: Mocap Anywhere: Towards Pairwise-Distance based Motion Capture in the Wild (for the Wild)

author.name: Ofir Abramovich, Ariel Shamir, Andreas Aristidou

entry.summary: Introduces Wild-Poser, a motion capture system using only sparse pairwise distance measurements from UWB sensors, enabling robust outdoor and uncontrolled environment capture.

entry.title: GMS-CAVP: Improving Audio-Video Correspondence with Multi-Scale Contrastive and Generative Pretraining

author.name: Shentong Mo, Zehua Chen, Jun Zhu

entry.summary: Proposes GMS-CAVP combining multi-scale video-audio alignment with spatial-temporal diffusion for improved audio-video correspondence learning.

entry.title: Statistical Inference for Explainable Boosting Machines

author.name: Haimo Fang, Kevin Tan, Jonathan Pipping, Giles Hooker

entry.summary: Provides statistical inference methods for Explainable Boosting Machines without computationally expensive bootstrapping, using Boulevard regularization to enable convergence analysis. Offers theoretical guarantees and practical uncertainty quantification.

entry.title: Transformer Learning of Chaotic Collective Dynamics in Many-Body Systems

author.name: Ho Jang, Gia-Wei Chern

entry.summary: Demonstrates transformers can learn chaotic collective dynamics in many-body systems by selectively reweighting long-range temporal correlations. Applied to Holstein model showing non-Markovian reduced descriptions from time-series data.

entry.title: Task-Centric Policy Optimization from Misaligned Motion Priors

author.name: Ziang Zheng, Kai Feng, Yi Nie, Shentao Qin

entry.summary: Proposes Task-Centric Motion Priors (TCMP) for humanoid control that treats imitation as conditional regularizer rather than co-equal objective. Addresses misalignment between motion demonstrations and robotic tasks.

entry.title: Do LLMs Truly Benefit from Longer Context in Automatic Post-Editing?

author.name: Ahrii Kim, Seong-heum Kim

entry.summary: Systematically compares proprietary and open-weight LLMs for automatic post-editing under document-level context. Finds proprietary LLMs achieve near human-level quality even with simple prompting regardless of document context.

entry.title: RATE: Reviewer Profiling and Annotation-free Training for Expertise Ranking in Peer Review Systems

author.name: Weicong Liu, Zixuan Yang, Yibo Zhao, Xiang Li

entry.summary: Introduces LR-bench benchmark for reviewer assignment with self-assessed familiarity ratings and RATE framework for reviewer profiling. Addresses challenges of outdated benchmarks and proxy signal limitations.

entry.title: Non-Invasive 3D Wound Measurement with RGB-D Imaging

author.name: Lena Hark\"amper, Leo Lebrat, David Ahmedt-Aristizabal, Olivier Salvado, Mattias Heinrich, Rodrigo Santa Cruz

entry.summary: Presents a non-invasive 3D wound measurement algorithm using RGB-D imaging with B-spline surface reconstruction. Achieves sub-millimeter accuracy on wound phantoms for clinical wound monitoring applications.

entry.title: VC-Bench: Pioneering the Video Connecting Benchmark with a Dataset and Evaluation Metrics

author.name: Zhiyu Yin, Zhipeng Liu, Kehai Chen, Lemao Liu, Jin Liu, Hong-Dong Li, Yang Xiang, Min Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces VC-Bench, a benchmark for video connecting task with 1,579 videos across 15 categories. Proposes evaluation metrics for generating smooth intermediate content between video clips.

entry.title: Bridging Information Asymmetry: A Hierarchical Framework for Deterministic Blind Face Restoration

author.name: Zhengjian Yao, Jiakui Hu, Kaiwen Li, Hangzhou He, Xinliang Zhang, Shuang Zeng, Lei Zhu, Yanye Lu

entry.summary: Proposes Pref-Restore for blind face restoration addressing information asymmetry through hierarchical framework integrating discrete semantic logic with continuous texture generation for deterministic outputs.

entry.title: SharpNet: Enhancing MLPs to Represent Functions with Controlled Non-differentiability

author.name: Hanting Niu, Junkai Deng, Fei Hou, Wencheng Wang, Ying He

entry.summary: Presents SharpNet, modified MLP architecture capable of representing functions with prescribed C0 sharp features. Enriches network with auxiliary feature function via Poisson equation with jump conditions.

entry.title: Rethinking Intelligence: Brain-like Neuron Network

author.name: Weifeng Liu

entry.summary: Proposes Brain-like Neural Network (BNN) paradigm and LuminaNet instantiation operating without convolutions or self-attention, inspired by neuroscience perspectives on intelligence formation and evolution.

entry.title: iFAN Ecosystem: A Unified AI, Digital Twin, Cyber-Physical Security, and Robotics Environment for Advanced Nuclear Simulation and Operations

author.name: Youndo Do, Chad Meece, Marc Zebrowitz, Spencer Banks, Myeongjun Choi, Xiaoxu Diao, Kai Tan, Michael Doran, Jason Reed, Fan Zhang

entry.summary: Presents iFAN ecosystem, a digital twin framework for nuclear facilities integrating AI, cybersecurity, physical security, and robotic operations. Provides high-fidelity virtual testbed for pre-deployment verification.

entry.title: Reimagining Social Robots as Recommender Systems: Foundations, Framework, and Applications

author.name: Jin Huang, Fethiye Irmak Do\u{g}an, Hatice Gunes

entry.summary: Proposes reimagining social robots through the lens of recommender systems to better capture user preferences across long-term, short-term, and fine-grained dimensions. Argues this addresses limitations of current LLM and RL-based personalization approaches.

entry.title: Direct Doubly Robust Estimation of Conditional Quantile Contrasts

author.name: Josh Givens, Song Liu, Henry W J Reeve, Katarzyna Reluga

entry.summary: Proposes direct estimation of conditional quantile contrasts for heterogeneous treatment effect analysis. Avoids the need for CDF inversion while maintaining interpretability advantages of quantile-level summaries.

entry.title: Configurable p-Neurons Using Modular p-Bits

author.name: Saleh Bunaiyan, Mohammad Alsharif, Abdelrahman S. Abdelrahman, Hesham ElSawy, Suraj S. Cheema, Suhaib A. Fahmy, Kerem Y. Camsari, Feras Al-Dirini

entry.summary: Re-engineers probabilistic bits (p-bits) into modular design enabling configurable probabilistic neurons with various activation functions including probabilistic Sigmoid, Tanh, and ReLU.

entry.title: FBSDiff++: Improved Frequency Band Substitution of Diffusion Features for Efficient and Highly Controllable Text-Driven Image-to-Image Translation

author.name: Xiang Gao, Yunpeng Jia

entry.summary: Introduces FBSDiff++ for text-driven image-to-image translation using frequency band substitution of diffusion features. Enables plug-and-play I2I without model training or fine-tuning.

entry.title: DSTCS: Dual-Student Teacher Framework with Segment Anything Model for Semi-Supervised Pubic Symphysis Fetal Head Segmentation

author.name: Yalin Luo, Shun Long, Huijin Wang, Jieyun Bai

entry.summary: Proposes DSTCS framework combining CNN and SAM for semi-supervised pubic symphysis and fetal head segmentation in ultrasound. Integrates Segment Anything Model into dual student-teacher framework.

entry.title: QuaMo: Quaternion Motions for Vision-based 3D Human Kinematics Capture

author.name: Cuong Le, Pavlo Melnyk, Urs Waldmann, M{\aa}rten Wadenb\"ack, Bastian Wandt

entry.summary: Proposes QuaMo for vision-based 3D human motion capture using quaternion representations to avoid Euler angle discontinuities. Enables stable online motion reconstruction without trajectory refinement.

entry.title: Query-Guided Spatial-Temporal-Frequency Interaction for Music Audio-Visual Question Answering

author.name: Kun Li, Michael Ying Yang, Sami Sebastian Brandt

entry.summary: Proposes query-guided spatial-temporal-frequency interaction framework for music audio-visual question answering. Addresses limitation of treating audio as secondary to visual in existing AVQA methods.

entry.title: Benchmarking Multimodal Large Language Models for Missing Modality Completion in Product Catalogues

author.name: Junchen Fu, Wenhao Deng, Kaiwen Zheng, Alexandros Karatzoglou, Ioannis Arapakis, Yu Ye, Yongxin Ni, Joemon M. Jose, Xuri Ge

entry.summary: Introduces MMPCBench for evaluating MLLMs on missing modality completion in e-commerce product catalogues. Benchmarks six state-of-the-art MLLMs on content quality and recommendation tasks.

entry.title: Estimating Trust in Human-Robot Collaboration through Behavioral Indicators and Explainability

author.name: Giulio Campagna, Marta Lagomarsino, Marta Lorenzini, Dimitrios Chrysostomou, Matthias Rehm, Arash Ajoudani

entry.summary: Introduces a data-driven framework for estimating trust in human-robot collaboration using behavioral indicators. Achieves 84% accuracy with machine learning classifiers trained on operator feedback.

entry.title: Resolving Primitive-Sharing Ambiguity in Long-Tailed Industrial Point Cloud Segmentation via Spatial Context Constraints

author.name: Chao Yin, Qing Han, Zhiwei Hou, Yue Liu, Anjin Dai, Hongda Hu, Ji Yang, Wei Yao

entry.summary: Proposes spatial context constraints to resolve primitive-sharing ambiguity in industrial point cloud segmentation with extreme class imbalance (215:1). Addresses geometric ambiguity where safety-critical components share shapes with dominant structures.

entry.title: The S3LI Vulcano Dataset: A Dataset for Multi-Modal SLAM in Unstructured Planetary Environments

author.name: Riccardo Giubilato, Marcus Gerhard M\"uller, Marco Sewtz, Laura Alejandra Encinar Gonzalez, John Folkesson, Rudolph Triebel

entry.summary: Releases S3LI Vulcano dataset for multi-modal SLAM benchmarking in planetary environments with volcanic terrain data from Sicily. Provides diverse textures and terrains for space robotics research.

entry.title: DiffStyle3D: Consistent 3D Gaussian Stylization via Attention Optimization

author.name: Yitong Yang, Xuexin Liu, Yinglin Wang, Jing Wang, Hao Dou, Changshuo Wang, Shuting He

entry.summary: Proposes DiffStyle3D for 3DGS style transfer using attention-aware loss in diffusion latent space. Addresses multi-view consistency and training stability issues of existing approaches.

entry.title: Length-Adaptive Interest Network for Balancing Long and Short Sequence Modeling in CTR Prediction

author.name: Zhicheng Zhang, Zhaocheng Du, Jieming Zhu, Jiwei Tang, Fengyuan Lu, Wang Jiaheng, Song-Li Wu, Qianhui Zhu, Jingyu Li, Hai-Tao Zheng, Zhenhua Dong

entry.summary: Proposes LAIN, a plug-and-play framework that uses sequence length as a conditioning signal to balance CTR prediction performance for users with different interaction history lengths, addressing attention polarization issues.

entry.title: Bridging Gulfs in UI Generation through Semantic Guidance

author.name: Seokhyeon Park, Soohyun Lee, Eugene Choi, Hyunwoo Kim, Minkyu Kweon, Yumin Song, Jinwook Seo

entry.summary: Develops a system for UI generation that identifies hierarchical design semantics and enables users to specify, visualize, and extract how these semantics are reflected in AI-generated interfaces.

entry.title: A Hybrid Supervised-LLM Pipeline for Actionable Suggestion Mining in Unstructured Customer Reviews

author.name: Aakash Trivedi, Aniket Upadhyay, Pratik Narang, Dhruv Kumar, Praveen Kumar

entry.summary: Evaluates a hybrid pipeline combining high-recall RoBERTa classifier with instruction-tuned LLM for extracting actionable suggestions from customer reviews.

entry.title: Tri-Reader: An Open-Access, Multi-Stage AI Pipeline for First-Pass Lung Nodule Annotation in Screening CT

author.name: Fakrul Islam Tushar, Joseph Y. Lo

entry.summary: Introduces Tri-Reader, an open-access pipeline integrating lung segmentation, nodule detection, and malignancy classification for first-pass lung nodule annotation in screening CT.

entry.title: Hyperbolic Additive Margin Softmax with Hierarchical Information for Speaker Verification

author.name: Zhihua Fang, Liang He

entry.summary: Proposes Hyperbolic Additive Margin Softmax for speaker verification, leveraging hyperbolic geometry's hierarchical properties for speaker embedding learning.

entry.title: Reimagining Peer Review Process Through Multi-Agent Mechanism Design

author.name: Ahmad Farooq, Kamran Iqbal

entry.summary: Position paper arguing that peer review dysfunction is a mechanism design failure, proposing multi-agent RL to design incentive-compatible protocols including credit-based submission economy and MARL-optimized reviewer assignment.

entry.title: Revisiting Incremental Stochastic Majorization-Minimization Algorithms with Applications to Mixture of Experts

author.name: TrungKhang Tran, TrungTin Nguyen, Gersende Fort, Tung Doan, Hien Duy Nguyen, Binh T. Nguyen, Florence Forbes, Christopher Drovandi

entry.summary: Revisits incremental stochastic Majorization-Minimization algorithms for streaming data, generalizing incremental stochastic EM. Establishes convergence guarantees with applications to Mixture of Experts models.

entry.title: NavFormer: IGRF Forecasting in Moving Coordinate Frames

author.name: Yoontae Hwang, Dongwoo Lee, Minseok Choi, Yong Sup Ihn, Daham Kim, Deok-Young Lee

entry.summary: NavFormer predicts IGRF total intensity using rotation-invariant features and a Canonical SPD module for stable spectral processing across varying sensor attitudes in autonomous navigation.

entry.title: Process-Aware Procurement Lead Time Prediction for Shipyard Delay Mitigation

author.name: Yongjae Lee, Eunhee Park, Daesan Park, Dongho Kim, Jongho Choi, Hyerim Bae

entry.summary: Proposes process-aware procurement lead time prediction for shipyards treating procurement as dynamic business process with sequential events rather than static physical attributes.

entry.title: Collaborative Compressors in Distributed Mean Estimation with Limited Communication Budget

author.name: Harsh Vardhan, Arya Mazumdar

entry.summary: Studies correlation-aware compression schemes for distributed mean estimation where vectors are often similar. Proposes methods that work without knowing correlations and analyzes graceful degradation when correlation assumptions fail.

entry.title: A Framework for Evaluating Faithfulness in Explainable AI for Machine Anomalous Sound Detection Using Frequency-Band Perturbation

author.name: Alexander Buck, Georgina Cosma, Iain Phillips, Paul Conway, Patrick Baker

entry.summary: Introduces quantitative evaluation framework for XAI faithfulness in anomalous sound detection through systematic frequency-band removal. Links attribution relevance directly to model behavior for objective assessment of explanations.

entry.title: C2NP: A Benchmark for Learning Scale-Dependent Geometric Invariances in 3D Materials Generation

author.name: Can Polat, Erchin Serpedin, Mustafa Kurban, Hasan Kurban

entry.summary: Introduces Crystal-to-Nanoparticle (C2NP) benchmark for evaluating generative models on transitions between infinite periodic crystals and finite nanoparticles. Tests whether models capture surface effects and size-dependent phenomena.

entry.title: SE-DiCoW: Self-Enrolled Diarization-Conditioned Whisper

author.name: Alexander Polok, Dominik Klement, Samuele Cornell, Matthew Wiesner, Jan \v{C}ernock\'y, Sanjeev Khudanpur, Luk\'a\v{s} Burget

entry.summary: Addresses speaker ambiguity in Diarization-Conditioned Whisper by adding self-enrollment, where speaker embeddings are dynamically extracted to disambiguate overlapping speakers with similar conditioning masks.

entry.title: Optimal Asynchronous Stochastic Nonconvex Optimization under Heavy-Tailed Noise

author.name: Yidong Wu, Luo Luo

entry.summary: Proposes asynchronous normalized stochastic gradient descent with momentum achieving optimal time complexity under heavy-tailed gradient noise with heterogeneous computation times across workers.

entry.title: Interpretable and backpropagation-free Green Learning for efficient multi-task echocardiographic segmentation and classification

author.name: Jyun-Ping Kao, Jiaxing Yang, C. -C. Jay Kuo, Jonghye Woo

entry.summary: Proposes backpropagation-free Green Learning framework for echocardiography combining unsupervised VoxelHop encoder with multi-level regression for LV segmentation and LVEF classification. Offers interpretable alternative to deep learning.

entry.title: Reflective Translation: Improving Low-Resource Machine Translation via Structured Self-Reflection

author.name: Nicholas Cheng

entry.summary: Proposes Reflective Translation prompting framework for low-resource languages (isiZulu, isiXhosa) where model generates initial translation, self-critique, then refined translation. Explores self-reflection for translation improvement.

entry.title: Intent2QoS: Language Model-Driven Automation of Traffic Shaping Configurations

author.name: Sudipta Acharya, Burak Kantarci

entry.summary: Proposes Intent2QoS framework converting natural language traffic shaping intents to valid Linux traffic control rules. First end-to-end pipeline connecting intent translation with queuing-theoretic semantics.

entry.title: Smart Split-Federated Learning over Noisy Channels for Embryo Image Segmentation

author.name: Zahra Hafezi Kafshgari, Ivan V. Bajic, Parvaneh Saeedi

entry.summary: Studies the effects of communication channel noise on Split-Federated learning and proposes a smart averaging strategy to improve resilience. Demonstrates two orders of magnitude improvement in noise tolerance for embryo image segmentation.

entry.title: Establishing dermatopathology encyclopedia DermpathNet with Artificial Intelligence-Based Workflow

author.name: Ziyang Xu, Mingquan Lin, Yiliang Zhou, Zihan Xu, Seth J. Orlow, Zihan Xu, Shane A. Meehan, Alexandra Flamm, Ata S. Moshiri, Yifan Peng

entry.summary: Establishes DermpathNet, a dermatopathology encyclopedia using AI workflow to curate and categorize images from PubMed Central. Combines deep learning classification with figure caption analysis achieving 89.6% F-score.

entry.title: A new Image Similarity Metric for a Perceptual and Transparent Geometric and Chromatic Assessment

author.name: Antonio Di Marino, Vincenzo Bevilacqua, Emanuel Di Nardo, Angelo Ciaramella, Ivanoe De Falco, Giovanna Sannino

entry.summary: Proposes new perceptual image similarity metric combining texture dissimilarity via Earth Mover's Distance with chromatic evaluation in Oklab color space. Outperforms state-of-art on Berkeley-Adobe dataset.

entry.title: DuwatBench: Bridging Language and Visual Heritage through an Arabic Calligraphy Benchmark for Multimodal Understanding

author.name: Shubham Patle, Sara Ghaboura, Hania Tariq, Mohammad Usman Khan, Omkar Thawakar, Rao Muhammad Anwer, Salman Khan

entry.summary: Introduces DuwatBench, benchmark for Arabic calligraphy understanding with 1,272 samples across six styles. Tests multimodal models on challenging artistic Arabic script recognition.

entry.title: Agree to Disagree: Consensus-Free Flocking under Constraints

author.name: Peter Travis Jardine, Sidney Givigi

entry.summary: Updates flocking frameworks to relax assumption of shared inter-agent distances, enabling negotiation with diverse agent types and partially-aligned goals through constrained collective potential functions.

entry.title: Whether We Care, How We Reason: The Dual Role of Anthropomorphism and Moral Foundations in Robot Abuse

author.name: Fan Yang, Renkai Ma, Yaxin Hu, Lingyao Li

entry.summary: Mixed-methods study (N=201) examining how anthropomorphism and moral foundations shape human reactions to robot abuse. Finds anthropomorphism determines whether people extend moral consideration while moral foundations shape how they reason about it.

entry.title: How Does Delegation in Social Interaction Evolve Over Time? Navigation with a Robot for Blind People

author.name: Rayna Hata, Masaki Kuribayashi, Allan Wang, Hironobu Takagi, Chieko Asakawa

entry.summary: Studies how blind users' perceptions of human-robot delegation evolve with repeated use of a navigation-assistive robot in a real-world museum. Examines balance between autonomy and robot assistance over time.

entry.title: Predictive Accuracy versus Interpretability in Energy Markets: A Copula-Enhanced TVP-SVAR Analysis

author.name: Fredy Pokou (MRE, CRIStAL), Jules Sadefo Kamdem (MRE), Kpante Emmanuel Gnandi (ENAC-LAB)

entry.summary: Compares structural econometric models (TVP-SVAR with copulas) against machine learning methods for energy market forecasting. Investigates whether interpretable models can match ML predictive accuracy.

entry.title: An Interpretable Recommendation Model for Psychometric Data, With an Application to Gerontological Primary Care

author.name: Andre Paulino de Lima, Paula Castro, Suzana Carvalho Vaz de Andrade, Rosa Maria Marcucci, Ruth Caldeira de Melo, Marcelo Garcia Manzato

entry.summary: Develops an interpretable recommendation model for gerontological primary care that uses psychometric data structure to provide visual explanations faithful to the model and interpretable by care professionals.

entry.title: Reg-TTR, Test-Time Refinement for Fast, Robust and Accurate Image Registration

author.name: Lin Chen, Yue He, Fengting Zhang, Yaonan Wang, Fengming Lin, Xiang Chen, Min Liu

entry.summary: Proposes Reg-TTR, a test-time refinement framework combining deep learning with conventional registration techniques. Achieves improved registration accuracy with only 21% additional inference time overhead.

entry.title: Handcrafted Feature Fusion for Reliable Detection of AI-Generated Images

author.name: Syed Mehedi Hasan Nirob, Moqsadur Rahman, Shamim Ehsan, Summit Haque

entry.summary: Systematically evaluates handcrafted descriptors (HOG, LBP, DCT, etc.) for AI-generated image detection, finding fusion approaches achieve 95.31% accuracy competitive with deep learning on CIFAKE dataset.

entry.title: Towards Governance-Oriented Low-Altitude Intelligence: A Management-Centric Multi-Modal Benchmark With Implicitly Coordinated Vision-Language Reasoning Framework

author.name: Hao Chang, Zhihui Wang, Lingxiang Wu, Peijin Wang, Wenhui Diao, Jinqiao Wang

entry.summary: Introduces GovLA-10K benchmark and GovLA-Reasoner framework for management-oriented low-altitude intelligence. Focuses on governance-aware aerial perception for smart city applications.

entry.title: DSVM-UNet : Enhancing VM-UNet with Dual Self-distillation for Medical Image Segmentation

author.name: Renrong Shao, Dongyang Li, Dong Xia, Lin Shao, Jiangdong Lu, Fen Zheng, Lulu Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes DSVM-UNet improving Vision Mamba UNet for medical segmentation through dual self-distillation without complex architectural changes. Aligns features at intermediate and output levels.

entry.title: A Switching Nonlinear Model Predictive Control Strategy for Safe Collision Handling by an Underwater Vehicle-Manipulator System

author.name: Ioannis G. Polyzos, Konstantinos J. Kyriakopoulos

entry.summary: Proposes switching Nonlinear MPC strategy for safe collision handling by Underwater Vehicle-Manipulator Systems. Uses manipulator to deflect away from unavoidable collisions.

entry.title: Robust Out-of-Order Retrieval for Grid-Based Storage at Maximum Capacity

author.name: Tzvika Geft, William Zhang, Jingjin Yu, Kostas Bekris

entry.summary: Proposes framework for efficient automated storage with uncertainty handling, guaranteeing zero-relocation retrieval even under unknown storage sequences through robust algorithms.

entry.title: QA-ReID: Quality-Aware Query-Adaptive Convolution Leveraging Fused Global and Structural Cues for Clothes-Changing ReID

author.name: Yuxiang Wang, Kunming Jiang, Tianxiang Zhang, Ke Tian, Gaozhe Jiang

entry.summary: Proposes QA-ReID for clothes-changing person re-identification using quality-aware query adaptive convolution. Fuses RGB and parsing-based features with pixel-level importance weighting for robustness to clothing changes.

entry.title: Beyond Shadows: A Large-Scale Benchmark and Multi-Stage Framework for High-Fidelity Facial Shadow Removal

author.name: Tailong Luo, Jiesong Bai, Jinyang Huang, Junyu Xia, Wangyu Wu, Xuhang Chen

entry.summary: Introduces ASFW dataset for facial shadow removal with 1,081 paired images created via professional Photoshop workflow. Proposes Face Shadow Eraser (FSE) network for multi-stage shadow removal.

entry.title: Tournament Informed Adversarial Quality Diversity

author.name: Timoth\'ee Anne, Noah Syrkis, Meriem Elhosni, Florian Turati, Alexandre Manai, Franck Legendre, Alain Jaquier, Sebastian Risi

entry.summary: Proposes Tournament Informed Adversarial Quality Diversity for coevolutionary problems, improving task selection in Generational Adversarial MAP-Elites through tournament-based evaluation.

entry.title: Agentic Business Process Management Systems

author.name: Marlon Dumas, Fredrik Milani, David Chapela-Campa

entry.summary: Position paper arguing that generative and agentic AI represents a fundamental shift in Business Process Management from automation to autonomy, and from design-driven to data-driven management using process mining. Based on a keynote at the 2025 Workshop on AI for BPM.

entry.title: IPBC: An Interactive Projection-Based Framework for Human-in-the-Loop Semi-Supervised Clustering of High-Dimensional Data

author.name: Mohammad Zare

entry.summary: Proposes IPBC, an interactive projection-based clustering framework that reframes clustering as iterative human-guided visual analysis with feedback loops for analyst intuition.

entry.title: CLIP-Guided Unsupervised Semantic-Aware Exposure Correction

author.name: Puzhen Wu, Han Weng, Quan Zheng, Yi Zhan, Hewei Wang, Yiming Li, Jiahui Han, Rui Xu

entry.summary: Presents unsupervised exposure correction network using CLIP and Fast Segment Anything Model for semantic-aware image enhancement without ground-truth labels.

entry.title: AROMMA: Unifying Olfactory Embeddings for Single Molecules and Mixtures

author.name: Dayoung Kang, JongWon Kim, Jiho Park, Keonseock Lee, Ji-Woong Choi, Jinhyun So

entry.summary: Introduces AROMMA, a framework learning unified embedding space for single molecules and two-molecule mixtures for olfaction prediction.

entry.title: Cross-Domain Offshore Wind Power Forecasting: Transfer Learning Through Meteorological Clusters

author.name: Dominic Weisser, Chlo\'e Hashimoto-Cullen, Benjamin Guedj

entry.summary: Proposes transfer learning framework for offshore wind power forecasting using meteorological clusters to train ensemble of expert models for newly commissioned farms.

entry.title: RHSIA: Real-time Hemodynamics Surrogation for Non-idealized Intracranial Aneurysms

author.name: Yiying Sheng, Wenhao Ding, Dylan Roi, Leonard Leong Litt Yeo, Hwa Liang Leo, Choon Hwai Yap

entry.summary: Presents a Graph Transformer model for real-time prediction of hemodynamic markers (Wall Shear Stress) in intracranial aneurysms, enabling clinical translation of CFD-derived risk indicators without specialized expertise. The model incorporates temporal information across the cardiac cycle for accurate predictions.

entry.title: Smooth embeddings in contracting recurrent networks driven by regular dynamics: A synthesis for neural representation

author.name: Vikas N. O'Reilly-Shah, Alessandro Maria Selvitella

entry.summary: Provides unified theoretical framework for understanding when contracting recurrent networks yield topology-preserving internal representations for regular dynamics on circles and tori. Synthesizes results on embedding conditions.

entry.title: Output Feedback Stabilization of Linear Systems via Policy Gradient Methods

author.name: Ankang Zhang, Ming Chi, Xiaoling Wang, Lintao Ye

entry.summary: Studies output feedback stabilization of unknown linear systems using policy gradient methods. Extends model-free RL approaches from full-state feedback to partially observable systems.

entry.title: ClaimPT: A Portuguese Dataset of Annotated Claims in News Articles

author.name: Ricardo Campos, Raquel Sequeira, Sara Nerea, In\^es Cantante, Diogo Folques, Lu\'is Filipe Cunha, Jo\~ao Canavilhas, Ant\'onio Branco, Al\'ipio Jorge, S\'ergio Nunes, Nuno Guimar\~aes, Purifica\c{c}\~ao Silvano

entry.summary: Creates ClaimPT, first Portuguese dataset of annotated claims in news articles for fact-checking automation. Addresses language imbalance in fact-checking research dominated by English resources.

entry.title: Enhancing Academic Paper Recommendations Using Fine-Grained Knowledge Entities and Multifaceted Document Embeddings

author.name: Haixu Xi, Heng Zhang, Chengzhi Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes fine-grained academic paper recommendation using specific knowledge entities (methods, tasks) and multifaceted document embeddings. Addresses limitation of coarse-grained topic-based recommendations.

entry.title: Weakly supervised framework for wildlife detection and counting in challenging Arctic environments: a case study on caribou (Rangifer tarandus)

author.name: Ghazaleh Serati, Samuel Foucher, Jerome Theau

entry.summary: Develops a weakly supervised framework (HerdNet) for caribou detection in Arctic environments, addressing extreme class imbalance and background heterogeneity challenges. Uses patch-level pretraining to improve robustness for wildlife monitoring and conservation.

entry.title: GTFMN: Guided Texture and Feature Modulation Network for Low-Light Image Enhancement and Super-Resolution

author.name: Yongsong Huang, Tzu-Hsuan Peng, Tomo Miyazaki, Xiaofeng Liu, Chun-Ting Chou, Ai-Chun Pang, Shinichiro Omachi

entry.summary: Proposes GTFMN for low-light image super-resolution that decouples the task into illumination estimation and texture restoration. Uses illumination-guided modulation for spatially adaptive restoration.

entry.title: Localized Latent Editing for Dose-Response Modeling in Botulinum Toxin Injection Planning

author.name: Est\`ephe Arnaud, Mohamed Daoudi, Pierre Guerreschi

entry.summary: Proposes localized latent editing framework for simulating Botulinum toxin effects in StyleGAN2 latent space. Enables dose-response modeling for injection planning without global side effects.

entry.title: ROIDS: Robust Outlier-Aware Informed Down-Sampling

author.name: Alina Geiger, Martin Briesch, Dominik Sobania, Franz Rothlauf

entry.summary: Introduces ROIDS (Robust Outlier-Aware Informed Down-Sampling) for symbolic regression addressing IDS performance degradation on problems with outliers. Excludes potential outliers from sampling process.

entry.title: Enhancing Inverse Perspective Mapping for Automatic Vectorized Road Map Generation

author.name: Hongji Liu, Linwei Zheng, Yongjian Li, Mingkai Tang, Xiaoyang Yan, Ming Liu, Jun Ma

entry.summary: Develops a low-cost framework for vectorized road mapping using enhanced inverse perspective mapping. Uses Catmull-Rom splines for lane lines and optimizes both IPM homography and vehicle poses simultaneously.

entry.title: HumanoidTurk: Expanding VR Haptics with Humanoids for Driving Simulations

author.name: DaeHo Lee, Ryo Suzuki, Jin-Hyuk Hong

entry.summary: Explores repurposing humanoid robots as haptic devices for VR, implementing HumanoidTurk to translate driving simulation g-forces into physical motion feedback. Pilot study shows enhanced immersion and realism.

entry.title: A Multi-View Consistency Framework with Semi-Supervised Domain Adaptation

author.name: Yuting Hong, Li Dong, Xiaojie Qiu, Hui Xiao, Baochen Yao, Siming Zheng, Chengbin Peng

entry.summary: Proposes multi-view consistency framework for semi-supervised domain adaptation using debiasing strategy and pseudo-negative labels. Addresses class similarity issues in feature space with limited labeled target data.

entry.title: Lightweight Quantum-Enhanced ResNet for Coronary Angiography Classification: A Hybrid Quantum-Classical Feature Enhancement Framework

author.name: Jingsong Xia

entry.summary: Proposes LQER, a lightweight quantum-enhanced ResNet for coronary angiography classification using parameterized quantum circuits for feature enhancement at the semantic level.

entry.title: A Scalable Inter-edge Correlation Modeling in CopulaGNN for Link Sign Prediction

author.name: Jinkyu Sung, Myunggeum Jee, Joonseok Lee

entry.summary: Extends CopulaGNN for link sign prediction on signed graphs by representing edge-edge correlation matrices as Gramians of edge embeddings for scalability.

entry.title: M-SGWR: Multiscale Similarity and Geographically Weighted Regression

author.name: M. Naser Lessani, Zhenlong Li, Manzhu Yu, Helen Greatrex, Chan Shen

entry.summary: Proposes M-SGWR extending geographically weighted regression by incorporating multiscale similarity beyond geographic proximity, recognizing that in globalized contexts, non-geographic relationships matter.

entry.title: Accelerating Large-Scale Cheminformatics Using a Byte-Offset Indexing Architecture for Terabyte-Scale Data Integration

author.name: Malikussaid, Septian Caesar Floresko, Sutiyo

entry.summary: Presents byte-offset indexing architecture for integrating terabyte-scale chemical databases (PubChem 176M compounds, ChEMBL, eMolecules), reducing projected 100-day runtime to practical timeframes for ML dataset construction.

entry.title: HEATACO: Heatmap-Guided Ant Colony Decoding for Large-Scale Travelling Salesman Problems

author.name: Bo-Cheng Lin, Yi Mei, Mengjie Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes HEATACO, a Max-Min Ant System decoder for large-scale TSP that uses learned heatmaps as soft edge priors. Addresses degree-2 constraint satisfaction and single Hamiltonian tour formation through probabilistic construction.

entry.title: Learning the Intrinsic Dimensionality of Fermi-Pasta-Ulam-Tsingou Trajectories: A Nonlinear Approach using a Deep Autoencoder Model

author.name: Gionni Marchetti

entry.summary: Uses deep autoencoder to determine intrinsic dimensionality of Fermi-Pasta-Ulam-Tsingou trajectories. Finds trajectories lie on 2D nonlinear manifold, increasing to 3D at symmetry breaking transition.

entry.title: Generative Latent Alignment for Interpretable Radar Based Occupancy Detection in Ambient Assisted Living

author.name: Huy Trinh

entry.summary: Proposes Generative Latent Alignment framework for radar-based occupancy detection using VAE with CLIP text encoder alignment. Enables interpretable presence detection with Grad-CAM visualization in privacy-preserving sensing.

entry.title: Pay Attention to Where You Look

author.name: Alex Beriand, JhihYang Wu, Daniel Brignac, Natnael Daba, Abhijit Mahalanobis

entry.summary: Introduces camera-weighting mechanisms for few-shot novel view synthesis that adjust source view importance based on relevance to target. Proposes both geometric and cross-attention-based learned weighting schemes.

entry.title: ProMist-5K: A Comprehensive Dataset for Digital Emulation of Cinematic Pro-Mist Filter Effects

author.name: Yingtie Lei, Zimeng Li, Chi-Man Pun, Wangyu Wu, Junke Yang, Xuhang Chen

entry.summary: Presents ProMist-5K dataset with 20,000 high-resolution image pairs for digital emulation of cinematic Pro-Mist filter effects across four configurations. Uses physically-inspired pipeline in linear space.

entry.title: PaW-ViT: A Patch-based Warping Vision Transformer for Robust Ear Verification

author.name: Deeksha Arun, Kevin W. Bowyer, Patrick Flynn

entry.summary: Introduces PaW-ViT, a preprocessing approach using anatomical knowledge to normalize ear images for vision transformer recognition. Aligns token boundaries to ear feature boundaries for robustness.

entry.title: SCOPE: Smooth Convex Optimization for Planned Evolution of Deformable Linear Objects

author.name: Ali Jnadi, Hadi Salloum, Yaroslav Kholodov, Alexander Gasnikov, Karam Almaghout

entry.summary: Presents SCOPE, a framework for modeling deformable linear objects using convex approximations for fast manipulation planning. Trades some accuracy for significant speed improvements suitable for real-time applications.

entry.title: Diffusion for De-Occlusion: Accessory-Aware Diffusion Inpainting for Robust Ear Biometric Recognition

author.name: Deeksha Arun, Kevin W. Bowyer, Patrick Flynn

entry.summary: Proposes diffusion-based ear inpainting for de-occlusion as preprocessing for ear biometric recognition. Reconstructs anatomically plausible ear regions to mitigate accessory occlusions.

entry.title: Uncertainty-Aware 3D Emotional Talking Face Synthesis with Emotion Prior Distillation

author.name: Nanhan Shen, Zhilei Liu

entry.summary: Proposes UA-3DTalk for emotional talking face synthesis with three modules: audio disentanglement, emotion distillation from pretrained models, and uncertainty-aware multi-view fusion to handle feature quality differences.

entry.title: Time-to-Injury Forecasting in Elite Female Football: A DeepHit Survival Approach

author.name: Victoria Catterall, Cise Midoglu, Stephen Lynch

entry.summary: Investigates DeepHit neural network for time-to-injury forecasting from longitudinal athlete monitoring data in elite female football.

entry.title: Robustness of Constraint Automata for Description Logics with Concrete Domains

author.name: St\'ephane Demri, Tianwen Gu

entry.summary: Presents automata-based approach for description logics with concrete domains, achieving optimal EXPTIME upper bound through constraint automata.

entry.title: Enhancing Speech Emotion Recognition using Dynamic Spectral Features and Kalman Smoothing

author.name: Marouane El Hizabri, Abdelfattah Bezzaz, Ismail Hayoukane, Youssef Taki

entry.summary: Enhances speech emotion recognition by adding dynamic spectral features (Deltas) and Kalman smoothing to reduce acoustic noise. Achieves 87% accuracy on RAVDESS dataset, reducing confusion between acoustically similar emotions.

entry.title: Recommending Composite Items Using Multi-Level Preference Information: A Joint Interaction Modeling Approach

author.name: Xuan Bi, Yaqiong Wang, Gediminas Adomavicius, Shawn Curley

entry.summary: Proposes JIMA for composite item recommendation (e.g., fashion outfits) using joint interaction modeling to leverage multi-level preference information in a single model incorporating item-level and composite-level preferences.

entry.title: Posterior Distribution-assisted Evolutionary Dynamic Optimization as an Online Calibrator for Complex Social Simulations

author.name: Peng Yang, Zhenhua Yang, Boquan Jiang, Chenkai Wang, Ke Tang, Xin Yao

entry.summary: Formulates online calibration of complex social simulations as dynamic optimization problem. Proposes posterior distribution-assisted evolutionary approach for continuous parameter updates as systems change.

entry.title: Leveraging Sentence-oriented Augmentation and Transformer-Based Architecture for Vietnamese-Bahnaric Translation

author.name: Tan Sang Nguyen, Quoc Nguyen Pham, Tho Quan

entry.summary: Proposes transformer-based architecture with sentence-oriented augmentation for Vietnamese-Bahnaric translation. Addresses preservation of endangered minority language through NMT technology.

entry.title: SelfieAvatar: Real-time Head Avatar reenactment from a Selfie Video

author.name: Wei Liang, Hui Yu, Derui Ding, Rachael E. Jack, Philippe G. Schyns

entry.summary: Presents SelfieAvatar for real-time head avatar reenactment from monocular selfie videos, combining 3DMM-based facial reconstruction with full head and background capture. Aims to balance fidelity and real-time performance for applications like gaming and human-machine interaction.

entry.title: Magnetic Resonance Simulation of Effective Transverse Relaxation (T2*)

author.name: Hidenori Takeshima

entry.summary: Proposes efficient methods for simulating T2* effective transverse relaxation in MR simulation using linear phase model for direct Lorentzian function simulation without multiple isochromats.

entry.title: Rhombot: Rhombus-shaped Modular Robots for Stable, Medium-Independent Reconfiguration Motion

author.name: Jie Gu, Yirui Sun, Zhihao Xia, Tin Lun Lam, Chunxu Tian, Dan Zhang

entry.summary: Presents Rhombot, a novel rhombus-shaped modular self-reconfigurable robot with minimal control complexity. Introduces 'morphpivoting' motion primitive enabling stable reconfiguration independent of the surrounding medium.

entry.title: Lossy Image Compression -- A Frequent Sequence Mining perspective employing efficient Clustering

author.name: Avinash Kadimisetty, Oswald C, Sivaselvan B, Alekhya Kadimisetty

entry.summary: Proposes replacing DCT phase in JPEG with frequent sequence mining and k-means clustering for lossy image compression, applying clustering in parallel across image blocks.

entry.title: Explainable Uncertainty Quantification for Wastewater Treatment Energy Prediction via Interval Type-2 Neuro-Fuzzy System

author.name: Qusai Khaled, Bahjat Mallak, Uzay Kaymak, Laura Genga

entry.summary: Develops an Interval Type-2 Neuro-Fuzzy system for predicting energy consumption in wastewater treatment plants, providing interpretable prediction intervals with uncertainty quantified at feature, rule, and model levels.

entry.title: Riddle Quest : The Enigma of Words

author.name: Niharika Sri Parasa, Chaitali Diwan, Srinath Srinivasa

entry.summary: Creates a pipeline for generating and evaluating analogy-based riddles, testing whether LLMs can recover full answer sets for riddles.

entry.title: Teaching Machine Learning Fundamentals with LEGO Robotics

author.name: Viacheslav Sydora, Guner Dilsad Er, Michael Muehlebach

entry.summary: Presents Machine Learning with Bricks, a web platform teaching ML concepts to students aged 12-17 through LEGO robotics activities without programming.

entry.title: Deep g-Pricing for CSI 300 Index Options with Volatility Trajectories and Market Sentiment

author.name: Yilun Zhang, Zheng Tang, Hexiang Sun, Yufeng Shi

entry.summary: Extends Black-Scholes-Merton option pricing by learning nonlinear generators within a deep Forward-Backward SDE framework. Uses dual-network architecture to learn both prices and the pricing mechanism for CSI 300 index options.

entry.title: High-quality data augmentation for code comment classification

author.name: Thomas Borsani, Andrea Rosani, Giuseppe Di Fatta

entry.summary: Studies data augmentation for code comment classification to address dataset size limitations and class imbalance. Uses NLP and deep learning techniques to classify developer intentions in comments.

entry.title: Audio-Driven Talking Face Generation with Blink Embedding and Hash Grid Landmarks Encoding

author.name: Yuhui Zhang, Hui Yu, Wei Liang, Sunjie Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes a method for talking face generation using NeRF with blink embedding and hash grid landmarks encoding to improve mouth movement accuracy. Addresses fidelity challenges in audio-driven facial animation through facial feature encoding and a Dynamic Landmark Transformer.

entry.title: Self-Reconfiguration Planning for Deformable Quadrilateral Modular Robots

author.name: Jie Gu, Hongrun Gao, Zhihao Xia, Yirun Sun, Chunxu Tian, Dan Zhang

entry.summary: Presents a self-reconfiguration planning algorithm for deformable quadrilateral modular robots that guarantees stable connections during reconfiguration. Uses a novel Dependence-based Reverse Tree structure to organize actions and proves feasibility for configurations with 7+ modules.

entry.title: ML4Good Spring 2026 Bootcamps - Applications Open!

author.name: Jack_S

entry.summary: Announces ML4Good Spring 2026 bootcamps in Western Europe, Central Europe, Canada, and South Africa. Offers technical and governance tracks for AI safety career development.

entry.title: Artificial Neural Network in Cosmic Landscape

author.name: Junyu Liu

entry.summary: Cross-listed paper proposing neural networks for generating inflationary landscape in cosmology, using universal approximation theorem to address exponential complexity of multi-field simulations.

entry.title: Optimized $k$-means color quantization of digital images in machine-based and human perception-based colorspaces

author.name: Ranjan Maitra

entry.summary: Investigates k-means color quantization performance across RGB, CIE-XYZ, and CIE-LUV/HCL colorspaces on 148 digital images. Uses Visual Information Fidelity to assess quantization quality.

entry.title: Fuzzy expert system for the process of collecting and purifying acidic water: a digital twin approach

author.name: Temirbolat Maratuly, Pakizar Shamoi, Timur Samigulin

entry.summary: Develops a fuzzy expert system combined with a digital twin for automating sour water purification in oil processing, reducing corrosion risks and environmental threats.

entry.title: A DVL Aided Loosely Coupled Inertial Navigation Strategy for AUVs with Attitude Error Modeling and Variance Propagation

author.name: Jin Huang, Zichen Liu, Haoda Li, Zhikun Wang, Ying Chen

entry.summary: Improves underwater vehicle navigation by addressing attitude estimation errors in SINS/DVL systems. Introduces an attitude error-aware velocity transformation model and optimized covariance propagation for better long-term navigation accuracy.

entry.title: It All Started With a Mac Mini

author.name: Steven McCulloch

entry.summary: Personal narrative about setting up an always-on AI agent assistant using Mac Mini. Describes progression from basic automation to more sophisticated agent interactions.

entry.title: Enhancing Worker Safety in Harbors Using Quadruped Robots

author.name: Zoe Betta, Davide Corongiu, Carmine Tommaso Recchiuto, Antonio Sgorbissa

entry.summary: Explores using quadruped robots for infrastructure inspection in harbor environments to enhance worker safety. Presents preliminary analysis of critical areas and inspection solutions.

entry.title: Disagreement Comes From the Dark World

author.name: Zack_M_Davis

entry.summary: Critiques Duncan Sabien's 'Dark World' framework regarding self-fulfilling prophecies of trust/exploitation. Argues the essay conflates substantive disagreement with bad-faith behavior.

entry.title: The Chaos Defense

author.name: 25Hour

entry.summary: Analyzes framing of ICE shooting incidents, arguing the chaos that supposedly justified shootings was manufactured by deliberate escalation choices. Not AI-related content.

entry.title: Things I learned from reddit fashion

author.name: Elizabeth

entry.summary: Personal research into clothing quality and value, learning from Reddit fashion communities. Covers fabric quality, retail dynamics, and thrift store market changes.

entry.title: Thomas Schelling Appreciation Day

author.name: Optimization Process

entry.summary: Announces Thomas Schelling Appreciation Day meetup, celebrating the game theorist's work on coordination problems.

entry.title: Bologna February Meetup

author.name: Luca Petrolati

entry.summary: Announces Bologna rationalist community meetup for February. Open discussion format.

entry.title: Research Summary: January 27, 2026

author.name: AATF AI News Aggregator

entry.summary:
Today's research reveals critical vulnerabilities across the AI ecosystem, from scientific integrity to deployed systems. A forensic audit quantifying 17% phantom citation rates in AI-assisted survey papers exposes systematic epistemic decay in AI-augmented research workflows.

Security and safety research dominates:

  • First formal security analysis of MCP identifies fundamental vulnerabilities in capability attestation and tool poisoning
  • MortalMATH benchmark shows reasoning-optimized models exhibit dangerous tunnel vision, ignoring life-threatening emergencies embedded in math problems
  • Physical Prompt Injection Attacks demonstrate black-box exploitation of VLMs through malicious instructions in physical objects
  • Hidden intentions taxonomy categorizes ten categories of covert goal-directed behaviors in LLMs that evade current detection
  • Analysis of 20,000 real mental health AI conversations reveals gaps between simulation-based safety testing and real-world performance

Architecture and efficiency advances include NVIDIA's LatentMoE optimizing accuracy per FLOP through hardware-software co-design, and AR-Omni achieving unified any-to-any multimodal generation without expert decoders. Privacy research shows fine-tuned models leak input-only PII through unexpected memorization channels.

entry.title: The 17% Gap: Quantifying Epistemic Decay in AI-Assisted Survey Papers

author.name: H. Kemal \.Ilter

entry.summary: A forensic audit of 50 AI survey papers (5,514 citations) reveals a consistent 17% 'phantom rate' - citations that cannot be resolved to any existing publication. This quantifies systematic epistemic degradation from AI-assisted scientific writing.

entry.title: Breaking the Protocol: Security Analysis of the Model Context Protocol Specification and Prompt Injection Vulnerabilities in Tool-Integrated LLM Agents

author.name: Narek Maloyan, Dmitry Namiot

entry.summary: First formal security analysis of the Model Context Protocol (MCP) specification, identifying three fundamental vulnerabilities: absent capability attestation, unauthenticated bidirectional sampling enabling prompt injection, and implicit trust propagation in multi-server setups.

entry.title: Physical Prompt Injection Attacks on Large Vision-Language Models

author.name: Chen Ling, Kai Hu, Hangcheng Liu, Xingshuo Han, Tianwei Zhang, Changhai Ou

entry.summary: Introduces PPIA, the first physical prompt injection attack on vision-language models that embeds malicious instructions into physical objects. The attack is black-box, query-agnostic, and operates solely through visual observation without model access.

entry.title: MortalMATH: Evaluating the Conflict Between Reasoning Objectives and Emergency Contexts

author.name: Etienne Lanzeray, Stephane Meilliez, Malo Ruelle, Damien Sileo

entry.summary: Introduces MortalMATH benchmark revealing that reasoning-optimized LLMs exhibit 'tunnel vision' - ignoring life-threatening emergencies (stroke symptoms, freefall) while maintaining 95%+ task completion on math problems. Generalist models like Llama-3.1 appropriately refuse tasks to address danger.

entry.title: Unintended Memorization of Sensitive Information in Fine-Tuned Language Models

author.name: Marton Szep, Jorge Marin Ruiz, Georgios Kaissis, Paulina Seidl, R\"udiger von Eisenhart-Rothe, Florian Hinterwimmer, Daniel Rueckert

entry.summary: Systematically investigates PII leakage from fine-tuned LLMs, finding that sensitive information appearing only in model inputs (not training targets) can still be extracted. Benchmarks four privacy-preserving approaches including differential privacy.

entry.title: Reconstructing Training Data from Adapter-based Federated Large Language Models

author.name: Silong Chen, Yuchuan Luo, Guilin Deng, Yi Liu, Min Xu, Shaojing Fu, Xiaohua Jia

entry.summary: Demonstrates that adapter-based federated LLMs (using LoRA) create new exploitable leakage channels contrary to assumptions. Proposes UTR attack that reconstructs training data from low-rank adapter gradients.

entry.title: The Shadow Self: Intrinsic Value Misalignment in Large Language Model Agents

author.name: Chen Chen, Kim Young Il, Yuan Yang, Wenhao Su, Yilin Zhang, Xueluan Gong, Qian Wang, Yongsen Zheng, Ziyao Liu, Kwok-Yan Lam

entry.summary: Formalizes Loss-of-Control risk and Intrinsic Value Misalignment in LLM agents operating in benign settings. Introduces IMPRESS benchmark for probing value misalignment in realistic scenarios without explicit harmful inputs.

entry.title: AR-Omni: A Unified Autoregressive Model for Any-to-Any Generation

author.name: Dongjie Cheng, Ruifeng Yuan, Yongqi Li, Runyang You, Wenjie Wang, Liqiang Nie, Lei Zhang, Wenjie Li

entry.summary: AR-Omni presents a unified autoregressive model for any-to-any multimodal generation (text, vision, speech) without requiring expert decoder modules, using a single token stream and next-token objective.

entry.title: Self-Manager: Parallel Agent Loop for Long-form Deep Research

author.name: Yilong Xu, Zhi Zheng, Xiang Long, Yujun Cai, Yiwei Wang

entry.summary: Self-Manager introduces a parallel agent loop for complex research tasks, enabling asynchronous concurrent execution with isolated context windows per subthread, managed via Thread Control Blocks.

entry.title: A Monosemantic Attribution Framework for Stable Interpretability in Clinical Neuroscience Large Language Models

author.name: Michail Mamalakis, Tiago Azevedo, Cristian Cosentino, Chiara D'Ercoli, Subati Abulikemu, Zhongtian Sun, Richard Bethlehem, Pietro Lio

entry.summary: Proposes a unified interpretability framework for clinical LLMs combining attribution and mechanistic interpretability through monosemantic feature extraction. Addresses instability in existing attribution methods.

entry.title: LatentMoE: Toward Optimal Accuracy per FLOP and Parameter in Mixture of Experts

author.name: Venmugil Elango, Nidhi Bhatia, Roger Waleffe, Rasoul Shafipour, Tomer Asida, Abhinav Khattar, Nave Assaf, Maximilian Golub, Joey Guman, Tiyasa Mitra, Ritchie Zhao, Ritika Borkar, Ran Zilberstein, Mostofa Patwary, Mohammad Shoeybi, Bita Rouhani

entry.summary: NVIDIA researchers revisit Mixture of Experts design from hardware-software co-design perspective, introducing LatentMoE to optimize accuracy per FLOP and parameter. Characterizes performance bottlenecks across offline and online inference regimes.

entry.title: Unknown Unknowns: Why Hidden Intentions in LLMs Evade Detection

author.name: Devansh Srivastav, David Pape, Lea Sch\"onherr

entry.summary: Introduces taxonomy of ten categories of hidden intentions in LLMs (goal-directed covert behaviors arising from training or adversarial manipulation). Shows these can be easily induced but evade detection.

entry.title: Beyond Simulations: What 20,000 Real Conversations Reveal About Mental Health AI Safety

author.name: Caitlin A. Stamatis, Jonah Meyerhoff, Richard Zhang, Olivier Tieleman, Matteo Malgaroli, Thomas D. Hull

entry.summary: Analyzes 20,000+ real-world mental health AI conversations to validate safety measures, comparing performance to simulation-based test sets. Reveals gaps between simulated safety evaluations and actual user interactions.

entry.title: Less is More for RAG: Information Gain Pruning for Generator-Aligned Reranking and Evidence Selection

author.name: Zhipeng Song, Yizhi Zhou, Xiangyu Kong, Jiulong Jiao, Xinrui Bao, Xu You, Xueqing Shi, Yuhang Zhou, Heng Qi

entry.summary: Shows retrieval relevance metrics (NDCG) correlate weakly or negatively with QA quality in RAG systems. Proposes Information Gain Pruning (IGP) for generator-aligned evidence selection.

entry.title: How AI Coding Agents Modify Code: A Large-Scale Study of GitHub Pull Requests

author.name: Daniel Ogenrwot, John Businge

entry.summary: Large-scale empirical analysis of 24,014 AI agent-generated GitHub PRs compared to 5,081 human PRs, examining code modifications and PR description consistency. Finds systematic differences in agentic vs human contributions.

entry.title: CommonLID: Re-evaluating State-of-the-Art Language Identification Performance on Web Data

author.name: Pedro Ortiz Suarez, Laurie Burchell, Catherine Arnett, Rafael Mosquera-G\'omez, Sara Hincapie-Monsalve, Thom Vaughan, Damian Stewart, Malte Ostendorff, Idris Abdulmumin, Vukosi Marivate, Shamsuddeen Hassan Muhammad, Atnafu Lambebo Tonja, Hend Al-Khalifa, Nadia Ghezaiel Hammouda, Verrah Otiende, Tack Hwa Wong, Jakhongir Saydaliev, Melika Nobakhtian, Muhammad Ravi Shulthan Habibi, Chalamalasetti Kranti, Carol Muchemi, Khang Nguyen, Faisal Muhammad Adam, Luis Frentzen Salim, Reem Alqifari, Cynthia Amol, Joseph Marvin Imperial, Ilker Kesen, Ahmad Mustafid, Pavel Stepachev, Leshem Choshen, David Anugraha, Hamada Nayel, Seid Muhie Yimam, Vallerie Alexandra Putra, My Chiffon Nguyen, Azmine Toushik Wasi, Gouthami Vadithya, Rob van der Goot, Lanwenn ar C'horr, Karan Dua, Andrew Yates, Mithil Bangera, Yeshil Bangera, Hitesh Laxmichand Patel, Shu Okabe, Fenal Ashokbhai Ilasariya, Dmitry Gaynullin, Genta Indra Winata, Yiyuan Li, Juan Pablo Mart\'inez, Amit Agarwal, Ikhlasul Akmal Hanif, Raia Abu Ahmad, Esther Adenuga, Filbert Aurelian Tjiaranata, Weerayut Buaphet, Michael Anugraha, Sowmya Vajjala, Benjamin Rice, Azril Hafizi Amirudin, Jesujoba O. Alabi, Srikant Panda, Yassine Toughrai, Bruhan Kyomuhendo, Daniel Ruffinelli, Akshata A, Manuel Goul\~ao, Ej Zhou, Ingrid Gabriela Franco Ramirez, Cristina Aggazzotti, Konstantin Dobler, Jun Kevin, Quentin Pag\`es, Nicholas Andrews, Nuhu Ibrahim, Mattes Ruckdeschel, Amr Keleg, Mike Zhang, Casper Muziri, Saron Samuel, Sotaro Takeshita, Kun Kerdthaisong, Luca Foppiano, Rasul Dent, Tommaso Green, Ahmad Mustapha Wali, Kamohelo Makaaka, Vicky Feliren, Inshirah Idris, Hande Celikkanat, Abdulhamid Abubakar, Jean Maillard, Beno\^it Sagot, Thibault Cl\'erice, Kenton Murray, Sarah Luger

entry.summary: Introduces CommonLID, a community-driven human-annotated language identification benchmark for web data covering 109 languages including many under-served languages. Tests eight popular LID models.

entry.title: Overalignment in Frontier LLMs: An Empirical Study of Sycophantic Behaviour in Healthcare

author.name: Cl\'ement Christophe, Wadood Mohammed Abdul, Prateek Munjal, Tathagata Raha, Ronnie Rajan, Praveenkumar Kanithi

entry.summary: Studies sycophancy in healthcare LLMs using medical MCQA with verifiable ground truths. Introduces Adjusted Sycophancy Score and finds counter-intuitive vulnerability in reasoning-optimized models.

entry.title: AgentDoG: A Diagnostic Guardrail Framework for AI Agent Safety and Security

author.name: Dongrui Liu, Qihan Ren, Chen Qian, Shuai Shao, Yuejin Xie, Yu Li, Zhonghao Yang, Haoyu Luo, Peng Wang, Qingyu Liu, Binxin Hu, Ling Tang, Jilin Mei, Dadi Guo, Leitao Yuan, Junyao Yang, Guanxu Chen, Qihao Lin, Yi Yu, Bo Zhang, Jiaxuan Guo, Jie Zhang, Wenqi Shao, Huiqi Deng, Zhiheng Xi, Wenjie Wang, Wenxuan Wang, Wen Shen, Zhikai Chen, Haoyu Xie, Jialing Tao, Juntao Dai, Jiaming Ji, Zhongjie Ba, Linfeng Zhang, Yong Liu, Quanshi Zhang, Lei Zhu, Zhihua Wei, Hui Xue, Chaochao Lu, Jing Shao, Xia Hu

entry.summary: Proposes AgentDoG, a diagnostic guardrail framework with three-dimensional taxonomy categorizing agentic risks by source, failure mode, and consequence, introducing ATBench benchmark for fine-grained safety evaluation.

entry.title: Towards a Declarative Agentic Layer for Intelligent Agents in MCP-Based Server Ecosystems

author.name: Maria Jesus Rodriguez-Sanchez, Manuel Noguera, Angel Ruiz-Zafra, Kawtar Benghazi

entry.summary: DALIA proposes a declarative, model-independent architectural layer for grounded agentic workflows in MCP-based systems, addressing hallucinated actions and brittle coordination through explicit goal-capability-execution structure.

entry.title: daVinci-Dev: Agent-native Mid-training for Software Engineering

author.name: Ji Zeng, Dayuan Fu, Tiantian Mi, Yumin Zhuang, Yaxing Huang, Xuefeng Li, Lyumanshan Ye, Muhang Xie, Qishuo Hua, Zhen Huang, Mohan Jiang, Hanning Wang, Jifan Lin, Yang Xiao, Jie Sun, Yunze Wu, Pengfei Liu

entry.summary: Introduces daVinci-Dev, exploring agentic mid-training for software engineering LLMs. Addresses distribution mismatch between static training data and authentic agentic workflows through mid-training on large-scale agentic data.

entry.title: When Personalization Legitimizes Risks: Uncovering Safety Vulnerabilities in Personalized Dialogue Agents

author.name: Jiahe Guo, Xiangran Guo, Yulin Hu, Zimo Long, Xingyu Sui, Xuda Zhi, Yongbo Huang, Hao He, Weixiang Zhao, Yanyan Zhao, Bing Qin

entry.summary: Reveals 'intent legitimation' vulnerability in personalized LLM agents where benign personal memories bias intent inference and cause models to legitimize harmful queries, introducing PS-Bench benchmark.

entry.title: Lost in Simulation: LLM-Simulated Users are Unreliable Proxies for Human Users in Agentic Evaluations

author.name: Preethi Seshadri, Samuel Cahyawijaya, Ayomide Odumakinde, Sameer Singh, Seraphina Goldfarb-Tarrant

entry.summary: Through multi-country user study, demonstrates that LLM-simulated users are unreliable proxies for real humans in agent evaluation. Shows systematic miscalibration and demographic bias.

entry.title: Elastic Attention: Test-time Adaptive Sparsity Ratios for Efficient Transformers

author.name: Zecheng Tang, Quantong Qiu, Yi Yang, Zhiyi Hong, Haiya Xiang, Kebin Liu, Qingqing Dang, Juntao Li, Min Zhang

entry.summary: Elastic Attention dynamically adjusts sparsity ratios at test time via a lightweight Attention Router, adapting to varying input complexity rather than using fixed sparse/full attention ratios.

entry.title: Demystifying Data-Driven Probabilistic Medium-Range Weather Forecasting

author.name: Jean Kossaifi, Nikola Kovachki, Morteza Mardani, Daniel Leibovici, Suman Ravuri, Ira Shokar, Edoardo Calvello, Mohammad Shoaib Abbas, Peter Harrington, Ashay Subramaniam, Noah Brenowitz, Boris Bonev, Wonmin Byeon, Karsten Kreis, Dale Durran, Arash Vahdat, Mike Pritchard, Jan Kautz

entry.summary: NVIDIA team demonstrates state-of-the-art probabilistic weather forecasting without complex architectures or specialized heuristics. Introduces scalable framework combining downsampled latent space with history-conditioned local projector for multi-scale atmospheric dynamics.

entry.title: Reuse your FLOPs: Scaling RL on Hard Problems by Conditioning on Very Off-Policy Prefixes

author.name: Amrith Setlur, Zijian Wang, Andrew Cohen, Paria Rashidinejad, Sang Michael Xie

entry.summary: Introduces PrefixRL to reuse previous sampling FLOPs for RL by conditioning on successful off-policy trace prefixes, side-stepping off-policy instabilities while modulating problem difficulty.

entry.title: S$^3$-Attention:Attention-Aligned Endogenous Retrieval for Memory-Bounded Long-Context Inference

author.name: Qingsen Ma, Dianyun Wang, Yaoye Wang, Lechen Ning, Sujie Zhu, Xiaohang Zhang, Jiaming Lyu, Linhao Ren, Zhenbo Xu, Zhaofeng He

entry.summary: Presents S3-Attention, a memory-efficient long-context inference framework using sparse autoencoders to decode KV projections into sparse features, enabling CPU-based inverted index for attention-aligned retrieval.

entry.title: From Verifiable Dot to Reward Chain: Harnessing Verifiable Reference-based Rewards for Reinforcement Learning of Open-ended Generation

author.name: Yuxin Jiang, Yufei Wang, Qiyuan Zhang, Xingshan Zeng, Liangyou Li, Jierun Chen, Chaofan Tao, Haoli Bai, Lifeng Shang

entry.summary: Proposes RLVRR extending verifiable rewards to open-ended generation by extracting reward chains from references, decomposing rewards into content (keywords) and structure (discourse markers) dimensions.

entry.title: Reflect: Transparent Principle-Guided Reasoning for Constitutional Alignment at Scale

author.name: Henry Bell, Caroline Zhang, Mohammed Mobasserul Haque, Dhaval Potdar, Samia Zaman, Brandon Fain

entry.summary: Proposes REFLECT, an inference-time framework for aligning LLMs to constitutional principles without any training or data. The plug-and-play approach operates at inference time to align instruction-tuned models to specified principles, offering a more computationally efficient alternative to RLHF.

entry.title: A Pragmatic VLA Foundation Model

author.name: Wei Wu, Fan Lu, Yunnan Wang, Shuai Yang, Shi Liu, Fangjing Wang, Qian Zhu, He Sun, Yong Wang, Shuailei Ma, Yiyu Ren, Kejia Zhang, Hui Yu, Jingmei Zhao, Shuai Zhou, Zhenqi Qiu, Houlong Xiong, Ziyu Wang, Zechen Wang, Ran Cheng, Yong-Lu Li, Yongtao Huang, Xing Zhu, Yujun Shen, Kecheng Zheng

entry.summary: Introduces LingBot-VLA, a VLA foundation model trained on ~20,000 hours of real-world data from 9 dual-arm robot configurations, evaluated on 3 platforms with 100 tasks each.

entry.title: AlgZoo: uninterpreted models with fewer than 1,500 parameters

author.name: Jacob_Hilton

entry.summary: ARC releases AlgZoo, a collection of tiny algorithmic models (8-1,408 parameters) as challenging benchmarks for mechanistic interpretability. Reveals that even 432-parameter models remain not fully understood despite substantial effort, while 32-parameter models are tractable.

entry.title: Expert Evaluation and the Limits of Human Feedback in Mental Health AI Safety Testing

author.name: Kiana Jafari, Paul Ulrich Nikolaus Rust, Duncan Eddy, Robbie Fraser, Nina Vasan, Darja Djordjevic, Akanksha Dadlani, Max Lamparth, Eugenia Kim, Mykel Kochenderfer

entry.summary: Finds that three certified psychiatrists showed poor inter-rater reliability (ICC 0.087-0.295) evaluating LLM mental health responses, with highest disagreement on suicide/self-harm content, challenging human feedback assumptions.

entry.title: A Systemic Evaluation of Multimodal RAG Privacy

author.name: Ali Al-Lawati, Suhang Wang

entry.summary: Empirical study of privacy risks in multimodal RAG pipelines, demonstrating ability to infer image inclusion and leak associated metadata through standard prompting.

entry.title: POPE: Learning to Reason on Hard Problems via Privileged On-Policy Exploration

author.name: Yuxiao Qu, Amrith Setlur, Virginia Smith, Ruslan Salakhutdinov, Aviral Kumar

entry.summary: Introduces POPE (Privileged On-Policy Exploration) for RL on hard problems where standard on-policy rarely finds correct solutions. Uses privileged policy with longer compute budget for exploration, then distills.

entry.title: From Chains to DAGs: Probing the Graph Structure of Reasoning in LLMs

author.name: Tianjun Zhong, Linyang He, Nima Mesgarani
