entry.summary: Introduces Reasoning DAG Probing framework to test whether LLM hidden states encode the geometry of directed acyclic graph reasoning structures in a linearly accessible form. Examines where this structure emerges across layers.

entry.title: Mechanistic Analysis of Catastrophic Forgetting in Large Language Models During Continual Fine-tuning

author.name: Olaf Yunus Laitinen Imanov

entry.summary: Presents comprehensive mechanistic analysis of catastrophic forgetting across model scales (109B-400B parameters), identifying three mechanisms: gradient interference in attention, representation drift in FFN layers, and attention pattern disruption.

entry.title: Neuro-Symbolic Verification on Instruction Following of LLMs

author.name: Yiming Su, Kunzhao Xu, Yanjie Gao, Fan Yang, Cheng Li, Mao Yang, Tianyin Xu

entry.summary: Presents NSVIF, a neuro-symbolic framework for verifying LLM instruction-following by modeling instructions as constraints and checking both logical and semantic constraint satisfaction.

entry.title: An Experimental Comparison of Cognitive Forcing Functions for Execution Plans in AI-Assisted Writing: Effects On Trust, Overreliance, and Perceived Critical Thinking

author.name: Ahana Ghosh, Advait Sarkar, Si\^an Lindley, Christian Poelitz

entry.summary: Controlled experiment testing cognitive forcing functions (CFFs) for AI-generated execution plans in writing tasks. Tests assumption analysis and hypothesis testing interventions against overreliance.

entry.title: Code over Words: Overcoming Semantic Inertia via Code-Grounded Reasoning

author.name: Manjie Xu, Isabella Yin, Xinyi Tu, Chi Zhang, Yixin Zhu

entry.summary: Discovers 'Semantic Inertia' - LLMs' inability to override pre-trained priors (e.g., 'Lava is Dangerous') when in-context rules contradict them. Using Baba Is You game, shows larger models exhibit inverse scaling on such tasks.

entry.title: Gained in Translation: Privileged Pairwise Judges Enhance Multilingual Reasoning

author.name: Lintang Sutawika, Gokul Swamy, Zhiwei Steven Wu, Graham Neubig

entry.summary: Introduces SP3F framework for multilingual reasoning enhancement using self-play with privileged pairwise feedback from judges receiving English reference responses. Achieves improvements without target language data.

entry.title: $\infty$-MoE: Generalizing Mixture of Experts to Infinite Experts

author.name: Shota Takashiro, Takeshi Kojima, Shohei Taniguchi, Yusuke Iwasawa, Yutaka Matsuo

entry.summary: Proposes ∞-MoE, generalizing Mixture of Experts to infinite experts by selecting parameters from large FFNs based on continuous values rather than discrete expert selection. Enables more effective training when scaling expert count.

entry.title: High-Fidelity Longitudinal Patient Simulation Using Real-World Data

author.name: Yu Akagi, Tomohisa Seki, Hiromasa Ito, Toru Takiguchi, Kazuhiko Ohe, Yoshimasa Kawazoe

entry.summary: Develops a generative simulator pretrained on 200+ million clinical records that synthesizes realistic future patient trajectories, enabling personalized treatment planning and virtual clinical trials.

entry.title: The Viscosity of Logic: Phase Transitions and Hysteresis in DPO Alignment

author.name: Marco Pollanen

entry.summary: Studies DPO alignment by treating β as control parameter, discovering sharp non-monotonic capability changes including phase transitions and hysteresis effects across model families.

entry.title: treaming-dLLM: Accelerating Diffusion LLMs via Suffix Pruning and Dynamic Decoding

author.name: Zhongyu Xiao, Zhiwei Hao, Jianyuan Guo, Yong Luo, Jia Liu, Jie Xu, Han Hu

entry.summary: Streaming-dLLM accelerates diffusion language models through suffix pruning (spatial) and dynamic decoding schedules (temporal), achieving training-free efficiency improvements.

entry.title: VIBEVOICE-ASR Technical Report

author.name: Zhiliang Peng, Jianwei Yu, Yaoyao Chang, Zilong Wang, Li Dong, Yingbo Hao, Yujie Tu, Chenyu Yang, Wenhui Wang, Songchen Xu, Yutao Sun, Hangbo Bao, Weijiang Xu, Yi Zhu, Zehua Wang, Ting Song, Yan Xia, Zewen Chi, Shaohan Huang, Liang Wang, Chuang Ding, Shuai Wang, Xie Chen, Furu Wei

entry.summary: Microsoft/Furu Wei team presents VibeVoice-ASR, end-to-end speech understanding framework supporting single-pass processing for up to 60 minutes of audio. Unifies ASR, speaker diarization, and timestamping across 50+ languages with code-switching support.

entry.title: HalluCitation Matters: Revealing the Impact of Hallucinated References with 300 Hallucinated Papers in ACL Conferences

author.name: Yusuke Sakai, Hidetaka Kamigaito, Taro Watanabe

entry.summary: Systematic analysis finding nearly 300 papers in ACL/NAACL/EMNLP 2024-2025 contain hallucinated citations (HalluCitation) that don't correspond to existing works, with most appearing in 2025 publications.

entry.title: Oops, Wait: Token-Level Signals as a Lens into LLM Reasoning

author.name: Jaehui Hwang, Dongyoon Han, Sangdoo Yun, Byeongho Heo

entry.summary: Analyzes token-level signals like 'wait' and 'therefore' in LLM reasoning, finding specific tokens strongly correlate with reasoning correctness. Shows reasoning models acquire but only partially exploit these signals.

entry.title: Demographic Probing of Large Language Models Lacks Construct Validity

author.name: Manuel Tonneau, Neil K. R. Seghal, Niyati Malhotra, Victor Orozco-Olvera, Ana Mar\'ia Mu\~noz Boudet, Lakshmi Subramanian, Sharath Chandra Guntuku, Valentin Hofmann

entry.summary: Demonstrates that demographic probing of LLMs lacks construct validity: different cues intended to represent the same demographic group induce only partially overlapping behavior changes.

entry.title: Agentic Search in the Wild: Intents and Trajectory Dynamics from 14M+ Real Search Requests

author.name: Jingjie Ning, Jo\~ao Coelho, Yibo Kong, Yunfan Long, Bruno Martins, Jo\~ao Magalh\~aes, Jamie Callan, Chenyan Xiong

entry.summary: Large-scale analysis of 14.44M agentic search requests revealing distinctive behavioral patterns in LLM-powered search agents. Proposes Context-driven Term Adoption Rate (CTAR) to quantify query term origins from retrieved evidence.

entry.title: Teaching Models to Teach Themselves: Reasoning at the Edge of Learnability

author.name: Shobhita Sundaram, John Quan, Ariel Kwiatkowski, Kartik Ahuja, Yann Ollivier, Julia Kempe

entry.summary: Introduces SOAR, a meta-RL framework where teacher model proposes synthetic problems for student copy, rewarded by student improvement on hard problems. Enables models to escape learning plateaus through self-generated curriculum.

entry.title: Faramesh: A Protocol-Agnostic Execution Control Plane for Autonomous Agent Systems

author.name: Amjad Fatmi

entry.summary: Introduces Faramesh, a protocol-agnostic execution control plane enforcing mandatory authorization checkpoints for agent actions before they affect the real world through a non-bypassable boundary.

entry.title: Success Conditioning as Policy Improvement: The Optimization Problem Solved by Imitating Success

author.name: Daniel Russo

entry.summary: Proves that success conditioning (rejection sampling with SFT) exactly solves a trust-region optimization problem, yielding an identity connecting policy improvement, change magnitude, and problem difficulty.

entry.title: ReLE: A Scalable System and Structured Benchmark for Diagnosing Capability Anisotropy in Chinese LLMs

author.name: Rui Fang, Jian Li, Wei Chen, Bin Hu, Ying-Cong Chen, Xin Tang, Liang Diao

entry.summary: ReLE benchmark evaluates 304 LLMs (189 commercial, 115 open-source) for Chinese language understanding across a domain×capability matrix with 207,843 samples, measuring 'capability anisotropy'.

entry.title: Just-In-Time Reinforcement Learning: Continual Learning in LLM Agents Without Gradient Updates

author.name: Yibo Li, Zijie Lin, Ailin Deng, Xuan Zhang, Yufei He, Shuo Ji, Tri Cao, Bryan Hooi

entry.summary: Introduces JitRL, training-free framework enabling test-time policy optimization for LLM agents without gradient updates. Uses dynamic non-parametric memory and on-the-fly advantage estimation to modulate output logits.

entry.title: Beyond Preferences: Learning Alignment Principles Grounded in Human Reasons and Values

author.name: Henry Bell, Lara Neubauer da Costa Schertel, Bochu Ding, Brandon Fain

entry.summary: Proposes Grounded Constitutional AI (GCAI) for generating representative constitutions from both general user expectations and interaction-time preferences, extending Inverse Constitutional AI to derive contextual principles.

entry.title: Lattice: Generative Guardrails for Conversational Agents

author.name: Emily Broadhurst, Tawab Safi, Joseph Edell, Vashisht Ganesh, Karime Maamari

entry.summary: Introduces Lattice, a framework for self-constructing and continuously improving conversational AI guardrails through iterative simulation, optimization, and autonomous adversarial testing, achieving 91% F1.

entry.title: Paying Less Generalization Tax: A Cross-Domain Generalization Study of RL Training for LLM Agents

author.name: Zhihan Liu, Lin Guan, Yixin Nie, Kai Zhang, Zhuoqun Hao, Lin Chen, Asli Celikyilmaz, Zhaoran Wang, Na Zhang

entry.summary: Investigates cross-domain generalization of RL-trained LLM agents, identifying state information richness and planning complexity as key environment axes affecting out-of-domain performance.

entry.title: Beyond Outcome Verification: Verifiable Process Reward Models for Structured Reasoning

author.name: Massimiliano Pronesti, Anya Belz, Yufang Hou

entry.summary: Introduces Verifiable Process Reward Models (VPRMs), using deterministic rule-based verifiers for intermediate reasoning steps in RLVR. Applies to risk-of-bias assessment task.

entry.title: Data-driven Clustering and Merging of Adapters for On-device Large Language Models

author.name: Ondrej Bohdal, Taha Ceritli, Mete Ozay, Jijoong Moon, Kyeng-Hun Lee, Hyeonmok Ko, Umberto Michieli

entry.summary: D2C addresses on-device LLM adapter selection by clustering adapters using minimal task examples and iteratively optimizing assignments, then merging within clusters for multi-task deployment.

entry.title: The Limits of AI Data Transparency Policy: Three Disclosure Fallacies

author.name: Judy Hanwen Shen, Ken Liu, Angelina Wang, Sarah H. Cen, Andy K. Zhang, Caroline Meinhardt, Daniel Zhang, Kevin Klyman, Rishi Bommasani, Daniel E. Ho

entry.summary: Stanford HAI researchers identify three fallacies in AI data transparency policies: specification gaps, reform attempts creating new problems, and limited consideration of effective disclosure research. Critiques 'nutrition facts for AI' approaches.

entry.title: Unsupervised Elicitation of Moral Values from Language Models

author.name: Meysam Alizadeh, Fabrizio Gilardi, Zeynab Samei

entry.summary: Investigates unsupervised elicitation of moral values from LLMs using Internal Coherence Maximization algorithm across benchmark datasets. Tests whether base models possess intrinsic moral reasoning without human supervision.

entry.title: FP8-RL: A Practical and Stable Low-Precision Stack for LLM Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Zhaopeng Qiu, Shuang Yu, Jingqi Zhang, Shuai Zhang, Xue Huang, Jingyi Yang, Junjie Lai

entry.summary: Presents FP8 rollout stack for LLM reinforcement learning addressing unique challenges of policy weight changes every step and train-inference mismatch. Provides practical engineering solutions for low-precision RL.

entry.title: Interpreting Agentic Systems: Beyond Model Explanations to System-Level Accountability

author.name: Judy Zhu, Dhari Gandhi, Himanshu Joshi, Ahmad Rezaie Mianroodi, Sedef Akinli Kocak, Dhanesh Ramachandran

entry.summary: Addresses interpretability challenges unique to agentic AI systems, arguing that traditional model-level explanations are insufficient and proposing system-level accountability frameworks for autonomous agents with multi-step planning.

entry.title: DeepPlanning: Benchmarking Long-Horizon Agentic Planning with Verifiable Constraints

author.name: Yinger Zhang, Shutong Jiang, Renhao Li, Jianhong Tu, Yang Su, Lianghao Deng, Xudong Guo, Chenxu Lv, Junyang Lin

entry.summary: Introduces DeepPlanning benchmark for long-horizon agent planning featuring multi-day travel and shopping tasks requiring proactive information gathering and global constrained optimization.

entry.title: Initial results of the Digital Consciousness Model

author.name: Derek Shiller, Laura Duffy, Arvo Mu\~noz Mor\'an, Adri\`a Moret, Chris Percy, Hayley Clatterbuck

entry.summary: Introduces Digital Consciousness Model (DCM), a systematic probabilistic framework for assessing AI consciousness by incorporating multiple leading theories. First attempt at principled AI consciousness assessment.

entry.title: Causal Pre-training Under the Fairness Lens: An Empirical Study of TabPFN

author.name: Qinyi Liu, Mohammad Khalil, Naman Goel

entry.summary: Comprehensive fairness evaluation of TabPFN (tabular foundation model pre-trained on synthetic causal data), finding it achieves stronger accuracy but worse fairness compared to traditional models, especially under distribution shift.

entry.title: One Adapts to Any: Meta Reward Modeling for Personalized LLM Alignment

author.name: Hongru Cai, Yongqi Li, Tiezheng Yu, Fengbin Zhu, Wenjie Wang, Fuli Feng, Wenjie Li

entry.summary: Proposes Meta Reward Modeling (MRM) for personalized LLM alignment, reformulating personalized reward learning as meta-learning problem to efficiently adapt to unseen users with scarce individual feedback.

entry.title: HalluGuard: Demystifying Data-Driven and Reasoning-Driven Hallucinations in LLMs

author.name: Xinyue Zeng, Junhong Lin, Yujun Yan, Feng Guo, Liang Shi, Jun Wu, Dawei Zhou

entry.summary: Introduces Hallucination Risk Bound framework decomposing hallucination into data-driven and reasoning-driven components, providing principled foundation for unified detection across scenarios.

entry.title: LLM-Based Adversarial Persuasion Attacks on Fact-Checking Systems

author.name: Jo\~ao A. Leite, Olesya Razuvayevskaya, Kalina Bontcheva, Carolina Scarton

entry.summary: Introduces adversarial persuasion attacks on automated fact-checking systems using LLMs to rephrase claims with persuasion techniques. Tests 15 persuasion techniques across 6 categories on FEVER and FEVEROUS benchmarks.

entry.title: Sparks of Cooperative Reasoning: LLMs as Strategic Hanabi Agents

author.name: Mahesh Ramesh, Kaousheik Jayakumar, Aswinkumar Ramkumar, Pavan Thodima, Aniket Rege

entry.summary: Benchmarks 17 LLM agents on Hanabi cooperative game testing theory-of-mind and strategic communication across model scales (4B to 600B+). Studies impact of context engineering approaches.

entry.title: Fast KVzip: Efficient and Accurate LLM Inference with Gated KV Eviction

author.name: Jang-Hyun Kim, Dongyoon Han, Sangdoo Yun

entry.summary: Proposes gating-based KV cache eviction for frozen LLMs achieving high compression with negligible computational cost. Uses lightweight sink-attention gating modules for task-agnostic compression without expensive backpropagation.

entry.title: Sponge Tool Attack: Stealthy Denial-of-Efficiency against Tool-Augmented Agentic Reasoning

author.name: Qi Li, Xinchao Wang

entry.summary: Introduces Sponge Tool Attack (STA), a novel attack that disrupts tool-augmented LLM reasoning by rewriting input prompts without modifying the model or tools. This identifies a new attack surface for agentic AI systems under query-only access assumptions.

entry.title: GenAgent: Scaling Text-to-Image Generation via Agentic Multimodal Reasoning

author.name: Kaixun Jiang, Yuzheng Wang, Junjie Zhou, Pandeng Li, Zhihang Liu, Chen-Wei Xie, Zhaoyu Chen, Yun Zheng, Wenqiang Zhang

entry.summary: GenAgent unifies visual understanding and generation through an agentic multimodal model that treats image generators as tools, enabling autonomous multi-turn refinement with reasoning, judgment, and reflection.

entry.title: EEG Foundation Models: Progresses, Benchmarking, and Open Problems

author.name: Dingkun Liu, Yuheng Chen, Zhu Chen, Zhenyao Cui, Yaozhi Wen, Jiayu An, Jingwei Luo, Dongrui Wu

entry.summary: Comprehensive review and benchmark of 50 EEG foundation models, organizing design choices into unified taxonomy and evaluating 12 open-source models with competitive baselines across multiple tasks.

entry.title: Reasoning Long Jump: Why we shouldn’t rely on CoT monitoring for interpretability

author.name: tobypullan

entry.summary: Argues against relying on Chain-of-Thought monitoring for interpretability, showing that models sometimes rationalize pre-conceived answers rather than reasoning through CoT. Suggests models are taking bigger 'reasoning jumps' and may eventually reason entirely in latent space.

entry.title: JaxARC: A High-Performance JAX-based Environment for Abstraction and Reasoning Research

author.name: Aadam, Monu Verma, Mohamed Abdel-Mottaleb

entry.summary: Presents JaxARC, a high-performance JAX-based RL environment for the Abstraction and Reasoning Corpus achieving 38-5,439x speedup over Gymnasium implementations with 790M steps/second throughput.

entry.title: Dynamic Thinking-Token Selection for Efficient Reasoning in Large Reasoning Models

author.name: Zhenyuan Guo, Tong Chen, Wenlong Meng, Chen Gong, Xin Yu, Chengkun Wei, Wenzhi Chen

entry.summary: Proposes DynTS using attention maps to identify decision-critical tokens in reasoning traces, retaining only their KV cache states to reduce memory while maintaining accuracy in Large Reasoning Models.

entry.title: DPI: Exploiting Parameter Heterogeneity for Interference-Free Fine-Tuning

author.name: Xiaoyu Liu, Xiaoyu Guan, Di Liang, Xianjie Wu

entry.summary: DPI addresses 'seesaw effect' in multi-task SFT by identifying task-specific parameter regions (largest updates) and isolating fine-tuning to non-overlapping regions to prevent cross-task interference.

entry.title: TriPlay-RL: Tri-Role Self-Play Reinforcement Learning for LLM Safety Alignment

author.name: Zhewen Tan, Wenhan Yu, Jianfeng Si, Tongxin Liu, Kaiqi Guan, Huiyan Jin, Jiawen Tao, Xiaokun Yuan, Duohe Ma, Xiangzheng Zhang, Tong Yang, Lin Sun

entry.summary: Proposes TriPlay-RL, closed-loop RL framework with three co-improving roles (attacker, defender, evaluator) for LLM safety alignment with near-zero manual annotation. Shows 20-50% improvement in adversarial success.

entry.title: Frame-Guided Synthetic Claim Generation for Automatic Fact-Checking Using High-Volume Tabular Data

author.name: Jacob Devasier, Akshith Putta, Qing Wang, Alankrit Moses, Chengkai Li

entry.summary: Creates large-scale multilingual fact-checking dataset with 78,503 synthetic claims across English, Chinese, Spanish, and Hindi grounded in complex OECD tables averaging 500K+ rows. Demonstrates LLMs haven't memorized these facts.

entry.title: A Universal Load Balancing Principle and Its Application to Large Language Model Serving

author.name: Zixi Chen, Tianci Bu, Chendong Song, Xin Lu, Yinyu Ye, Zijie Zhou

entry.summary: Studies load balancing in barrier-synchronized stateful systems like LLM serving, proposing universal principle that achieves near-optimal idle time reduction.

entry.title: Phase Transition for Budgeted Multi-Agent Synergy

author.name: Bang Liu, Linglong Kong, Jian Pei

entry.summary: Develops a theoretical framework predicting when multi-agent systems help, saturate, or collapse under fixed inference budgets, identifying phase transitions based on context windows, communication fidelity, and error correlation.

entry.title: OffSeeker: Online Reinforcement Learning Is Not All You Need for Deep Research Agents

author.name: Yuhang Zhou, Kai Zheng, Qiguang Chen, Mengkang Hu, Qingfeng Sun, Can Xu, Jingjing Chen

entry.summary: Introduces OffSeeker demonstrating expensive online RL is not necessary for research agents, providing open-source suite including DeepForge task synthesis framework for effective offline training.

entry.title: Do VLMs Have a Moral Backbone? A Study on the Fragile Morality of Vision-Language Models

author.name: Zhining Liu, Tianyi Wang, Xiao Lin, Penghao Ouyang, Gaotang Li, Ze Yang, Hui Liu, Sumit Keswani, Vishwa Pardeshi, Huijun Zhao, Wei Fan, Hanghang Tong

entry.summary: Studies moral robustness in VLMs, finding ethical judgments are highly fragile under simple text and visual perturbations. Reveals sycophancy trade-off in instruction-following models.

entry.title: Conformal Feedback Alignment: Quantifying Answer-Level Reliability for Robust LLM Alignment

author.name: Tiejin Chen, Xiaoou Liu, Vishnu Nandam, Kuan-Ru Liou, Hua Wei

entry.summary: Proposes Conformal Feedback Alignment (CFA) using conformal prediction for answer-level reliability quantification in preference-based alignment. Grounds preference weighting in statistical guarantees.

entry.title: Improving User Privacy in Personalized Generation: Client-Side Retrieval-Augmented Modification of Server-Side Generated Speculations

author.name: Alireza Salemi, Hamed Zamani

entry.summary: P³ framework enables personalization without revealing private profiles to cloud LLMs through client-side retrieval-augmented modification of server-generated draft tokens.

entry.title: Beyond Retention: Orchestrating Structural Safety and Plasticity in Continual Learning for LLMs

author.name: Fei Meng

entry.summary: Reveals critical dichotomy in Experience Replay for LLM continual learning: while ER helps unstructured tasks, it causes severe negative transfer on structured domains like code generation, trading structural integrity for broad retention.

entry.title: VibeTensor: System Software for Deep Learning, Fully Generated by AI Agents

author.name: Bing Xu, Terry Chen, Fengzhe Zhou, Tianqi Chen, Yangqing Jia, Vinod Grover, Haicheng Wu, Wei Liu, Craig Wittenbrink, Wen-mei Hwu, Roger Bringmann, Ming-Yu Liu, Luis Ceze, Michael Lightstone, Humphrey Shi

entry.summary: VibeTensor is an open-source deep learning system software stack fully generated by LLM-powered coding agents. Implements PyTorch-style eager tensor library with C++20 core, Python overlay, and CUDA runtime.

entry.title: Uncertainty Quantification for Named Entity Recognition via Full-Sequence and Subsequence Conformal Prediction

author.name: Matthew Singer, Srijan Sengupta, Karl Pazdernik

entry.summary: Introduces conformal prediction framework for NER that produces prediction sets guaranteed to contain correct labeling with user-specified confidence. Provides formal statistical guarantees analogous to confidence intervals for sequence labeling.

entry.title: D-Models and E-Models: Diversity-Stability Trade-offs in the Sampling Behavior of Large Language Models

author.name: Jia Gu, Liang Pang, Huawei Shen, Xueqi Cheng

entry.summary: Identifies dichotomy between D-models and E-models in LLM sampling behavior: D-models show large diversity in token probabilities but drift from task distribution, while E-models show stability-diversity tradeoff.

entry.title: MemWeaver: Weaving Hybrid Memories for Traceable Long-Horizon Agentic Reasoning

author.name: Juexiang Ye, Xue Li, Xinyu Yang, Chengkai Huang, Lanshun Nie, Lina Yao, Dechen Zhan

entry.summary: Proposes MemWeaver, a hybrid memory framework for long-horizon agents with temporally grounded graph memory, experience memory for recurring patterns, and passage memory for evidence preservation.

entry.title: Benchmarking Direct Preference Optimization for Medical Large Vision-Language Models

author.name: Dain Kim, Jiwoo Lee, Jaehoon Yun, Yong Hoe Koo, Qingyu Chen, Hyunjae Kim, Jaewoo Kang

entry.summary: First comprehensive benchmark of DPO variants for medical Large Vision-Language Models, testing 9 formulations across LLaVA-Med and HuatuoGPT-Vision. Reveals critical limitations including inconsistent improvements and unstable training.

entry.title: Health-ORSC-Bench: A Benchmark for Measuring Over-Refusal and Safety Completion in Health Context

author.name: Zhihao Zhang, Liting Huang, Guanghao Wu, Preslav Nakov, Heng Ji, Usman Naseem

entry.summary: Introduces Health-ORSC-Bench, a 31,920-prompt benchmark measuring over-refusal and safe completion in healthcare LLMs across seven health categories including self-harm and medical misinformation.

entry.title: Can Good Writing Be Generative? Expert-Level AI Writing Emerges through Fine-Tuning on High-Quality Books

author.name: Tuhin Chakrabarty, Paramveer S. Dhillon

entry.summary: Finds that expert MFA writers preferred human writing 82.7% of the time with in-context prompting, but this reversed to 62% preference for AI after fine-tuning on authors' complete works.

entry.title: Crystal-KV: Efficient KV Cache Management for Chain-of-Thought LLMs via Answer-First Principle

author.name: Zihan Wang, Cheng Tang, Lei Gong, Cheng Li, Chao Wang, teng wang, Wenqi Lou, Xuehai Zhou

entry.summary: Proposes Crystal-KV for efficient KV cache management in Chain-of-Thought reasoning using answer-first principle to identify and retain only important reasoning tokens.

entry.title: Agentic reinforcement learning empowers next-generation chemical language models for molecular design and synthesis

author.name: Hao Li, He Cao, Shenyao Peng, Zijing Liu, Bin Feng, Yu Wang, Zhiyuan Yan, Yonghong Tian, Yu Li, Li Yuan

entry.summary: ChemCRAFT uses agentic reinforcement learning to decouple chemical reasoning from knowledge storage, allowing small models to query external sandbox for precise retrieval rather than memorizing chemical data.

entry.title: Funny or Persuasive, but Not Both: Evaluating Fine-Grained Multi-Concept Control in LLMs

author.name: Arya Labroo, Ivaxi Sheth, Vyas Raina, Amaani Ahmed, Mario Fritz

entry.summary: Evaluates fine-grained multi-concept control in LLMs, finding performance drops in dual-concept settings (e.g., persuasive AND funny simultaneously) even for linguistically distinct concept pairs.

entry.title: CLM-Bench: Benchmarking and Analyzing Cross-lingual Misalignment of LLMs in Knowledge Editing

author.name: Yucheng Hu, Wei Zhou, Juesi Xiao

entry.summary: Introduces CLM-Bench, a culture-aware benchmark for multilingual knowledge editing constructed with Chinese-first methodology. Addresses translation artifacts and cultural bias in existing MKE benchmarks.

entry.title: CHiRPE: A Step Towards Real-World Clinical NLP with Clinician-Oriented Model Explanations

author.name: Stephanie Fong, Zimu Wang, Guilherme C. Oliveira, Xiangyu Zhao, Yiwen Jiang, Jiahe Liu, Beau-Luke Colton, Scott Woods, Martha E. Shenton, Barnaby Nelson, Zongyuan Ge, Dominic Dwyer

entry.summary: Introduces CHiRPE, an NLP pipeline for psychosis risk prediction from clinical interviews with clinician-co-developed SHAP explanation formats. Achieves 90%+ accuracy with interpretable outputs.

entry.title: Do not be greedy, Think Twice: Sampling and Selection for Document-level Information Extraction

author.name: Mikel Zubillaga, Oscar Sainz, Oier Lopez de Lacalle, Eneko Agirre

entry.summary: Proposes ThinkTwice framework for document-level information extraction showing sampling produces substantially better solutions than greedy decoding, especially for reasoning models. Introduces selection methods for choosing among candidates.

entry.title: TheoremForge: Scaling up Formal Data Synthesis with Low-Budget Agentic Workflow

author.name: Yicheng Tao, Hongteng Xu

entry.summary: Introduces TheoremForge, a cost-effective pipeline for synthesizing formal mathematics data by decomposing formalization into sub-tasks and recovering training signals from failed trajectories, achieving 12.6% verified rate.

entry.title: EntWorld: A Holistic Environment and Benchmark for Verifiable Enterprise GUI Agents

author.name: Ying Mo, Yu Bai, Dapeng Sun, Yuqian Shi, Yukai Miao, Li Chen, Dan Li

entry.summary: Introduces EntWorld, a benchmark of 1,756 tasks across six enterprise domains testing GUI agents on high-density interfaces, business logic constraints, and precise information retrieval.

entry.title: AdaReasoner: Dynamic Tool Orchestration for Iterative Visual Reasoning

author.name: Mingyang Song, Haoyu Sun, Jiawei Gu, Linjie Li, Luxin Xu, Ranjay Krishna, Yu Cheng

entry.summary: Introduces AdaReasoner, multimodal models learning tool use as general reasoning skill through scalable data curation and Tool-GRPO reinforcement learning for long-horizon visual reasoning.

entry.title: Scientific Image Synthesis: Benchmarking, Methodologies, and Downstream Utility

author.name: Honglin Lin, Chonghan Qin, Zheng Liu, Qizhi Pei, Yu Li, Zhanping Zhong, Xin Gao, Yanfeng Wang, Conghui He, Lijun Wu

entry.summary: Systematic study of scientific image synthesis comparing pixel-based and programmatic approaches. Proposes ImgCoder, a logic-driven framework for generating scientifically rigorous images.

entry.title: Least-Loaded Expert Parallelism: Load Balancing An Imbalanced Mixture-of-Experts

author.name: Xuan-Phi Nguyen, Shrey Pandit, Austin Xu, Caiming Xiong, Shafiq Joty

entry.summary: Proposes Least-Loaded Expert Parallelism for handling imbalanced MoE routing. Addresses compute and memory failures from disproportionate token distribution during inference.

entry.title: On the Insecurity of Keystroke-Based AI Authorship Detection: Timing-Forgery Attacks Against Motor-Signal Verification

author.name: David Condrey

entry.summary: Demonstrates keystroke-based AI authorship detection is insecure against copy-type and timing-forgery attacks. All attacks achieve ≥99.8% evasion rates across classifiers.

entry.title: Res-MIA: A Training-Free Resolution-Based Membership Inference Attack on Federated Learning Models

author.name: Mohammad Zare, Pirooz Shamsinejadbabaki

entry.summary: Res-MIA introduces a training-free black-box membership inference attack on federated learning using progressive resolution degradation to detect training set membership.

entry.title: MalURLBench: A Benchmark Evaluating Agents' Vulnerabilities When Processing Web URLs

author.name: Dezhang Kong, Zhuxi Wu, Shiqi Liu, Zhicheng Tan, Kuichen Lu, Minghao Li, Qichen Liu, Shengyu Chu, Zhenhua Xu, Xuan Liu, Meng Han

entry.summary: Introduces MalURLBench, first benchmark for evaluating LLM vulnerabilities to malicious URLs with 61,845 attack instances across 10 scenarios. Reveals that existing models struggle to detect elaborately disguised malicious URLs.

entry.title: Trust, Don't Trust, or Flip: Robust Preference-Based Reinforcement Learning with Multi-Expert Feedback

author.name: Seyed Amir Hosseini, Maryam Abdolali, Amirhosein Tavakkoli, Fardin Ayar, Ehsan Javanmardi, Manabu Tsukada, Mahdi Javanmardi

entry.summary: Introduces TriTrust-PBRL for preference-based RL with heterogeneous annotators, jointly learning reward model and trust parameters. Key insight: trust parameters can flip systematically adversarial preferences.

entry.title: Persuasion Tokens for Editing Factual Knowledge in LLMs

author.name: Paul Youssef, Christin Seifert, J\"org Schl\"otterer

entry.summary: Introduces persuasion tokens (P-Tokens) as special tokens trained to replicate in-context knowledge editing demonstrations, enabling efficient LLM knowledge updates without fact-specific examples. Achieves comparable or better performance than standard IKE methods.

entry.title: From Emotion to Expression: Theoretical Foundations and Resources for Fear Speech

author.name: Vigneshwaran Shankaran, Gabriella Lapesa, Claudia Wagner

entry.summary: Presents theoretical foundations for fear speech as distinct from hate speech, bridging perspectives from psychology, political science, communication, and linguistics. Argues fear speech evades moderation while driving engagement.

entry.title: Learning to Ideate for Machine Learning Engineering Agents

author.name: Yunxiang Zhang, Kang Zhou, Zhichao Xu, Kiran Ramnath, Yun Zhou, Sangmin Woo, Haibo Ding, Lin Lee Cheong

entry.summary: Introduces MLE-Ideator, a dual-agent framework separating ideation from implementation for ML engineering tasks. Shows RL-trained Ideator achieves 11.5% improvement with only 1K training samples.

entry.title: Grounded Concreteness: Human-Like Concreteness Sensitivity in Vision-Language Models

author.name: Aryan Roy, Zekun Wang, Christopher J. MacLellan

entry.summary: Studies whether VLMs develop more human-like sensitivity to linguistic concreteness than text-only LLMs through controlled comparison of Llama variants. Examines output behavior, embedding geometry, and attention dynamics.

entry.title: One Persona, Many Cues, Different Results: How Sociodemographic Cues Impact LLM Personalization

author.name: Franziska Weeber, Vera Neplenbroek, Jan Batzner, Sebastian Pad\'o

entry.summary: Compares six persona cue types across seven LLMs on four tasks, finding cues produce substantial response variance despite overall correlation. Questions robustness and external validity of persona-based studies.

entry.title: Scaling medical imaging report generation with multimodal reinforcement learning

author.name: Qianchu Liu, Sheng Zhang, Guanghui Qin, Yu Gu, Ying Jin, Sam Preston, Yanbo Xu, Sid Kiblawi, Wen-wai Yim, Tim Ossowski, Tristan Naumann, Mu Wei, Hoifung Poon

entry.summary: Introduces UniRG framework for medical imaging report generation using reinforcement learning to directly optimize evaluation metrics. Demonstrates significant improvements over supervised fine-tuning by avoiding overfitting to boilerplate patterns.

entry.title: Self-Distilled Reasoner: On-Policy Self-Distillation for Large Language Models

author.name: Siyan Zhao, Zhihui Xie, Mengchen Liu, Jing Huang, Guan Pang, Feiyu Chen, Aditya Grover

entry.summary: Proposes Self-Distilled Reasoner for on-policy self-distillation where LLM rationalizes external reasoning traces to teach its weaker self, eliminating need for separate teacher while leveraging ground-truth solutions.

entry.title: Geometry-Grounded Gaussian Splatting

author.name: Baowen Zhang, Chenxing Jiang, Heng Li, Shaojie Shen, Ping Tan

entry.summary: Provides rigorous theoretical derivation establishing Gaussian primitives as stochastic solids, enabling direct treatment as explicit geometric representations for improved shape extraction and multi-view consistency in Gaussian Splatting.

entry.title: Agentic Very Long Video Understanding

author.name: Aniket Rege, Arka Sadhu, Yuliang Li, Kejie Li, Ramya Korlakai Vinayak, Yuning Chai, Yong Jae Lee, Hyo Jin Kim

entry.summary: EGAgent addresses very long egocentric video understanding through an enhanced agentic framework enabling compositional, multi-hop reasoning over video streams spanning days or weeks, targeting always-on AI assistants.

entry.title: ExoGS: A 4D Real-to-Sim-to-Real Framework for Scalable Manipulation Data Collection

author.name: Yiming Wang, Ruogu Zhang, Minyang Li, Hao Shi, Junbo Wang, Deyi Li, Jieji Ren, Wenhai Liu, Weiming Wang, Hao-Shu Fang

entry.summary: Proposes ExoGS, a 4D Real-to-Sim-to-Real framework capturing static environments and dynamic interactions for scalable manipulation data collection using robot-isomorphic exoskeleton.

entry.title: SQL-Trail: Multi-Turn Reinforcement Learning with Interleaved Feedback for Text-to-SQL

author.name: Harper Hua, Zhen Han, Zhengyuan Shen, Jeremy Lee, Patrick Guan, Qi Zhu, Sullam Jeoung, Yueyan Chen, Yunfei Bai, Shuai Wang, Vassilis Ioannidis, Huzefa Rangwala

entry.summary: Introduces SQL-Trail, a multi-turn RL framework for text-to-SQL that interacts with databases and uses execution feedback to iteratively refine predictions with adaptive turn-budget allocation.

entry.title: UniCog: Uncovering Cognitive Abilities of LLMs through Latent Mind Space Analysis

author.name: Jiayu Liu, Yinhe Long, Zhenya Huang, Enhong Chen

entry.summary: Proposes UniCog framework analyzing LLM cognition through latent mind space, revealing a Pareto principle where a shared reasoning core is complemented by ability-specific signatures across models including DeepSeek-V3.2 and GPT-4o.

entry.title: Evaluating Reward Model Generalization via Pairwise Maximum Discrepancy Competitions

author.name: Shunyang Luo, Peibei Cao, Zhihui Zhu, Kehua Feng, Zhihua Wang, Keyan Ding

entry.summary: Introduces PMDC, dynamic framework for evaluating reward model generalization using maximum disagreement between models to select contentious test cases efficiently without pre-annotation.

entry.title: High-Rate Quantized Matrix Multiplication: Theory and Practice

author.name: Or Ordentlich, Yury Polyanskiy

entry.summary: Investigates quantized matrix multiplication theory for LLM deployment, analyzing fundamental rate-distortion tradeoffs and comparing popular quantization schemes to information-theoretic limits.

entry.title: VidLaDA: Bidirectional Diffusion Large Language Models for Efficient Video Understanding

author.name: Zhihao He, Tieyuan Chen, Kangyu Wang, Ziran Qin, Yang Shao, Chaofan Gan, Shijie Li, Zuxuan Wu, Weiyao Lin

entry.summary: VidLaDA applies diffusion language models with bidirectional attention for video understanding, introducing MARS-Cache for efficient inference on massive video tokens.

entry.title: PaperSearchQA: Learning to Search and Reason over Scientific Papers with RLVR

author.name: James Burgess, Jan N. Hansen, Duo Peng, Yuhui Zhang, Alejandro Lozano, Min Woo Sun, Emma Lundberg, Serena Yeung-Levy

entry.summary: Introduces RLVR-trained search agents for scientific paper retrieval over 16 million biomedical abstracts. Creates PaperSearchQA benchmark for factoid QA requiring multi-step reasoning over scientific literature.

entry.title: CaseFacts: A Benchmark for Legal Fact-Checking and Precedent Retrieval

author.name: Akshith Reddy Putta, Jacob Devasier, Chengkai Li

entry.summary: Introduces CaseFacts benchmark for verifying colloquial legal claims against U.S. Supreme Court precedents, with 6,294 claims categorized as Supported, Refuted, or Overruled. Addresses temporal validity of legal facts.

entry.title: Controlling Reading Ease with Gaze-Guided Text Generation

author.name: Andreas S\"auberli, Darja Jepifanova, Diego Frassinelli, Barbara Plank

entry.summary: Uses gaze prediction models to steer language model outputs toward desired reading behaviors. Eye-tracking experiments with native and non-native speakers validate effectiveness at controlling reading ease.

entry.title: Exploring Fine-Tuning for In-Context Retrieval and Efficient KV-Caching in Long-Context Language Models

author.name: Francesco Maria Molfese, Momchil Hardalov, Rexhina Blloshmi, Bill Byrne, Adri\`a de Gispert

entry.summary: Investigates training strategies for long-context LLMs and their robustness under KV-cache compression. Finds +20 point in-domain gains but limited out-of-domain generalization.

entry.title: Falsifying Predictive Algorithm

author.name: Amanda Coston

entry.summary: Proposes falsification framework providing statistical test for discriminant validity in ML algorithms, detecting when algorithms predict unintended outcomes.

entry.title: Aligning Medical Conversational AI through Online Reinforcement Learning with Information-Theoretic Rewards

author.name: Tanvi Verma, Yang Zhou, Rick Siow Mong Goh, Yong Liu

entry.summary: Presents IGFT for training medical conversational AI using online GRPO with information-theoretic rewards, enabling models to learn questioning strategies through self-generated conversations.

entry.title: SAGE: Steerable Agentic Data Generation for Deep Search with Execution Feedback

author.name: Fangyuan Xu, Rujun Han, Yanfei Chen, Zifeng Wang, I-Hung Hsu, Jun Yan, Vishy Tirumalashetty, Eunsol Choi, Tomas Pfister, Chen-Yu Lee

entry.summary: Introduces SAGE, an agentic pipeline for generating difficulty-controlled deep search QA pairs through interaction between data generator and search agent with execution feedback.

entry.title: Stability as a Liability:Systematic Breakdown of Linguistic Structure in LLMs

author.name: Xianzhe Meng, Qiangsheng Zeng, Ling Luo, Qinghan Yang, Jiarui Hao, Wenbo Wu, Qinyu Wang, Rui Yin, Lin Qi, Renzhi Lu

entry.summary: Shows that stable training dynamics under MLE lead to forward KL minimization reducing generative entropy, causing concentration on limited modes and systematic degeneration despite smooth loss convergence.

entry.title: TSRBench: A Comprehensive Multi-task Multi-modal Time Series Reasoning Benchmark for Generalist Models

author.name: Fangxu Yu, Xingang Guo, Lingzhi Yuan, Haoqiang Kang, Hongyu Zhao, Lianhui Qin, Furong Huang, Bin Hu, Tianyi Zhou

entry.summary: Introduces TSRBench, comprehensive benchmark of 4,125 time series problems across 14 domains testing perception, reasoning, prediction, and decision-making in 15 tasks.

entry.title: FlashMoE: Reducing SSD I/O Bottlenecks via ML-Based Cache Replacement for Mixture-of-Experts Inference on Edge Devices

author.name: Byeongju Kim, Jungwan Lee, Donghyeon Han, Hoi-Jun Yoo, Sangyeob Kim

entry.summary: Introduces FlashMoE, an ML-based cache replacement strategy for SSD-based MoE inference on edge devices. Addresses memory constraints for running large MoE models on-device.

entry.title: Mind the Ambiguity: Aleatoric Uncertainty Quantification in LLMs for Safe Medical Question Answering

author.name: Yaokun Liu, Yifan Liu, Phoebe Mbuvi, Zelin Li, Ruichen Yao, Gawon Lim, Dong Wang

entry.summary: Proposes CV-MedBench for studying input ambiguity in medical QA, linking ambiguity to aleatoric uncertainty. Introduces AU-guided abstention using linearly encoded uncertainty in LLM activations.

entry.title: SD-E$^2$: Semantic Exploration for Reasoning Under Token Budgets

author.name: Kshitij Mishra, Nils Lukas, Salem Lahlou

entry.summary: SD-E² uses semantic diversity rewards in RL to improve small language model reasoning by exploring diverse solution strategies rather than surface-form novelty.

entry.title: FastInsight: Fast and Insightful Retrieval via Fusion Operators for Graph RAG

author.name: Seonho An, Chaejeong Hyun, Min-Soo Kim

entry.summary: Introduces FastInsight for efficient Graph RAG with novel fusion operators: GRanker (graph-based reranker) and SFuser (semantic-topology fuser) addressing topology-blindness and semantics-blindness limitations.

entry.title: FaLW: A Forgetting-aware Loss Reweighting for Long-tailed Unlearning

author.name: Liheng Yu, Zhe Zhao, Yuxuan Wang, Pengkun Wang, Binwu Wang, Yang Wang

entry.summary: First investigation of machine unlearning in long-tailed settings, identifying Heterogeneous and Skewed Unlearning Deviation issues. Proposes FaLW, plug-and-play loss reweighting framework.

entry.title: PingPong: A Natural Benchmark for Multi-Turn Code-Switching Dialogues

author.name: Mohammad Rifqi Farhansyah, Hanif Muhammad Zhafran, Farid Adilazuarda, Shamsuddeen Hassan Muhammad, Maryam Ibrahim Mukhtar, Nedjma Ousidhoum, Genta Indra Winata, Ayu Purwarianti, Alham Fikri Aji

entry.summary: Presents PingPong, a benchmark for natural multi-party code-switching dialogues covering 5 language combinations including trilingual scenarios. Features human-authored conversations with complex multi-threaded structures.

entry.title: ProGraph-R1: Progress-aware Reinforcement Learning for Graph Retrieval Augmented Generation

author.name: Jinyoung Park, Sanghyeok Lee, Omar Zia Khan, Hyunwoo J. Kim, Joo-Kyung Kim

entry.summary: Introduces ProGraph-R1 for GraphRAG using RL with progress-aware dense rewards instead of sparse outcome-level rewards. Addresses limitation of existing approaches that rely solely on semantic similarity.

entry.title: LLMs as Cultural Archives: Cultural Commonsense Knowledge Graph Extraction

author.name: Junior Cedric Tonga, Chen Cecilia Liu, Iryna Gurevych, Fajri Koto

entry.summary: Presents iterative prompt-based framework for constructing Cultural Commonsense Knowledge Graphs from LLMs, treating models as cultural archives. Evaluates across five countries with human judgments.

entry.title: Suppressing Final Layer Hidden State Jumps in Transformer Pretraining

author.name: Keigo Shibata, Kazuki Yano, Ryosuke Takahashi, Jaesung Lee, Wataru Ikeda, Jun Suzuki

entry.summary: Introduces jump-suppressing regularizer (JREG) to address disproportionate angular distance jumps in final transformer layers observed across pre-trained models. Proposes quantitative metric for jump strength.

entry.title: iFSQ: Improving FSQ for Image Generation with 1 Line of Code

author.name: Bin Lin, Zongjian Li, Yuwei Niu, Kaixiong Gong, Yunyang Ge, Yunlong Lin, Mingzhe Zheng, JianWei Zhang, Miles Yang, Zhao Zhong, Liefeng Bo, Li Yuan

entry.summary: Proposes iFSQ improving Finite Scalar Quantization with a single line of code change - replacing activation function with distribution-matching mapping to resolve activation collapse in discrete image generation.

entry.title: Correct-by-Construction Vision-based Pose Estimation using Geometric Generative Models

author.name: Ulices Santa Cruz, Mahmoud Elfar, Yasser Shoukry

entry.summary: Proposes framework for certifiable neural networks for vision-based pose estimation integrating geometric generative models with provable correctness guarantees.

entry.title: Are We Evaluating the Edit Locality of LLM Model Editing Properly?

author.name: Wei Liu, Haomei Xu, Hongkai Liu, Zhiying Deng, Ruixuan Li, Heng Huang, Yee Whye Teh, Wee Sun Lee

entry.summary: Identifies fundamental flaws in existing model editing specificity/locality evaluation protocols, showing current metrics are weakly correlated with regularizer strength and lack sensitivity.

entry.title: RouteMoA: Dynamic Routing without Pre-Inference Boosts Efficient Mixture-of-Agents

author.name: Jize Wang, Han Wu, Zhiyuan You, Yiming Song, Yijun Wang, Zifei Shan, Yining Li, Songyang Zhang, Xinyi Le, Cailian Chen, Xinping Guan, Dacheng Tao

entry.summary: Proposes RouteMoA for efficient mixture-of-agents using lightweight scoring for initial screening before inference, avoiding full model execution while maintaining quality through mixture of judges.

entry.title: DEEPMED: Building a Medical DeepResearch Agent via Multi-hop Med-Search Data and Turn-Controlled Agentic Training & Inference

author.name: Zihan wang, Hao Wang, Shi Feng, Xiaocui Yang, Daling Wang, Yiqun Zhang, Jinghao Lin, Haihua Yang, Xiaozhong Ji

entry.summary: Introduces DEEPMED medical DeepResearch agent addressing task characteristic and tool-use scaling gaps through multi-hop medical search data and turn-controlled agentic training.

entry.title: AMVICC: A Novel Benchmark for Cross-Modal Failure Mode Profiling for VLMs and IGMs

author.name: Aahana Basappa, Pranay Goel, Anusri Karra, Anish Karra, Asa Gilmore, Kevin Zhu

entry.summary: Creates AMVICC benchmark for systematically comparing failure modes across 11 MLLMs and 5 image generation models in both image-to-text and text-to-image tasks. Reveals gaps in elementary visual reasoning.

entry.title: Who Gets Which Message? Auditing Demographic Bias in LLM-Generated Targeted Text

author.name: Tunazzina Islam

entry.summary: First systematic analysis of demographic bias in LLM-generated targeted messaging using GPT-4o, Llama-3.3, and Mistral-Large 2.1. Evaluates lexical, stylistic, and persuasive dimensions.

entry.title: Robust Privacy: Inference-Time Privacy through Certified Robustness

author.name: Jiankai Jin, Xiangzheng Zhang, Zhao Liu, Deyue Zhang, Quanchen Zou

entry.summary: Introduces Robust Privacy, a novel inference-time privacy notion inspired by certified robustness. Develops Attribute Privacy Enhancement to translate input invariance to attribute-level privacy.

entry.title: Automatic Stability and Recovery for Neural Network Training

author.name: Barak Or

entry.summary: Proposes supervisory runtime stability framework treating optimization as controlled stochastic process, enabling automatic detection and recovery from destabilizing updates without modifying optimizer.

entry.title: TAM-Eval: Evaluating LLMs for Automated Unit Test Maintenance

author.name: Elena Bruches, Vadim Alperovich, Dari Baturova, Roman Derunets, Daniil Grebenkin, Georgy Mkrtchyan, Oleg Sedukhin, Mikhail Klementev, Ivan Bondarenko, Nikolay Bushkov, Stanislav Moiseev

entry.summary: Introduces TAM-Eval benchmark for evaluating LLMs on test suite maintenance including creation, repair, and updating. Provides 1,539 automatically extracted scenarios operating at test file level with full repository context.

entry.title: Towards a Theoretical Understanding to the Generalization of RLHF

author.name: Zhaochun Li (Beijing Institute of Technolegy, Zhongguancun Academy), Mingyang Yi (Renmin University of China), Yue Wang (Zhongguancun Academy), Shisheng Cui (Beijing Institute of Technolegy), Yong Liu (Renmin University of China)

entry.summary: Provides first generalization theory for RLHF of LLMs under linear reward models using algorithmic stability framework. Proves that under feature coverage conditions, empirical optimum generalizes well in an end-to-end learning framework.

entry.title: Endless Terminals: Scaling RL Environments for Terminal Agents

author.name: Kanishk Gandhi, Shivam Garg, Noah D. Goodman, Dimitris Papailiopoulos

entry.summary: Introduces Endless Terminals, an autonomous pipeline for procedurally generating terminal-use tasks for RL agent training. Creates 3255 validated tasks spanning file operations, scripting, databases; agents trained with vanilla PPO.

entry.title: A Scalable Measure of Loss Landscape Curvature for Analyzing the Training Dynamics of LLMs

author.name: Dayal Singh Kalra, Jean-Christophe Gagnon-Audet, Andrey Gromov, Ishita Mediratta, Kelvin Niu, Alexander H Miller, Michael Shvartsman

entry.summary: Introduces 'critical sharpness' as computationally efficient measure of loss landscape curvature for LLMs, requiring fewer than 10 forward passes. Shows it captures important aspects of Hessian sharpness.

entry.title: Reward-Forcing: Autoregressive Video Generation with Reward Feedback

author.name: Jingran Zhang, Ning Li, Yuanhao Ban, Andrew Bai, Justin Cui

entry.summary: Proposes Reward-Forcing approach for autoregressive video generation using reward signals instead of teacher model distillation. Enables efficient and scalable video generation while preserving visual fidelity and temporal consistency.

entry.title: On the Emergence and Test-Time Use of Structural Information in Large Language Models

author.name: Michelle Chao Chen, Moritz Miller, Bernhard Sch\"olkopf, Siyuan Guo

entry.summary: Studies how LLMs learn abstract structures from observational data and use them for test-time compositional generation. Uses controlled dataset of linguistic structural transformations.

entry.title: FABLE: Forest-Based Adaptive Bi-Path LLM-Enhanced Retrieval for Multi-Document Reasoning

author.name: Lin Sun, Linglin Zhang, Jingang Huang, Change Jia, Zhengwei Cheng, Xiangzheng Zhang

entry.summary: Presents FABLE, a forest-based adaptive bi-path RAG framework for multi-document reasoning integrating LLMs into both knowledge organization and retrieval. Addresses long-context limitations.

entry.title: AVMeme Exam: A Multimodal Multilingual Multicultural Benchmark for LLMs' Contextual and Cultural Knowledge and Thinking

author.name: Xilin Jiang, Qiaolin Wang, Junkai Wu, Xiaomin He, Zhongweiyang Xu, Yinghao Ma, Minshuo Piao, Kaiyi Yang, Xiuwen Zheng, Riki Shimizu, Yicong Chen, Arsalan Firoozi, Gavin Mischler, Sukru Samet Dindar, Richard Antonello, Linyang He, Tsun-An Hsieh, Xulin Fan, Yulun Wu, Yuesheng Ma, Chaitanya Amballa, Weixiong Chen, Jiarui Hai, Ruisi Li, Vishal Choudhari, Cong Han, Yinghao Aaron Li, Adeen Flinker, Mounya Elhilali, Emmanouil Benetos, Mark Hasegawa-Johnson, Romit Roy Choudhury, Nima Mesgarani

entry.summary: Presents AVMeme Exam, a benchmark of 1000+ iconic internet audio-visual clips spanning multiple languages/cultures, with Q&A assessing understanding from surface content to cultural context. Shows significant human-AI performance gaps.

entry.title: Performance uncertainty in medical image analysis: a large-scale investigation of confidence intervals

author.name: Pascaline Andr\'e (Sorbonne Universit\'e, Institut du Cerveau - Paris Brain Institute - ICM, CNRS, Inria, Inserm, AP-HP, H\^opital de la Piti\'e-Salp\^etri\`ere, F-75013, Paris, France), Charles Heitz (Sorbonne Universit\'e, Institut du Cerveau - Paris Brain Institute - ICM, CNRS, Inria, Inserm, AP-HP, H\^opital de la Piti\'e-Salp\^etri\`ere, F-75013, Paris, France), Evangelia Christodoulou (German Cancer Research Center), Annika Reinke (German Cancer Research Center), Carole H. Sudre (Unit for Lifelong Health and Ageing at UCL, Department of Population Science and Experimental Medicine and Hawkes InstituteCentre for Medical Image Computing, Department of Computer Science, University College London, UK), Michela Antonelli (School of Biomedical Engineering and Imaging Science, King's College London, UK), Patrick Godau (German Cancer Research Center), M. Jorge Cardoso (School of Biomedical Engineering and Imaging Science, King's College London, UK), Antoine Gilson (Sorbonne Universit\'e, Institut du Cerveau - Paris Brain Institute - ICM, CNRS, Inria, Inserm, AP-HP, H\^opital de la Piti\'e-Salp\^etri\`ere, F-75013, Paris, France), Sophie Tezenas du Montcel (Sorbonne Universit\'e, Institut du Cerveau - Paris Brain Institute - ICM, CNRS, Inria, Inserm, AP-HP, H\^opital de la Piti\'e-Salp\^etri\`ere, F-75013, Paris, France), Ga\"el Varoquaux (SODA project team, Inria Saclay-\^Ile-de-France, France), Lena Maier-Hein (German Cancer Research Center), Olivier Colliot (Sorbonne Universit\'e, Institut du Cerveau - Paris Brain Institute - ICM, CNRS, Inria, Inserm, AP-HP, H\^opital de la Piti\'e-Salp\^etri\`ere, F-75013, Paris, France)

entry.summary: Large-scale empirical analysis of confidence interval methods for medical imaging AI across 24 tasks and 19 models, examining coverage behavior under different conditions for clinical translation.

entry.title: Beyond Rigid: Benchmarking Non-Rigid Video Editing

author.name: Bingzheng Qu, Kehai Chen, Xuefeng Bai, Jun Yu, Min Zhang

entry.summary: NRVBench introduces the first comprehensive benchmark for non-rigid video editing with 180 videos across 6 physics-based categories, 2,340 task instructions, and novel NRVE-Acc evaluation metric.

entry.title: Self-Refining Video Sampling

author.name: Sangwon Jang, Taekyung Ki, Jaehyeong Jo, Saining Xie, Jaehong Yoon, Sung Ju Hwang

entry.summary: Self-refining video sampling uses pre-trained video generator as its own self-refiner through denoising autoencoder interpretation, enabling inference-time refinement without external verifiers or additional training.

entry.title: TC-IDM: Grounding Video Generation for Executable Zero-shot Robot Motion

author.name: Weishi Mi, Yong Bao, Xiaowei Chi, Xiaozhu Ju, Zhiyuan Qin, Kuangzhi Ge, Kai Tang, Peidong Jia, Shanghang Zhang, Jian Tang

entry.summary: Proposes TC-IDM that bridges world model video generation and robot action by focusing on tool's imagined trajectory as intermediate representation.

entry.title: Claude’s Constitutional Structure

author.name: Zvi

entry.summary: Zvi's detailed analysis of Claude's constitution structure, examining how Anthropic has designed Claude's values and behaviors. Part one of a three-part series examining the document's design philosophy and implications.

entry.title: A Syllogistic Probe: Tracing the Evolution of Logic Reasoning in Large Language Models

author.name: Zhengqing Zang, Yuqi Ding, Yanmei Gu, Changkai Song, Zhengkai Yang, Guoping Du, Junbo Zhao, Haobo Wang

entry.summary: Uses syllogistic reasoning with existential import as a probe to trace how LLMs evolve from intuition-driven to formal logic, finding that model scaling and thinking capabilities accelerate this shift.

entry.title: RareAlert: Aligning heterogeneous large language model reasoning for early rare disease risk screening

author.name: Xi Chen, Hongru Zhou, Huahui Yi, Shiyu Feng, Hanyu Zhou, Tiancheng He, Mingke You, Li Wang, Qiankun Li, Kun Wang, Weili Fu, Kang Li, Jian Li

entry.summary: Presents RareAlert for early rare disease screening using heterogeneous LLM reasoning on primary-visit information, integrating multiple models' reasoning for patient-level risk prediction.

entry.title: Deconstructing Instruction-Following: A New Benchmark for Granular Evaluation of Large Language Model Instruction Compliance Abilities

author.name: Alberto Purpura, Li Wang, Sahil Badyal, Eugenio Beaufrand, Adam Faulkner

entry.summary: Introduces MOSAIC benchmark with up to 20 application-oriented constraints for granular evaluation of LLM instruction compliance, revealing compliance varies by constraint type, quantity, and position.

entry.title: Breaking Task Impasses Quickly: Adaptive Neuro-Symbolic Learning for Open-World Robotics

author.name: Pierrick Lorang

entry.summary: Presents neuro-symbolic framework integrating hierarchical abstractions with task and motion planning for rapid robotics adaptation, validated in manipulation and autonomous driving.

entry.title: Sparsity-Aware Low-Rank Representation for Efficient Fine-Tuning of Large Language Models

author.name: Longteng Zhang, Sen Wu, Shuai Hou, Zhengyu Qing, Zhuo Zheng, Danning Ke, Qihong Lin, Qiang Wang, Shaohuai Shi, Xiaowen Chu

entry.summary: Introduces SALR unifying low-rank adaptation with sparse pruning under MSE framework, proving static pruning of frozen weights preserves LoRA effectiveness while reducing costs.

entry.title: Latent-Space Contrastive Reinforcement Learning for Stable and Efficient LLM Reasoning

author.name: Lianlei Shan, Han Chen, Yixuan Wang, Zhenjie Liu, Wei Li

entry.summary: Proposes DeepLatent Reasoning (DLR), a latent-space bidirectional contrastive RL framework addressing sample inefficiency, gradient variance, and catastrophic forgetting in LLM reasoning.

entry.title: The Script is All You Need: An Agentic Framework for Long-Horizon Dialogue-to-Cinematic Video Generation

author.name: Chenyu Mu, Xin He, Qu Yang, Wanshun Chen, Jiadi Yao, Huang Liu, Zihao Yi, Bo Zhao, Xingyu Chen, Ruotian Ma, Fanghua Ye, Erkun Yang, Cheng Deng, Zhaopeng Tu, Xiaolong Li, Linus

entry.summary: Introduces agentic framework for dialogue-to-cinematic video with ScripterAgent that translates dialogue into executable cinematic scripts, using ScriptBench benchmark.

entry.title: DF-RAG: Query-Aware Diversity for Retrieval-Augmented Generation

author.name: Saadat Hasan Khan, Spencer Hong, Jingyu Wu, Kevin Lybarger, Youbing Yin, Erin Babinsky, Daben Liu

entry.summary: Introduces DF-RAG, which incorporates diversity into retrieval using Maximal Marginal Relevance to improve performance on reasoning-intensive QA by reducing redundancy in retrieved chunks.

entry.title: A Computational Approach to Visual Metonymy

author.name: Saptarshi Ghosh, Linfeng Liu, Tianyu Jiang

entry.summary: Presents first computational investigation of visual metonymy, introducing pipeline grounded in semiotic theory and ViMET dataset with 2,000 multiple-choice questions evaluating multimodal reasoning on indirect visual references.

entry.title: U-Fold: Dynamic Intent-Aware Context Folding for User-Centric Agents

author.name: Jin Su, Runnan Fang, Yeqiu Li, Xiaobin Wang, Shihao Cai, Pengjun Xie, Ningyu Zhang, Fajie Yuan

entry.summary: Proposes U-Fold, a dynamic context-folding framework for user-centric agents that tracks evolving user intent and preserves fine-grained constraints across multi-turn dialogues.

entry.title: Latent Knowledge as a Predictor of Fact Acquisition in Fine-Tuned Large Language Models

author.name: Daniel B. Hier, Tayo Obafemi-Ajayi

entry.summary: Studies how latent knowledge (present in weights but not reliably accessible under deterministic decoding) predicts fact acquisition during fine-tuning using ontology term mapping tasks.

entry.title: CoT-Seg: Rethinking Segmentation with Chain-of-Thought Reasoning and Self-Correction

author.name: Shiu-hong Kao, Chak Ho Huang, Huaiqian Liu, Yu-Wing Tai, Chi-Keung Tang

entry.summary: Proposes CoT-Seg, training-free reasoning segmentation framework using GPT-4o for chain-of-thought query decomposition with self-correction for complex reasoning segmentation tasks.

entry.title: Acoustic Field Video for Multimodal Scene Understanding

author.name: Daehwa Kim, Chris Harrison

entry.summary: Introduces acoustic field video as a new multimodal input for VLMs, using beamforming microphone arrays to provide spatially grounded sound visualization for enhanced scene understanding.

entry.title: Think Locally, Explain Globally: Graph-Guided LLM Investigations via Local Reasoning and Belief Propagation

author.name: Saurabh Jha, Rohan Arora, Bhavya, Noah Zheutlin, Paulina Toro Isaza, Laura Shwartz, Yu Deng, Daby Sow, Ruchi Mahindru, Ruchir Puri

entry.summary: Proposes a graph-guided approach for LLM investigations combining local reasoning with belief propagation to handle hidden dependency structures in open-ended investigations over massive operational data.

entry.title: Yunjue Agent Tech Report: A Fully Reproducible, Zero-Start In-Situ Self-Evolving Agent System for Open-Ended Tasks

author.name: Haotian Li, Shijun Yang, Weizhen Qi, Silei Zhao, Rui Hua, Mingzhu Song, Xiaojian Yang, Chao Peng

entry.summary: Proposes In-Situ Self-Evolving paradigm for agents in open-ended environments, using tool evolution as capability expansion pathway with verifiable binary feedback signals.

entry.title: Health-SCORE: Towards Scalable Rubrics for Improving Health-LLMs

author.name: Zhichao Yang, Sepehr Janghorbani, Dongxu Zhang, Jun Han, Qian Qian, Andrew Ressler II, Gregory D. Lyng, Sanjit Singh Batra, Robert E. Tillman

entry.summary: Introduces Health-SCORE, a scalable rubric-based framework reducing development costs while enabling use as structured reward for RL training with safety-aware supervision.

entry.title: BibAgent: An Agentic Framework for Traceable Miscitation Detection in Scientific Literature

author.name: Peiran Li, Fangzhou Lin, Shuo Xing, Xiang Zheng, Xi Hong, Jiashuo Sun, Zhengzhong Tu, Chaoqun Ni

entry.summary: Introduces BibAgent, agentic framework for automated citation verification integrating retrieval, reasoning, and adaptive evidence aggregation with novel approach for paywalled references.

entry.title: Boltzmann-GPT: Bridging Energy-Based World Models and Language Generation

author.name: Junichiro Niimi

entry.summary: Proposes Boltzmann-GPT architecture separating world models (Deep Boltzmann Machine) from language models (frozen GPT-2) with adapter projection. Demonstrates improved domain-specific generation.

entry.title: Prompt Driven Development with Claude Code: Building a Complete TUI Framework for the Ring Programming Language

author.name: Mahmoud Samir Fayed, Ahmed Samir Fayed

entry.summary: Empirical case study developing 7,420-line TUI framework using Claude Code through 107 prompts over three days, analyzing prompt categories and development patterns.

entry.title: Calibrating Beyond English: Language Diversity for Better Quantized Multilingual LLM

author.name: Everlyn Asiko Chimoto, Mostafa Elhoushi, Bruce A. Bassett

entry.summary: Shows multilingual LLM quantization benefits from non-English calibration sets, with systematic evaluation of 8 calibration settings across 10 languages showing consistent perplexity gains versus English-only baselines.

entry.title: Reasoning Beyond Literal: Cross-style Multimodal Reasoning for Figurative Language Understanding

author.name: Seyyed Saeid Cheshmi, Hahnemann Ortiz, James Mooney, Dongyeop Kang

entry.summary: Proposes three-step framework for developing VLMs that can interpret multimodal figurative language (sarcasm, humor, metaphor), provide transparent reasoning traces, and generalize across figurative styles.

entry.title: Align to the Pivot: Dual Alignment with Self-Feedback for Multilingual Math Reasoning

author.name: Chunxu Zhao, Xin Huang, Xue Han, Shujian Huang, Chao Deng, Junlan Feng

entry.summary: Presents PASMR for improving multilingual math reasoning by designating primary language as pivot, translating questions for alignment, and using self-feedback for preference optimization.

entry.title: GLEN-Bench: A Graph-Language based Benchmark for Nutritional Health

author.name: Jiatan Huang, Zheyuan Zhang, Tianyi Ma, Mingchen Li, Yaning Zheng, Yanfang Ye, Chuxu Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces GLEN-Bench, first comprehensive graph-language benchmark for nutritional health assessment combining health records, food composition data, and food access metrics.

entry.title: Hierarchical Text Classification with LLM-Refined Taxonomies

author.name: Jonas Golde, Nicolaas Jedema, Ravi Krishnan, Phong Le

entry.summary: Presents TaxMorph, a framework using LLMs to transform taxonomies through operations like renaming, merging, splitting for hierarchical text classification. Shows LLM-refined taxonomies outperform human-curated ones.

entry.title: FGGM: Fisher-Guided Gradient Masking for Continual Learning

author.name: Chao-Hong Tan, Qian Chen, Wen Wang, Yukun Ma, Chong Zhang, Chong Deng, Qinglin Zhang, Xiangang Li, Jieping Ye

entry.summary: Proposes FGGM using Fisher Information to guide gradient masking for continual learning, mitigating catastrophic forgetting without requiring historical data. Shows 9.6% improvement over SFT on TRACE benchmark.

entry.title: PocketGS: On-Device Training of 3D Gaussian Splatting for High Perceptual Modeling

author.name: Wenzhi Guo, Guangchi Fang, Shu Yang, Bing Wang

entry.summary: Proposes PocketGS enabling on-device 3DGS training on mobile devices under minute-scale training budgets and memory constraints while preserving perceptual fidelity.

entry.title: PILOT: A Perceptive Integrated Low-level Controller for Loco-manipulation over Unstructured Scenes

author.name: Xinru Cui, Linxi Feng, Yixuan Zhou, Haoqi Han, Zhe Liu, Hesheng Wang

entry.summary: Introduces PILOT, a single-stage RL framework for perceptive loco-manipulation in humanoid robots with cross-modal perception for terrain awareness and precise foot placement.

entry.title: Auditing Disability Representation in Vision-Language Models

author.name: Srikant Panda, Sourabh Singh Yadav, Palkesh Malviya

entry.summary: Audits 15 state-of-the-art VLMs for disability representation bias, introducing a benchmark with paired neutral and disability-contextualized prompts across 9 disability categories to measure interpretive shift.

entry.title: GAIA: A Data Flywheel System for Training GUI Test-Time Scaling Critic Models

author.name: Shaokang Wang, Pei Fu, Ruoceng Zhang, Shaojie Zhang, Xiuwen Xi, Jiahui Yang, Bin Qin, Ying Huang, Zhenbo Luo, Jian Luan

entry.summary: Proposes GAIA data flywheel system training GUI Action Critic Models for test-time scaling, using intuitive critics with tree search for both immediate and long-term action evaluation.

entry.title: Why Keep Your Doubts to Yourself? Trading Visual Uncertainties in Multi-Agent Bandit Systems

author.name: Jusheng Zhang, Yijia Fan, Kaitong Cai, Jing Yang, Jiawei Yao, Jian Wang, Guanlong Qu, Ziliang Chen, Keze Wang

entry.summary: Introduces Agora framework treating epistemic uncertainty as tradable asset in multi-agent VLM systems, enabling decentralized market-based coordination with profitability-driven trading.

entry.title: MathMixup: Boosting LLM Mathematical Reasoning with Difficulty-Controllable Data Synthesis and Curriculum Learning

author.name: Xuchen Li, Jing Chen, Xuzhao Li, Hao Liang, Xiaohuan Zhou, Taifeng Wang, Wentao Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces MathMixup, a data synthesis paradigm for generating difficulty-controllable mathematical reasoning problems through hybrid decomposition strategies. Enables curriculum learning for LLMs.

entry.title: ChemNavigator: Agentic AI Discovery of Design Rules for Organic Photocatalysts

author.name: Iman Peivaste, Ahmed Makradi, Salim Belouettar

entry.summary: Presents ChemNavigator, a multi-agent AI system for autonomous discovery of structure-property relationships in organic photocatalysts through hypothesis-driven exploration.

entry.title: Spectral Geometry for Deep Learning: Compression and Hallucination Detection via Random Matrix Theory

author.name: Davide Ettori

entry.summary: Proposes unified framework using spectral geometry and RMT for both hallucination detection (EigenTrack) and model compression (RMT-KD) through eigenvalue structure analysis.

entry.title: Status Hierarchies in Language Models

author.name: Emilio Barkett

entry.summary: Investigates whether LLMs form status hierarchies in multi-agent settings, adapting expectation states framework to show models reproduce social hierarchical patterns from training data.

entry.title: BoRP: Bootstrapped Regression Probing for Scalable and Human-Aligned LLM Evaluation

author.name: Peng Sun, Xiangyu Zhang, Duan Wu

entry.summary: Introduces BoRP framework for LLM evaluation using bootstrapped regression probing of latent space geometry. Claims to outperform generative evaluation approaches on industrial datasets.

entry.title: PRECISE: Reducing the Bias of LLM Evaluations Using Prediction-Powered Ranking Estimation

author.name: Abhishek Divekar, Anirban Majumder

entry.summary: Introduces PRECISE framework combining minimal human annotations (100 queries) with LLM judgments via Prediction-Powered Inference for unbiased ranking metric estimation.

entry.title: AnyView: Synthesizing Any Novel View in Dynamic Scenes

author.name: Basile Van Hoorick, Dian Chen, Shun Iwase, Pavel Tokmakov, Muhammad Zubair Irshad, Igor Vasiljevic, Swati Gupta, Fangzhou Cheng, Sergey Zakharov, Vitor Campagnolo Guizilini

entry.summary: Introduces AnyView, a diffusion-based video generation framework for dynamic view synthesis with minimal geometric assumptions. Leverages 2D, 3D, and 4D datasets to train a generalist spatiotemporal representation for zero-shot novel view synthesis.

entry.title: What Language Models Know But Don't Say: Non-Generative Prior Extraction for Generalization

author.name: Sara Rezaeimanesh, Mohammad M. Ghassemi

entry.summary: Proposes LoID, a method for extracting informative prior distributions from LLMs for Bayesian regression by probing token-level predictions across semantic directions without text generation.

entry.title: LLM-Generated or Human-Written? Comparing Review and Non-Review Papers on ArXiv

author.name: Yanai Elazar, Maria Antoniak

entry.summary: Investigates ArXiv's claim of high LLM-generated content in review papers by measuring LLM content prevalence. Finds substantial increase in both review and non-review papers, but absolute numbers of LLM-generated non-review papers are ~6x higher.

entry.title: Semi-Supervised Domain Adaptation with Latent Diffusion for Pathology Image Classification

author.name: Tengyue Zhang, Ruiwen Ding, Luoting Zhuang, Yuxiao Wu, Erika F. Rodriguez, William Hsu

entry.summary: Proposes semi-supervised domain adaptation framework using latent diffusion for pathology image classification, generating morphology-preserving target-aware synthetic images conditioned on foundation model features.

entry.title: StyleDecoupler: Generalizable Artistic Style Disentanglement

author.name: Zexi Jia, Jinchao Zhang, Jie Zhou

entry.summary: StyleDecoupler uses information theory to disentangle artistic style from content by leveraging differences between multi-modal and uni-modal vision models. Also introduces WeART, a large benchmark of 280K artworks across 152 styles.

entry.title: V-Loop: Visual Logical Loop Verification for Hallucination Detection in Medical Visual Question Answering

author.name: Mengyuan Jin, Zehui Liao, Yong Xia

entry.summary: V-Loop proposes training-free Visual Logical Loop Verification for hallucination detection in medical VQA, verifying factual correctness of specific answers rather than estimating general uncertainty.

entry.title: Efficient Complex-Valued Vision Transformers for MRI Classification Directly from k-Space

author.name: Moritz Rempe, Lukas T. Rotkopf, Marco Schlimbach, Helmut Becker, Fabian H\"orst, Johannes Haubold, Philipp Dammann, Kevin Kr\"oninger, Jens Kleesiek

entry.summary: kViT proposes complex-valued Vision Transformer for MRI classification directly from k-space data with radial patching strategy that respects spectral energy distribution.

entry.title: Trustworthy Evaluation of Robotic Manipulation: A New Benchmark and AutoEval Methods

author.name: Mengyuan Liu, Juyi Sheng, Peiming Li, Ziyi Wang, Tianming Xu, Tiantian Xu, Hong Liu

entry.summary: Proposes Eval-Actions benchmark and AutoEval architecture for trustworthy evaluation of robotic manipulation, distinguishing genuine policy behaviors from teleoperation and assessing execution quality.

entry.title: Dario Amodei – The Adolescence of Technology

author.name: habryka

entry.summary: Links to Dario Amodei's new essay 'Confronting and Overcoming the Risks of Powerful AI,' describing humanity's technological adolescence and the need to navigate AI development carefully. Important for understanding Anthropic's strategic thinking.

entry.title: DIML: Differentiable Inverse Mechanism Learning from Behaviors of Multi-Agent Learning Trajectories

author.name: Zhiyu An, Wan Du

entry.summary: Proposes DIML for inverse mechanism learning, recovering unknown incentive mechanisms from observed multi-agent learning trajectories by differentiating through learning dynamics models.

entry.title: Emergence of Phonemic, Syntactic, and Semantic Representations in Artificial Neural Networks

author.name: Pierre Orhan, Pablo Diego-Sim\'on, Emmnanuel Chemla, Yair Lakretz, Yves Boubenec, Jean-R\'emi King

entry.summary: Investigates whether phonemic, lexical, and syntactic representations emerge during neural network training, finding sequential learning stages in both speech and text models.

entry.title: TEA-Bench: A Systematic Benchmarking of Tool-enhanced Emotional Support Dialogue Agent

author.name: Xingyu Sui, Yanyan Zhao, Yulin Hu, Jiahe Guo, Weixiang Zhao, Bing Qin

entry.summary: Introduces TEA-Bench, first interactive benchmark for tool-augmented agents in emotional support conversations with MCP-style tool environment and process-level metrics.

entry.title: Bridging Expectation Signals: LLM-Based Experiments and a Behavioral Kalman Filter Framework

author.name: Yu Wang, Xiangchen Liu

entry.summary: Develops Behavioral Kalman Filter framework to quantify how LLM agents update beliefs when presented with individual vs aggregate signals, finding consistent behavioral patterns.

entry.title: ShapLoRA: Allocation of Low-rank Adaption on Large Language Models via Shapley Value Inspired Importance Estimation

author.name: Yi Zhao, Qinghua Yao, Xinyuan song, Wei Zhu

entry.summary: Proposes ShapLoRA for LoRA rank allocation using Shapley value-inspired importance estimation. Combines sensitivity measures with coalition game theory for explainable rank importance.

entry.title: Reflecting Twice before Speaking with Empathy: Self-Reflective Alternating Inference for Empathy-Aware End-to-End Spoken Dialogue

author.name: Yuhang Jia, Pei Liu, Haoqin Sun, Jiaming Zhou, Xuxin Cheng, Cao Liu, Ke Zeng, Xunliang Cai, Yong Qin

entry.summary: Proposes self-reflective alternating inference framework for empathetic spoken dialogue using natural language evaluation model EmpathyEval instead of rigid supervised signals.

entry.title: Are Video Generation Models Geographically Fair? An Attraction-Centric Evaluation of Global Visual Knowledge

author.name: Xiao Liu, Jiawei Zhang

entry.summary: Investigates geographic fairness in text-to-video models by introducing GAP framework and GEOATTRACTION-500 benchmark with 500 globally distributed tourist attractions to assess regional bias.

entry.title: EquiForm: Noise-Robust SE(3)-Equivariant Policy Learning from 3D Point Clouds

author.name: Zhiyuan Zhang, Yu She

entry.summary: Introduces EquiForm, a noise-robust SE(3)-equivariant policy learning framework for point cloud-based manipulation that explicitly corrects geometric deviations.

entry.title: Agentic AI for Self-Driving Laboratories in Soft Matter: Taxonomy, Benchmarks,and Open Challenges

author.name: Xuanzhou Chen, Audrey Wang, Stanley Yin, Hanyang Jiang, Dong Zhang

entry.summary: Comprehensive survey framing self-driving laboratories as agent-environment interaction problems, reviewing Bayesian optimization and other AI methods for closed-loop experimentation with soft matter as representative setting.

entry.title: A Balanced Neuro-Symbolic Approach for Commonsense Abductive Logic

author.name: Joseph Cotnareanu, Didier Chetelat, Yingxue Zhang, Mark Coates

entry.summary: Proposes neuro-symbolic approach using logic solver feedback to iteratively augment problems with commonsense relations from LLMs, improving complex proof planning.

entry.title: Failing on Bias Mitigation: Investigating Why Predictive Models Struggle with Government Data

author.name: Hongbo Bo, Jingyu Hu, Debbie Watson, Weiru Liu

entry.summary: Analyzes why bias mitigation techniques fail on government data using crime rate prediction as case study. Finds data properties, not model architectures, cause mitigation failures.

entry.title: TrojanGYM: A Detector-in-the-Loop LLM for Adaptive RTL Hardware Trojan Insertion

author.name: Saideep Sreekumar, Zeng Wang, Akashdeep Saha, Weihua Xiao, Minghao Shao, Muhammad Shafique, Ozgur Sinanoglu, Ramesh Karri, Johann Knechtel

entry.summary: Introduces TrojanGYM, an agentic LLM framework using GPT-4, LLaMA-3.3-70B, and Gemini-2.5Pro for adaptive hardware trojan insertion to expose detector blind spots.

entry.title: Meta-Judging with Large Language Models: Concepts, Methods, and Challenges

author.name: Hugo Silva, Mateus Mendes, Hugo Gon\c{c}alo Oliveira

entry.summary: Comprehensive survey on LLM-as-Meta-Judge paradigm covering conceptual foundations, mechanisms, alignment training, evaluation, and emerging applications.

entry.title: Linguistic and Argument Diversity in Synthetic Data for Function-Calling Agents

author.name: Dan Greenstein, Zohar Karnin, Chen Amiraz, Oren Somekh

entry.summary: Proposes method for generating synthetic training data for function-calling agents by optimizing linguistic and argument diversity without hand-crafted rules.

entry.title: \textsc{NaVIDA}: Vision-Language Navigation with Inverse Dynamics Augmentation

author.name: Weiye Zhu, Zekai Zhang, Xiangchen Wang, Hewei Pan, Teng Wang, Tiantian Geng, Rongtao Xu, Feng Zheng

entry.summary: Introduces NaVIDA framework for vision-language navigation that explicitly models how actions causally transform visual observations, using inverse dynamics to address unstable behaviors and weak generalization in VLN agents.

entry.title: Temp-R1: A Unified Autonomous Agent for Complex Temporal KGQA via Reverse Curriculum Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Zhaoyan Gong, Zhiqiang Liu, Songze Li, Xiaoke Guo, Yuanxiang Liu, Xinle Deng, Zhizhen Liu, Lei Liang, Huajun Chen, Wen Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces Temp-R1, first autonomous end-to-end agent for temporal knowledge graph QA via reinforcement learning. Uses reverse curriculum learning and specialized internal actions to handle cognitive overload.

entry.title: Dep-Search: Learning Dependency-Aware Reasoning Traces with Persistent Memory

author.name: Yanming Liu, Xinyue Peng, Zixuan Yan, Yanxin Shen, Wenjie Xu, Yuefeng Huang, Xinyi Wang, Jiannan Cao, Jianwei Yin, Xuhong Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes Dep-Search framework learning dependency-aware reasoning traces with persistent memory for RAG systems, addressing implicit reasoning limitations for managing cross-step dependencies.
