entry.title: Beyond Superficial Unlearning: Sharpness-Aware Robust Erasure of Hallucinations in Multimodal LLMs

author.name: Xianya Fang, Feiyang Ren, Xiang Chen, Yu Tian, Zhen Bi, Haiyang Yu, Sheng-Jun Huang

entry.summary: Proposes SARE for robust hallucination unlearning in multimodal LLMs. Shows standard unlearning achieves only superficial suppression; uses Targeted-SAM to flatten loss landscape and prevent hallucination resurgence.

entry.title: GRIP: Algorithm-Agnostic Machine Unlearning for Mixture-of-Experts via Geometric Router Constraints

author.name: Andy Zhu, Rongzhe Wei, Yupu Gu, Pan Li

entry.summary: Proposes GRIP for machine unlearning in Mixture-of-Experts models. Identifies that traditional methods manipulate routers rather than erasing knowledge; uses geometric constraint to preserve routing stability.

entry.title: Auto-Regressive Masked Diffusion Models

author.name: Mahdi Karami, Ali Ghodsi

entry.summary: Proposes Auto-Regressive Masked Diffusion (ARMD) that reframes masked diffusion as block-wise causal model. Enables computing all conditional probabilities in single parallel forward pass.

entry.title: White-Box Sensitivity Auditing with Steering Vectors

author.name: Hannah Cyberey, Yangfeng Ji, David Evans

entry.summary: Proposes white-box sensitivity auditing using activation steering vectors for LLMs. Enables more rigorous assessment of model properties like bias through internal perturbations rather than just input testing.

entry.title: Sequence Repetition Enhances Token Embeddings and Improves Sequence Labeling with Decoder-only Language Models

author.name: Matija Luka Kuki\'c, Marko \v{C}uljak, David Duki\'c, Martin Tutek, Jan \v{S}najder

entry.summary: Explores sequence repetition as a technique to enable decoder-only models to leverage full context for sequence labeling tasks without removing causal masks. Less invasive alternative to architectural modifications.

entry.title: PEAR: Pairwise Evaluation for Automatic Relative Scoring in Machine Translation

author.name: Lorenzo Proietti, Roman Grundkiewicz, Matt Post

entry.summary: Introduces PEAR, a pairwise QE metric for MT evaluation that predicts direction and magnitude of quality differences between translation candidates. Outperforms single-candidate baselines with same training data.

entry.title: A Contrastive Pre-trained Foundation Model for Deciphering Imaging Noisomics across Modalities

author.name: Yuanjie Gu, Yiqun Wang, Chaohui Yu, Ang Xuan, Fan Wang, Zhi Lu, Biqin Dong

entry.summary: Introduces 'Noisomics' framework shifting from noise suppression to systematic noise decoding via Contrastive Pre-trained Foundation Model, breaking traditional deep learning scaling laws for noise characterization.

entry.title: C-RADIOv4 (Tech Report)

author.name: Mike Ranzinger, Greg Heinrich, Collin McCarthy, Jan Kautz, Andrew Tao, Bryan Catanzaro, Pavlo Molchanov

entry.summary: Technical report on C-RADIOv4, multi-teacher distilled vision backbone with updated teachers (SigLIP2, DINOv3, SAM3), improved any-resolution support, and ViTDet option.

entry.title: FMIR, a foundation model-based Image Registration Framework for Robust Image Registration

author.name: Fengting Zhang, Yue He, Qinghao Liu, Yaonan Wang, Xiang Chen, Hang Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes FMIR, foundation model-based medical image registration framework achieving strong out-of-domain generalization when trained on single dataset, addressing key limitation of deep learning registration.

entry.title: VAE-REPA: Variational Autoencoder Representation Alignment for Efficient Diffusion Training

author.name: Mengmeng Wang, Dengyang Jiang, Liuzhuozheng Li, Yucheng Lin, Guojiang Shen, Xiangjie Kong, Yong Liu, Guang Dai, Jingdong Wang

entry.summary: VAE-REPA leverages off-the-shelf VAE features as intrinsic guidance for efficient diffusion transformer training, exploiting VAE's rich texture and structural priors without requiring external representation encoders.

entry.title: ARMOR: Agentic Reasoning for Methods Orchestration and Reparameterization for Robust Adversarial Attacks

author.name: Gabriel Lee Jun Rong, Christos Korgialas, Dion Jia Xu Ho, Pai Chet Ng, Xiaoxiao Miao, Konstantinos N. Plataniotis

entry.summary: ARMOR introduces agentic adversarial attack framework that orchestrates multiple attack primitives (CW, JSMA, STA) via VLM-guided agents with LLM-adaptive parameter tuning in real-time.

entry.title: MetaWorld: Skill Transfer and Composition in a Hierarchical World Model for Grounding High-Level Instructions

author.name: Yutong Shen, Hangxu Liu, Kailin Pei, Ruizhe Xia, Tongtong Feng

entry.summary: Proposes MetaWorld, a hierarchical world model integrating VLM-driven semantic planning with latent dynamics model for humanoid loco-manipulation with expert policy transfer.

entry.title: MMR-Bench: A Comprehensive Benchmark for Multimodal LLM Routing

author.name: Haoxuan Ma, Guannan Lai, Han-Jia Ye

entry.summary: Presents MMR-Bench, a unified benchmark for multimodal LLM routing that addresses modality fusion challenges and budget-aware evaluation for query-level model selection.

entry.title: FadeMem: Biologically-Inspired Forgetting for Efficient Agent Memory

author.name: Lei Wei, Xu Dong, Xiao Peng, Niantao Xie, Bin Wang

entry.summary: Proposes FadeMem, biologically-inspired agent memory with differential decay rates and dual-layer hierarchy governed by adaptive exponential decay modulated by semantic importance.

entry.title: MergeMix: Optimizing Mid-Training Data Mixtures via Learnable Model Merging

author.name: Jiapeng Wang, Changxin Tian, Kunlong Chen, Ziqi Liu, Jiaxin Mao, Wayne Xin Zhao, Zhiqiang Zhang, Jun Zhou

entry.summary: MergeMix determines optimal data mixing ratios for LLM training by using model merging weights as low-cost performance proxy, avoiding expensive full-scale training.

entry.title: GenAI for Social Work Field Education: Client Simulation with Real-Time Feedback

author.name: James Sungarda, Hongkai Liu, Zilong Zhou, Tien-Hsuan Wu, Johnson Chun-Sing Cheung, Ben Kao

entry.summary: Presents SWITCH, a social work training chatbot integrating client simulation with cognitively grounded profiles, real-time counseling skill classification, and Motivational Interviewing progression.

entry.title: Closing the Modality Gap Aligns Group-Wise Semantics

author.name: Eleonora Grassucci, Giordano Cicchetti, Emanuele Frasca, Aurelio Uncini, Danilo Comminiello

entry.summary: Analyzes and addresses the modality gap in CLIP-like models, showing its pronounced effect on group-level tasks like clustering and proposing method to close this gap.

entry.title: DV-VLN: Dual Verification for Reliable LLM-Based Vision-and-Language Navigation

author.name: Zijun Li, Shijie Li, Zhenxi Zhang, Bin Li, Shoujun Zhou

entry.summary: Proposes DV-VLN, a generate-then-verify framework for LLM-based vision-and-language navigation that reduces error accumulation through dual verification.

entry.title: Implementing Tensor Logic: Unifying Datalog and Neural Reasoning via Tensor Contraction

author.name: Swapn Shah (School of Data Science, University of North Carolina at Charlotte), Wlodek Zadrozny (Department of Computer Science, University of North Carolina at Charlotte)

entry.summary: Provides empirical validation of Tensor Logic framework showing equivalence between recursive Datalog rules and tensor contractions, demonstrating neuro-symbolic unification on a biblical genealogy graph with 1,972 individuals.

entry.title: Sentipolis: Emotion-Aware Agents for Social Simulations

author.name: Chiyuan Fu, Lyuhao Chen, Yunze Xiao, Weihao Xuan, Carlos Busso, Mona Diab

entry.summary: Introduces Sentipolis framework for emotionally stateful LLM agents using continuous PAD representation, dual-speed emotion dynamics, and emotion-memory coupling for social simulation.

entry.title: Think-Augmented Function Calling: Improving LLM Parameter Accuracy Through Embedded Reasoning

author.name: Lei Wei, Jinpeng Ou, Xiao Peng, Bin Wang

entry.summary: Proposes Think-Augmented Function Calling (TAFC) adding explicit reasoning via universal 'think' parameter augmentation at both function and parameter levels for improved accuracy.

entry.title: Interpretable and Sparse Linear Attention with Decoupled Membership-Subspace Modeling via MCR2 Objective

author.name: Tianyuan Liu, Libin Hou, Linyuan Wang, Bin Yan

entry.summary: Decouples membership and subspace matrices in MCR2 objective to derive interpretable sparse linear attention. Proposes directly learning membership matrices for improved white-box transformers.

entry.title: A Mechanistic View on Video Generation as World Models: State and Dynamics

author.name: Luozhou Wang, Zhifei Chen, Yihua Du, Dongyu Yan, Wenhang Ge, Guibao Shen, Xinli Xu, Leyi Wu, Man Chen, Tianshuo Xu, Peiran Ren, Xin Tao, Pengfei Wan, Ying-Cong Chen

entry.summary: Proposes taxonomy for understanding video generation models as world models, distinguishing between state construction (implicit/explicit) and dynamics modeling approaches.

entry.title: Beyond Instrumental and Substitutive Paradigms: Introducing Machine Culture as an Emergent Phenomenon in Large Language Models

author.name: Yueqing Hu, Xinyang Peng, Yukun Zhao, Lin Qiu, Ka-lai Hung, Kaiping Peng

entry.summary: Challenges instrumental and substitutive paradigms for understanding LLMs, proposing Machine Culture as emergent phenomenon. 2x2 factorial design across 8 multimodal tasks.

entry.title: Learning to Collaborate: An Orchestrated-Decentralized Framework for Peer-to-Peer LLM Federation

author.name: Inderjeet Singh, Eleonore Vissol-Gaudin, Andikan Otung, Motoyoshi Sekiya

entry.summary: Introduces KNEXA-FL for orchestrated decentralized federated learning of LLMs, addressing peer selection for avoiding negative transfer while maintaining privacy and data sovereignty.

entry.title: Data-Driven Information-Theoretic Causal Bounds under Unmeasured Confounding

author.name: Yonghan Jung, Bogyeong Kang

entry.summary: Develops data-driven information-theoretic framework for causal effect bounds under unmeasured confounding. Overcomes limitations of existing approaches without requiring external inputs.

entry.title: Addressing LLM Diversity by Infusing Random Concepts

author.name: Pulin Agrawal, Prasoon Goyal

entry.summary: Demonstrates that prepending random words/sentences unrelated to prompts increases diversity in LLM outputs, with systematic evaluation protocol using diversity metrics.

entry.title: Mitigating the OWASP Top 10 For Large Language Models Applications using Intelligent Agents

author.name: Mohammad Fasha, Faisal Abul Rub, Nasim Matar, Bilal Sowan, Mohammad Al Khaldy

entry.summary: Presents framework using LLM-enabled intelligent agents to mitigate OWASP Top 10 security vulnerabilities in LLM applications. Addresses risks to data integrity, confidentiality, and service availability.

entry.title: Typhoon-S: Minimal Open Post-Training for Sovereign Large Language Models

author.name: Kunat Pipatanakul, Pittawat Taveekitworachai

entry.summary: Introduces Typhoon-S framework for creating sovereign LLMs with minimal post-training resources, addressing needs of regional institutions with limited compute who require control over model weights and training data.

entry.title: A multimodal vision foundation model for generalizable knee pathology

author.name: Kang Yu, Dingyu Wang, Zimu Yuan, Nan Zhou, Jiajun Liu, Jiaxin Liu, Shanggui Liu, Yaoyan Zheng, Huishu Yuan, Di Huang, Dong Jiang

entry.summary: Introduces OrthoFoundation, multimodal vision foundation model for musculoskeletal pathology trained on large-scale curated dataset. Addresses fragmentation of task-specific approaches in orthopedic AI.

entry.title: ART for Diffusion Sampling: A Reinforcement Learning Approach to Timestep Schedule

author.name: Yilie Huang, Wenpin Tang, Xunyu Zhou

entry.summary: Introduces ART (Adaptive Reparameterized Time) for diffusion sampling, formulating timestep scheduling as continuous-time RL problem. Proves recovering optimal solution for minimal discretization error.

entry.title: SMART: Scalable Mesh-free Aerodynamic Simulations from Raw Geometries using a Transformer-based Surrogate Model

author.name: Jan Hagnberger, Mathias Niepert

entry.summary: Introduces SMART, transformer-based mesh-free surrogate model for aerodynamic simulations from point-cloud geometry representations, avoiding expensive simulation mesh generation for new geometries.

entry.title: $\alpha^3$-SecBench: A Large-Scale Evaluation Suite of Security, Resilience, and Trust for LLM-based UAV Agents over 6G Networks

author.name: Mohamed Amine Ferrag, Abderrahmane Lakas, Merouane Debbah

entry.summary: Introduces α³-SecBench, first large-scale security evaluation suite for LLM-based UAV agents under adversarial conditions in 6G networks, extending α³-Bench with adversarial scenarios.

entry.title: Ordering-based Causal Discovery via Generalized Score Matching

author.name: Vy Vo, He Zhao, Trung Le, Edwin V. Bonilla, Dinh Phung

entry.summary: Extends score matching framework for causal discovery to discrete data, introducing leaf discriminant criterion based on discrete score function for topological order identification.

entry.title: Mixture-of-Models: Unifying Heterogeneous Agents via N-Way Self-Evaluating Deliberation

author.name: Tims Pecerskis, Aivars Smirnovs

entry.summary: Introduces N-Way Self-Evaluating Deliberation (NSED) protocol for runtime mixture-of-models that dynamically selects and combines heterogeneous expert agents. Treats model selection as a Knapsack optimization problem with live telemetry.

entry.title: Revisiting Modality Invariance in a Multilingual Speech-Text Model via Neuron-Level Analysis

author.name: Toshiki Nakai, Varsha Suresh, Vera Demberg

entry.summary: Investigates modality invariance in SeamlessM4T v2 through neuron-level analysis, examining whether spoken and written forms of the same language are represented consistently across modality and language.

entry.title: EFT-CoT: A Multi-Agent Chain-of-Thought Framework for Emotion-Focused Therapy

author.name: Lanqing Du, Yunong Li, YuJie Long, Shihong Chen

entry.summary: Proposes EFT-CoT, an Emotion-Focused Therapy multi-agent chain-of-thought framework for mental health QA using eight specialized agents following bottom-up emotional processing trajectory.

entry.title: TechING: Towards Real World Technical Image Understanding via VLMs

author.name: Tafazzul Nadeem, Bhavik Shangari, Manish Rai, Gagan Raj Gupta, Ashutosh Modi

entry.summary: Introduces TechING, a synthetically generated corpus for training VLMs on technical diagram understanding (flowcharts, block diagrams) with evaluation on real hand-drawn images.

entry.title: Evaluating Morphological Plausibility of Subword Tokenization via Statistical Alignment with Morpho-Syntactic Features

author.name: Abishek Stephen, Jind\v{r}ich Libovick\'y

entry.summary: Presents novel metric for evaluating morphological plausibility of subword segmentation using morpho-syntactic features instead of gold morpheme boundaries, enabling broader language coverage.

entry.title: The Voice of Equity: A Systematic Evaluation of Bias Mitigation Techniques for Speech-Based Cognitive Impairment Detection Across Architectures and Demographics

author.name: Yasaman Haghbin, Sina Rashidi, Ali Zolnour, Maryam Zolnoori

entry.summary: Presents first comprehensive fairness analysis framework for speech-based cognitive impairment detection, systematically evaluating bias mitigation across transformer architectures and demographic subgroups on multilingual data.

entry.title: SpatialMath: Spatial Comprehension-Infused Symbolic Reasoning for Mathematical Problem-Solving

author.name: Ashutosh Bajpai, Akshat Bhandari, Akshay Nambi, Tanmoy Chakraborty

entry.summary: Introduces SpatialMath framework integrating spatial comprehension with symbolic reasoning for mathematical problem-solving, using specialized perception module to extract spatially-grounded representations for geometric problems.

entry.title: Ego4OOD: Rethinking Egocentric Video Domain Generalization via Covariate Shift Scoring

author.name: Zahra Vaseqi, James Clark

entry.summary: Introduces Ego4OOD benchmark for egocentric video domain generalization, emphasizing covariate diversity while reducing concept shift through semantically coherent action categories across 8 geographic domains.

entry.title: SkyReels-V3 Technique Report

author.name: Debang Li, Zhengcong Fei, Tuanhui Li, Yikun Dou, Zheng Chen, Jiangping Yang, Mingyuan Fan, Jingtao Xu, Jiahua Wang, Baoxuan Gu, Mingshan Chang, Yuqiang Xie, Binjie Mao, Youqiang Zhang, Nuo Pang, Hao Zhang, Yuzhe Jin, Zhiheng Xu, Dixuan Lin, Guibin Chen, Yahui Zhou

entry.summary: Technical report on SkyReels-V3, conditional video generation model supporting reference images-to-video, video extension, and audio-guided generation within unified multimodal in-context learning framework.

entry.title: HAAF: Hierarchical Adaptation and Alignment of Foundation Models for Few-Shot Pathology Anomaly Detection

author.name: Chunze Yang, Wenjie Zhao, Yue Tang, Junbo Lu, Jiusong Ge, Qidong Liu, Zeyu Gao, Chen Li

entry.summary: Proposes HAAF framework adapting vision-language models for few-shot pathology anomaly detection using Cross-Level Scaled Alignment to ground semantic prompts in ROI-specific visual contexts.

entry.title: SPACE-CLIP: Spatial Perception via Adaptive CLIP Embeddings for Monocular Depth Estimation

author.name: Taewan Cho, Taeryang Kim, Andrew Jaeyong Choi

entry.summary: SPACE-CLIP extracts latent geometric knowledge directly from frozen CLIP vision encoders for monocular depth estimation, bypassing the text encoder entirely through a dual-pathway decoder architecture using FiLM conditioning.

entry.title: ViTCoP: Accelerating Large Vision-Language Models via Visual and Textual Semantic Collaborative Pruning

author.name: Wen Luo, Peng Chen, Xiaotao Huang, LiQun Huang

entry.summary: ViTCoP introduces visual and textual semantic collaborative pruning for LVLMs, combining redundancy filtering in the vision encoder with step-wise co-pruning within the LLM to efficiently preserve critical information.

entry.title: MV-SAM: Multi-view Promptable Segmentation using Pointmap Guidance

author.name: Yoonwoo Jeong, Cheng Sun, Yu-Chiang Frank Wang, Minsu Cho, Jaesung Choe

entry.summary: MV-SAM achieves 3D-consistent multi-view segmentation using pointmaps from visual geometry models, enabling pixel-point correspondence lifting without costly per-scene optimization.

entry.title: FlowMorph: Physics-Consistent Self-Supervision for Label-Free Single-Cell Mechanics in Microfluidic Videos

author.name: Bora Yimenicioglu, Vishal Manikanden

entry.summary: FlowMorph introduces physics-consistent self-supervised learning for red blood cell mechanics in microfluidics, combining differentiable capsule-in-flow modeling with laminar Stokes-flow physics.

entry.title: MindCine: Multimodal EEG-to-Video Reconstruction with Large-Scale Pretrained Models

author.name: Tian-Yi Zhou, Xuan-Hao Liu, Bao-Liang Lu, Wei-Long Zheng

entry.summary: MindCine achieves EEG-to-video reconstruction using multimodal joint learning beyond text alignment, incorporating visual modalities to address data scarcity and overfitting in brain decoding.

entry.title: On Procrustes Contamination in Machine Learning Applications of Geometric Morphometrics

author.name: Lloyd Austin Courtenay

entry.summary: Identifies Procrustes contamination in machine learning applications of geometric morphometrics where GPA before train/test split introduces statistical dependence, and proposes realignment procedure.

entry.title: DisasterInsight: A Multimodal Benchmark for Function-Aware and Grounded Disaster Assessment

author.name: Sara Tehrani, Yonghao Xu, Leif Haglund, Amanda Berg, Michael Felsberg

entry.summary: DisasterInsight introduces multimodal benchmark for VLM disaster assessment with 112K building-centered instances from xBD, supporting function-aware evaluation for humanitarian response.

entry.title: Grasp-and-Lift: Executable 3D Hand-Object Interaction Reconstruction via Physics-in-the-Loop Optimization

author.name: Byeonggyeol Choi, Woojin Oh, Jongwoo Lim

entry.summary: Introduces simulation-in-the-loop refinement framework to convert visually aligned hand-object trajectories into physically executable ones using black-box optimization with spline-based parameterization.

entry.title: EMPM: Embodied MPM for Modeling and Simulation of Deformable Objects

author.name: Yunuo Chen, Yafei Hu, Lingfeng Sun, Tushar Kusnur, Laura Herlant, Chenfanfu Jiang

entry.summary: Introduces EMPM, a differentiable MPM-based framework for modeling deformable objects from multi-view RGB-D videos with physics simulation for robotic manipulation.

entry.title: SG-CADVLM: A Context-Aware Decoding Powered Vision Language Model for Safety-Critical Scenario Generation

author.name: Hongyi Zhao, Shuo Wang, Qijie He, Ziyuan Pu

entry.summary: Proposes SG-CADVLM using context-aware decoding with VLMs for generating realistic safety-critical scenarios for autonomous vehicle validation from crash reports.

entry.title: EvolVE: Evolutionary Search for LLM-based Verilog Generation and Optimization

author.name: Wei-Po Hsin, Ren-Hao Deng, Yao-Ting Hsieh, En-Ming Huang, Shih-Hao Hung

entry.summary: Presents EvolVE, first framework comparing evolution strategies for Verilog generation, finding MCTS excels at correctness while Idea-Guided Refinement is superior for optimization.

entry.title: PolySHAP: Extending KernelSHAP with Interaction-Informed Polynomial Regression

author.name: Fabian Fumagalli, R. Teal Witter, Christopher Musco

entry.summary: Extends KernelSHAP by approximating games via higher degree polynomials capturing feature interactions, yielding PolySHAP with empirically better Shapley estimates and theoretical guarantees.

entry.title: A Model-Driven Lossless Compression Algorithm Resistant to Mismatch

author.name: Cordelia Hu, Jennifer Tang

entry.summary: Proposes compression algorithm using next-token prediction that is robust to arbitrarily large model output mismatches between encoder and decoder, addressing non-determinism.

entry.title: Assessment of Generative Named Entity Recognition in the Era of Large Language Models

author.name: Qi Zhan, Yile Wang, Hui Huang

entry.summary: Systematic evaluation of open-source LLMs on flat and nested NER tasks across eight models and four datasets. Finds PEFT fine-tuned LLMs achieve competitive performance with traditional NER models.

entry.title: BMDS-Net: A Bayesian Multi-Modal Deep Supervision Network for Robust Brain Tumor Segmentation

author.name: Yan Zhou, Zhen Huang, Yingqiu Li, Yue Ouyang, Suncheng Xiang, Zehua Wang

entry.summary: Proposes BMDS-Net for brain tumor segmentation prioritizing robustness to missing modalities and confidence calibration over simple metric maximization, using Bayesian deep supervision.

entry.title: Evolving Interdependent Operators with Large Language Models for Multi-Objective Combinatorial Optimization

author.name: Junhao Qiu, Xin Chen, Liang Ge, Liyong Lin, Zhichao Lu, Qingfu Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes E2OC framework using LLMs to evolve interdependent operators for multi-objective evolutionary algorithms through sequential decision-making formulation.

entry.title: Less Is More: Scalable Visual Navigation from Limited Data

author.name: Yves Inglin, Jonas Frey, Changan Chen, Marco Hutter

entry.summary: Introduces LiMo, showing that augmenting limited expert demonstrations with geometric planner-generated synthetic trajectories yields substantial performance gains for visual navigation.

entry.title: The LLM Data Auditor: A Metric-oriented Survey on Quality and Trustworthiness in Evaluating Synthetic Data

author.name: Kaituo Zhang, Mingzhi Hu, Hoang Anh Duy Le, Fariha Kabir Torsha, Zhimeng Jiang, Minh Khai Bui, Chia-Yuan Chang, Yu-Neng Chuang, Zhen Xiong, Ying Lin, Guanchu Wang, Na Zou

entry.summary: Proposes the LLM Data Auditor framework providing a unified perspective on evaluating quality and trustworthiness of LLM-generated synthetic data across modalities.

entry.title: ShopSimulator: Evaluating and Exploring RL-Driven LLM Agent for Shopping Assistants

author.name: Pei Wang, Yanan Wu, Xiaoshuai Song, Weixun Wang, Gengru Chen, Zhongwen Li, Kezhong Yan, Ken Deng, Qi Liu, Shuaibing Zhao, Shaopan Xiong, Xuepeng Liu, Xuefeng Chen, Wanxi Deng, Wenbo Su, Bo Zheng

entry.summary: Introduces ShopSimulator, a large-scale Chinese shopping environment for evaluating LLM agents on multi-turn dialogue and product discrimination, finding best models achieve under 40% success.

entry.title: LLM-42: Enabling Determinism in LLM Inference with Verified Speculation

author.name: Raja Gond, Aditya K Kamath, Arkaprava Basu, Ramachandran Ramjee, Ashish Panwar

entry.summary: LLM-42 enables deterministic LLM inference through scheduling approach inspired by speculative decoding, decoupling determinism from kernel design.

entry.title: When Domain Pretraining Interferes with Instruction Alignment: An Empirical Study of Adapter Merging in Medical LLMs

author.name: Junyi Zou

entry.summary: Case study on adapter interference in medical LLMs, proposing Weighted Adapter Merging to balance instruction-following ability and domain knowledge retention when combining domain pretraining and supervised fine-tuning.

entry.title: Revealing the Truth with ConLLM for Detecting Multi-Modal Deepfakes

author.name: Gautam Siddharth Kashyap, Harsh Joshi, Niharika Jain, Ebad Shabbir, Jiechao Gao, Nipun Joshi, Usman Naseem

entry.summary: Proposes ConLLM, a hybrid framework combining contrastive learning with LLMs for multimodal deepfake detection. Uses two-stage architecture with modality-specific embeddings and cross-modal reasoning.

entry.title: Scaling Behaviors of Evolutionary Algorithms on GPUs: When Does Parallelism Pay Off?

author.name: Xinmeng Yu, Tao Jiang, Ran Cheng, Yaochu Jin, Kay Chen Tan

entry.summary: Systematic empirical study of 16 evolutionary algorithms on 30 benchmarks comparing CPU vs GPU execution across dimensionalities and population sizes to understand when parallelism helps.

entry.title: NeuroManip: Prosthetic Hand Manipulation System Based on EMG and Eye Tracking Powered by the Neuromorphic Processor AltAi

author.name: Roman Akinshin, Elizaveta Lopatina, Kirill Bogatikov, Nikolai Kiz, Anna V. Makarova, Mikhail Lebedev, Miguel Altamirano Cabrera, Dzmitry Tsetserukou, Valerii Kangler

entry.summary: Presents NeuroManip, neuromorphic prosthetic control combining sEMG with gaze-guided vision on AltAi processor, achieving sub-watt operation for upper-limb amputees.

entry.title: Beyond Static Datasets: Robust Offline Policy Optimization via Vetted Synthetic Transitions

author.name: Pedram Agand, Mo Chen

entry.summary: Presents MoReBRAC, model-based offline RL framework using dual-recurrent world model for synthetic transition generation with hierarchical uncertainty-aware vetting.

entry.title: The Relativity of AGI: Distributional Axioms, Fragility, and Undecidability

author.name: Angshul Majumdar

entry.summary: Formalizes AGI axiomatically as a distributional, resource-bounded predicate and proves that generality is inherently relational, AGI properties are fragile to distribution perturbations, and self-verification is undecidable.

entry.title: Beyond Text-to-SQL: Can LLMs Really Debug Enterprise ETL SQL?

author.name: Jing Ye, Yiwen Duan, Yonghong Yu, Victor Ma, Yang Gao, Xing Chen

entry.summary: Introduces OurBench, first benchmark for enterprise ETL SQL debugging using automated bug injection via reverse engineering and execution-free evaluation for fast assessment.

entry.title: Assessing the Quality of Mental Health Support in LLM Responses through Multi-Attribute Human Evaluation

author.name: Abeer Badawi, Md Tahmid Rahman Laskar, Elahe Rahimi, Sheri Grach, Lindsay Bertrand, Lames Danok, Frank Rudzicz, Jimmy Huang, Elham Dolatabadi

entry.summary: Introduces human-grounded evaluation methodology for LLM mental health responses, evaluating 9 LLMs on 500 conversations using multi-attribute assessment by domain experts.

entry.title: Measuring Political Stance and Consistency in Large Language Models

author.name: Salah Feras Alali, Mohammad Nashat Maasfeh, Mucahid Kutlu, Saban Kardas

entry.summary: Assesses political stances of 9 LLMs including Grok-3-mini and Mistral-7B across 24 politically sensitive issues using 5 prompting techniques. Finds varying stance stability across models.

entry.title: Can LLMs Clean Up Your Mess? A Survey of Application-Ready Data Preparation with LLMs

author.name: Wei Zhou, Jun Zhou, Haoyu Wang, Zhenghao Li, Qikang He, Shaokun Han, Guoliang Li, Xuanhe Zhou, Yeye He, Chunwei Liu, Zirui Tang, Bin Wang, Shen Tang, Kai Zuo, Yuyu Luo, Zhenzhe Zheng, Conghui He, Jingren Zhou, Fan Wu

entry.summary: Comprehensive survey reviewing LLM techniques for data preparation tasks including denoising, relationship discovery, and insight extraction. Covers recent literature on application-ready data.

entry.title: Multi-Agent Deep Reinforcement Learning Under Constrained Communications

author.name: Shahil Shaik, Jonathon M. Smereka, Yue Wang

entry.summary: Presents distributed MARL framework with novel Distributed Graph Attention Network (D-GAT) that removes need for centralized critics or global information during training.

entry.title: SFO: Learning PDE Operators via Spectral Filtering

author.name: Noam Koren, Rafael Moschopoulos, Kira Radinsky, Elad Hazan

entry.summary: Introduces Spectral Filtering Operator (SFO) using Universal Spectral Basis for neural operators solving PDEs. Proves kernels admit compact approximations in USB.

entry.title: Dynamic Role Assignment for Multi-Agent Debate

author.name: Miao Zhang, Junsik Kim, Siyuan Xiang, Jian Gao, Cheng Cao

entry.summary: Proposes dynamic role assignment for multi-agent debate through meta-debate with proposal and peer review stages. Consistently outperforms uniform agent assignment.

entry.title: Beyond Factual QA: Mentorship-Oriented Question Answering over Long-Form Multilingual Content

author.name: Parth Bhalerao, Diola Dsouza, Ruiwen Guan, Oana Ignat

entry.summary: Introduces MentorQA, first multilingual dataset for mentorship-focused QA with 9,000 pairs from 180 hours of video content. Defines evaluation dimensions beyond factual accuracy.

entry.title: From Specialist to Generalist: Unlocking SAM's Learning Potential on Unlabeled Medical Images

author.name: Vi Vu, Thanh-Huy Nguyen, Tien-Thinh Nguyen, Ba-Thinh Lam, Hoang-Thien Nguyen, Tianyang Wang, Xingjian Li, Min Xu

entry.summary: SC-SAM adapts SAM for semi-supervised medical imaging through reciprocal guidance between U-Net (prompts/pseudo-labels) and SAM (regularization).

entry.title: "Crash Test Dummies" for AI-Enabled Clinical Assessment: Validating Virtual Patient Scenarios with Virtual Learners

author.name: Brian Gin, Ahreum Lim, Fl\'avia Silva e Oliveira, Kuan Xing, Xiaomei Song, Gayana Amiyangoda, Thilanka Seneviratne, Alison F. Doubleday, Ananya Gangopadhyaya, Bob Kiser, Lukas Shum-Tim, Dhruva Patel, Kosala Marambe, Lauren Maggio, Ara Tekian, Yoon Soo Park

entry.summary: Proposes using AI 'simulated learners' to stress-test and validate AI-powered clinical assessment systems before human deployment, creating a novel validation framework. Introduces psychometric measurement models for evaluating virtual patient platforms.

entry.title: Beyond Pairwise Comparisons: A Distributional Test of Distinctiveness for Machine-Generated Works in Intellectual Property Law

author.name: Anirban Mukherjee, Hannah Hanwen Chang

entry.summary: Proposes distributional test using maximum mean discrepancy to assess distinctiveness of machine-generated works for intellectual property law, addressing limitations of pairwise comparisons for generative AI outputs.

entry.title: Rethinking Cross-Modal Fine-Tuning: Optimizing the Interaction between Feature Alignment and Target Fitting

author.name: Trong Khiem Tran, Manh Cuong Dao, Phi Le Nguyen, Thao Nguyen Truong, Trong Nghia Hoang

entry.summary: Develops theoretical framework for cross-modal fine-tuning, analyzing interaction between feature alignment and target fitting. Shows uncalibrated combinations can exacerbate source-target misalignment.

entry.title: Fair-Eye Net: A Fair, Trustworthy, Multimodal Integrated Glaucoma Full Chain AI System

author.name: Wenbin Wei, Suyuan Yao, Cheng Huang, Xiangyu Gao

entry.summary: Develops Fair-Eye Net, multimodal AI system for glaucoma screening and follow-up integrating fundus photos, OCT, visual field indices, and demographics with fairness considerations.

entry.title: Rank-1 Approximation of Inverse Fisher for Natural Policy Gradients in Deep Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Yingxiao Huo, Satya Prakash Dash, Radu Stoican, Samuel Kaski, Mingfei Sun

entry.summary: Presents efficient natural policy optimization using rank-1 approximation to inverse Fisher Information Matrix, proving faster convergence than policy gradients under certain conditions.

entry.title: Advances and Innovations in the Multi-Agent Robotic System (MARS) Challenge

author.name: Li Kang, Heng Zhou, Xiufeng Song, Rui Li, Bruno N. Y. Chen, Ziye Wang, Ximeng Meng, Stone Tao, Yiran Qin, Xiaohong Liu, Ruimao Zhang, Lei Bai, Yilun Du, Hao Su, Philip Torr, Zhenfei Yin, Ruihao Gong, Yejun Zeng, Fengjun Zhong, Shenghao Jin, Jinyang Guo, Xianglong Liu, Xiaojun Jia, Tianqi Shan, Wenqi Ren, Simeng Qin, Jialing Yang, Xiaoyu Ma, Tianxing Chen, Zixuan Li, Zijian Cai, Yan Qin, Yusen Qin, Qiangyu Chen, Kaixuan Wang, Zhaoming Han, Yao Mu, Ping Luo, Yuanqi Yao, Haoming Song, Jan-Nico Zaech, Fabien Despinoy, Danda Pani Paudel, Luc Van Gool

entry.summary: Presents MARS Challenge at NeurIPS 2025 Workshop on SpaVLE for multi-agent robotic systems, focusing on planning and control for embodied AI. Introduces benchmark for multi-agent collaboration.

entry.title: Subword-Based Comparative Linguistics across 242 Languages Using Wikipedia Glottosets

author.name: Iaroslav Chelombitko, Mika H\"am\"al\"ainen, Aleksey Komissarov

entry.summary: Large-scale comparative study of 242 Latin/Cyrillic-script languages using BPE subword analysis of Wikipedia lexicons, showing 95% better morpheme boundary alignment than random baseline.

entry.title: ctELM: Decoding and Manipulating Embeddings of Clinical Trials with Embedding Language Models

author.name: Brian Ondov, Chia-Hsuan Chang, Yujia Zhou, Mauro Giuffr\`e, Hua Xu

entry.summary: Develops ctELM applying Embedding Language Model method to clinical trials, training LLMs to decode and manipulate clinical trial embeddings for description, comparison, and generation.

entry.title: PyHealth 2.0: A Comprehensive Open-Source Toolkit for Accessible and Reproducible Clinical Deep Learning

author.name: John Wu, Yongda Fan, Zhenbang Wu, Paul Landes, Eric Schrock, Sayeed Sajjad Razin, Arjun Chatterjee, Naveen Baskaran, Joshua Steier, Andrea Fitzpatrick, Bilal Arif, Rian Atri, Jathurshan Pradeepkumar, Siddhartha Laghuvarapu, Junyi Gao, Adam R. Cross, Jimeng Sun

entry.summary: PyHealth 2.0 is a comprehensive clinical deep learning toolkit enabling predictive modeling in 7 lines of code. Unifies 15+ datasets, 20+ tasks, 25+ models with interpretability methods and uncertainty quantification.

entry.title: On the Expressive Power of Floating-Point Transformers

author.name: Sejun Park, Yeachan Park, Geonho Hwang

entry.summary: Studies expressiveness of transformers under realistic floating-point parameters and operations. Shows floating-point transformers can represent non-permutation-equivariant functions without positional encoding, challenging existing theory.

entry.title: Rethinking Large Language Models For Irregular Time Series Classification In Critical Care

author.name: Feixiang Zheng, Yu Wu, Cecilia Mascolo, Ting Dang

entry.summary: Systematically studies LLM-based methods for irregular ICU time series classification. Finds encoder design choices and alignment strategies are critical; strong baselines often outperform LLM approaches.

entry.title: E2Former-V2: On-the-Fly Equivariant Attention with Linear Activation Memory

author.name: Lin Huang, Chengxiang Huang, Ziang Wang, Yiyue Du, Chu Wang, Haocheng Lu, Yunyang Li, Xiaoli Liu, Arthur Jiang, Jia Zhang

entry.summary: Introduces E2Former-V2 for scalable equivariant attention in molecular modeling with linear memory. Uses EAAS to exploit SO(3)→SO(2) change of basis for efficient tensor contractions.

entry.title: The Art of Being Difficult: Combining Human and AI Strengths to Find Adversarial Instances for Heuristics

author.name: Henri Nikoleit, Ankit Anand, Anurag Murty Naredla, Heiko R\"oglin

entry.summary: Demonstrates human-LLM collaboration using FunSearch to find adversarial instances where heuristics perform poorly. Achieves state-of-the-art lower bounds for k-median clustering, bin packing, and knapsack problems.

entry.title: Latent Causal Diffusions for Single-Cell Perturbation Modeling

author.name: Lars Lorch, Jiaqi Zhang, Charlotte Bunne, Andreas Krause, Bernhard Sch\"olkopf, Caroline Uhler

entry.summary: Proposes Latent Causal Diffusion (LCD) for single-cell perturbation modeling, framing gene expression as stationary diffusion under measurement noise. Outperforms existing approaches for predicting unseen perturbation combinations.

entry.title: Towards Latent Diffusion Suitable For Text

author.name: Nesta Midavaine, Christian A. Naesseth, Grigory Bartosh

entry.summary: Introduces Neural Flow Diffusion Models for language generation that learns multivariate forward process from data. Substantially reduces likelihood gap with autoregressive models of same size.

entry.title: SoundBreak: A Systematic Study of Audio-Only Adversarial Attacks on Trimodal Models

author.name: Aafiya Hussain, Gaurav Srivastava, Alvi Ishmam, Zaber Hakim, Chris Thomas

entry.summary: First systematic study of audio-only adversarial attacks on trimodal audio-video-language models. Analyzes six attack objectives achieving up to 96% success rate, revealing severe multimodal vulnerabilities.

entry.title: GameTalk: Training LLMs for Strategic Conversation

author.name: Victor Conchello Vendrell, Max Ruiz Luyten, Mihaela van der Schaar

entry.summary: Introduces GameTalk framework for training LLMs to make strategic decisions via multi-turn dialogue. Adapts fine-tuning methods to optimize global objectives across full conversations.

entry.title: Relating Word Embedding Gender Biases to Gender Gaps: A Cross-Cultural Analysis

author.name: Scott Friedman, Sonja Schmer-Galunder, Anthony Chen, Jeffrey Rye

entry.summary: Presents approach for quantifying gender bias in word embeddings and correlating them with real-world gender gaps in education, politics, economics, and health across cultures.

entry.title: Beyond the Rabbit Hole: Mapping the Relational Harms of QAnon Radicalization

author.name: Bich Ngoc (Rubi), Doan, Giuseppe Russo, Gianmarco De Francisci Morales, Robert West

entry.summary: Maps QAnon radicalization journeys and emotional toll on families using BERTopic analysis of 12,747 narratives from r/QAnonCasualties. Identifies pre-existing conditions, triggers, and escalation patterns.

entry.title: Using Large Language Models to Construct Virtual Top Managers: A Method for Organizational Research

author.name: Antonio Garzon-Vico, Krithika Sharon Komalapati, Arsalan Shahid, Jan Rosier

entry.summary: Introduces framework using LLMs to create virtual personas of real CEOs based on their communications and Moral Foundations Theory. Validates against human participants for organizational research.

entry.title: Integrating Fine-Grained Audio-Visual Evidence for Robust Multimodal Emotion Reasoning

author.name: Zhixian Zhao, Wenjie Tian, Xiaohai Tian, Jun Zhang, Lei Xie

entry.summary: Proposes framework for multimodal emotion reasoning integrating fine-grained audio-visual evidence. Addresses MLLM limitations in perceiving subtle cues and unimodal dominance leading to hallucinations.

entry.title: OCR-Enhanced Multimodal ASR Can Read While Listening

author.name: Junli Chen, Changli Tang, Yixuan Li, Guangzhi Sun, Chao Zhang

entry.summary: Proposes Donut-Whisper, an audio-visual ASR model combining linear and Q-Former alignment structures via cross-attention. Introduces new multilingual AV-ASR dataset from movie clips with subtitles.

entry.title: Atomic Depth Estimation From Noisy Electron Microscopy Data Via Deep Learning

author.name: Matan Leibovich, Mai Tan, Adria Marcos-Morales, Sreyas Mohan, Peter A. Crozier, Carlos Fernandez-Granda

entry.summary: Proposes deep learning approach for estimating 3D atomic depth from noisy TEM images by formulating depth estimation as semantic segmentation, trained on simulated data with synthetic noise.

entry.title: GRASP: Guided Region-Aware Sparse Prompting for Adapting MLLMs to Remote Sensing

author.name: Qigan Sun, Chaoning Zhang, Jianwei Zhang, Xudong Wang, Jiehui Xie, Pengcheng Zheng, Haoyu Wang, Sungyoung Lee, Chi-lok Andy Tai, Yang Yang, Heng Tao Shen

entry.summary: Proposes GRASP, a parameter-efficient fine-tuning strategy for adapting MLLMs to remote sensing using spatially structured soft prompts to address large-scale variations and sparse target distributions.

entry.title: FineVAU: A Novel Human-Aligned Benchmark for Fine-Grained Video Anomaly Understanding

author.name: Jo\~ao Pereira, Vasco Lopes, Jo\~ao Neves, David Semedo

entry.summary: Proposes FineVAU benchmark for Video Anomaly Understanding with fine-grained, domain-specific evaluation focusing on factual relevance over language quality, addressing misalignment with human perception.

entry.title: TEXTS-Diff: TEXTS-Aware Diffusion Model for Real-World Text Image Super-Resolution

author.name: Haodong He, Xin Zhan, Yancheng Bai, Rui Lan, Lei Sun, Xiangxiang Chu

entry.summary: Proposes TEXTS-Diff for real-world text image super-resolution with new Real-Texts dataset and TEXTS-aware diffusion model achieving high quality in both background and textual regions.

entry.title: UCAD: Uncertainty-guided Contour-aware Displacement for semi-supervised medical image segmentation

author.name: Chengbo Ding, Fenghe Tang, Shaohua Kevin Zhou

entry.summary: Proposes UCAD framework for semi-supervised medical segmentation using uncertainty-guided contour-aware displacement that preserves anatomical structures unlike rectangular region approaches.

entry.title: Will It Zero-Shot?: Will It Zero-Shot?: Predicting Zero-Shot Classification Performance For Arbitrary Queries

author.name: Kevin Robbins, Xiaotong Liu, Yu Wu, Le Sun, Grady McPeak, Abby Stylianou, Robert Pless

entry.summary: Proposes method to predict zero-shot classification performance for arbitrary queries using text-only comparisons and synthetic image generation to evaluate VLM task suitability without real data.

entry.title: Implicit Neural Representation-Based Continuous Single Image Super Resolution: An Empirical Study

author.name: Tayyab Nasir, Daochang Liu, Ajmal Mian

entry.summary: Provides a comprehensive empirical study of implicit neural representation methods for arbitrary-scale image super-resolution, examining training recipes, scaling laws, and optimization strategies across multiple quality metrics.

entry.title: SynMind: Reducing Semantic Hallucination in fMRI-Based Image Reconstruction

author.name: Lan Yang, Minghan Yang, Ke Li, Honggang Zhang, Kaiyue Pang, Yi-Zhe Song

entry.summary: SynMind addresses semantic hallucination in fMRI-based image reconstruction by parsing fMRI signals into rich sentence-level semantic descriptions rather than relying solely on entangled visual embeddings.

entry.title: RemEdit: Efficient Diffusion Editing with Riemannian Geometry

author.name: Eashan Adhikarla, Brian D. Davison

entry.summary: RemEdit combines Riemannian manifold geometry for semantic diffusion editing with task-specific attention pruning and VLM-guided prompt enrichment for efficient controllable image generation.

entry.title: Domain-Expert-Guided Hybrid Mixture-of-Experts for Medical AI: Integrating Data-Driven Learning with Clinical Priors

author.name: Jinchen Gu, Nan Zhao, Lei Qiu, Lu Zhang

entry.summary: DKGH-MoE unifies data-driven experts with domain-expert-guided experts that encode clinical knowledge like physician gaze patterns, providing a plug-and-play interpretable module for medical AI.

entry.title: HomoFM: Deep Homography Estimation with Flow Matching

author.name: Mengfan He, Liangzheng Sun, Chunyu Li, Ziyang Meng

entry.summary: HomoFM applies flow matching from generative modeling to homography estimation for the first time, formulating it as velocity field learning for continuous point-wise transformation.

entry.title: SwipeGen: Bridging the Execution Gap in GUI Agents via Human-like Swipe Synthesis

author.name: Xuan Wang, Siyuan Su, Quantong Fu, Yongxiang Hu, Yangfan Zhou

entry.summary: SwipeGen addresses GUI agent execution capability by decomposing human swipe gestures into quantifiable dimensions and synthesizing human-like swipe interactions through automated GUI exploration.

entry.title: PPISP: Physically-Plausible Compensation and Control of Photometric Variations in Radiance Field Reconstruction

author.name: Isaac Deutsch, Nicolas Mo\"enne-Loccoz, Gavriel State, Zan Gojcic

entry.summary: PPISP proposes physically-plausible ISP correction for radiance field reconstruction, disentangling camera-intrinsic and capture-dependent effects through interpretable transformations with a controller for novel views.

entry.title: Q-Bench-Portrait: Benchmarking Multimodal Large Language Models on Portrait Image Quality Perception

author.name: Sijing Wu, Yunhao Li, Zicheng Zhang, Qi Jia, Xinyue Li, Huiyu Duan, Xiongkuo Min, Guangtao Zhai

entry.summary: Q-Bench-Portrait introduces first holistic benchmark for MLLM portrait image quality perception with 2,765 triplets covering diverse sources including AI-generated and artistic portraits.

entry.title: Adaptive Domain Shift in Diffusion Models for Cross-Modality Image Translation

author.name: Zihao Wang, Yuzhou Chen, Shaogang Ren

entry.summary: Proposes adaptive domain shift dynamics embedded in diffusion generative process for cross-modal image translation, with spatially varying mixing field and target-consistent restoration at each step.

entry.title: Thermodynamically Optimal Regularization under Information-Geometric Constraints

author.name: Laurent Caraffa

entry.summary: Proposes a theoretical framework connecting thermodynamic optimality with information geometry, showing that Fisher-Rao regularization is the unique thermodynamically optimal regularization strategy.

entry.title: Counterfactual Explanations on Robust Perceptual Geodesics

author.name: Eslam Zaher, Maciej Trzaskowski, Quan Nguyen, Fred Roosta

entry.summary: Presents Perceptual Counterfactual Geodesics (PCG), constructing counterfactual explanations by tracing geodesics under perceptually-aligned Riemannian metric from robust vision features.

entry.title: Scaling Rough Terrain Locomotion with Automatic Curriculum Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Ziming Li, Chenhao Li, Marco Hutter

entry.summary: Proposes LP-ACRL framework for automatic curriculum generation in reinforcement learning, achieving stable high-speed quadruped locomotion on challenging terrain.

entry.title: ConceptACT: Episode-Level Concepts for Sample-Efficient Robotic Imitation Learning

author.name: Jakob Karalus, Friedhelm Schwenker

entry.summary: Introduces ConceptACT extending Action Chunking with Transformers to leverage episode-level semantic concepts during training for improved sample efficiency without requiring concepts at deployment.

entry.title: Listing the virtues from Claude’s “Constitution”

author.name: David Gross

entry.summary: Catalogs the virtues embedded in Anthropic's newly released Claude constitution, noting its surprisingly virtue-ethics approach rather than utilitarian or deontological frameworks. Identifies primary virtues (harmlessness, helpfulness, honesty) and secondary social virtues.

entry.title: ReFuGe: Feature Generation for Prediction Tasks on Relational Databases with LLM Agents

author.name: Kyungho Kim, Geon Lee, Juyeon Kim, Dongwon Choi, Shinhwan Kang, Kijung Shin

entry.summary: Proposes ReFuGe, an agentic framework using specialized LLM agents for schema selection, feature synthesis, and verification to generate informative features for prediction tasks on relational databases.

entry.title: Clustering-driven Memory Compression for On-device Large Language Models

author.name: Ondrej Bohdal, Pramit Saha, Umberto Michieli, Mete Ozay, Taha Ceritli

entry.summary: Clustering-based memory compression for on-device LLMs that groups memories by similarity before merging, balancing context efficiency and personalization quality.

entry.title: Beyond a Single Perspective: Text Anomaly Detection with Multi-View Language Representations

author.name: Yixin Liu, Kehan Yan, Shiyuan Li, Qingfeng Chen, Shirui Pan

entry.summary: Proposes MCA² framework for text anomaly detection using embeddings from multiple pretrained language models. Employs multi-view reconstruction with inter-view correlation exploitation.

entry.title: LoD-Structured 3D Gaussian Splatting for Streaming Video Reconstruction

author.name: Xinhui Liu, Can Wang, Lei Liu, Zhenghao Chen, Wei Jiang, Wei Wang, Dong Xu

entry.summary: Proposes StreamLoD-GS, an LoD-based Gaussian Splatting framework for streaming free-viewpoint video with anchor-based LoD structure and hierarchical Gaussian representation.

entry.title: Advancing Improvisation in Human-Robot Construction Collaboration: Taxonomy and Research Roadmap

author.name: David Wireko Atibila, Vineet R. Kamat, Carol C. Menassa

entry.summary: Develops six-level taxonomy classifying human-robot collaboration based on improvisation capabilities, with systematic review of 214 construction robotics articles from 2010-2025.

entry.title: Fast and Safe Trajectory Optimization for Mobile Manipulators With Neural Configuration Space Distance Field

author.name: Yulin Li, Zhiyuan Song, Yiming Li, Zhicheng Song, Kai Chen, Chunxin Zheng, Zhihai Bi, Jiahang Cao, Sylvain Calinon, Fan Shi, Jun Ma

entry.summary: Proposes neural configuration space distance field for fast trajectory optimization of mobile manipulators, extending CDF approach to handle unbounded workspaces.

entry.title: Resonant Sparse Geometry Networks

author.name: Hasi Hays

entry.summary: Resonant Sparse Geometry Networks use learned hyperbolic space for input-dependent sparse connectivity, combining fast gradient descent with slow Hebbian structural learning.

entry.title: Dissipative Learning: A Framework for Viable Adaptive Systems

author.name: Laurent Caraffa

entry.summary: Proposes BEDS framework modeling learning as evolution of compressed belief states under dissipation constraints, proving Fisher-Rao regularization achieves minimal dissipation compared to Euclidean.

entry.title: TEFormer: Structured Bidirectional Temporal Enhancement Modeling in Spiking Transformers

author.name: Sicheng Shen, Mingyang Lv, Bing Han, Dongcheng Zhao, Guobin Shen, Feifei Zhao, Yi Zeng

entry.summary: Introduces TEFormer, a spiking transformer with bidirectional temporal fusion inspired by feedforward-feedback modulation in human visual pathway.

entry.title: AsterNav: Autonomous Aerial Robot Navigation In Darkness Using Passive Computation

author.name: Deepak Singh, Shreyas Khobragade, Nitin J. Sanket

entry.summary: Presents AsterNav for autonomous aerial navigation in darkness using IR camera with coded lens and structured light for depth-dependent defocus cues.

entry.title: A Cherry-Picking Approach to Large Load Shaping for More Effective Carbon Reduction

author.name: Bokan Chen, Raiden Hasegawa, Adriaan Hilbers, Ross Koningstein, Ana Radovanovi\'c, Utkarsh Shah, Gabriela Volpato, Mohamed Ahmed, Tim Cary, Rod Frowd

entry.summary: Studies load shaping strategies for data centers on CO2 emissions using calibrated DC-OPF simulations of ERCOT grid, finding LMP-based shaping underperforms other strategies.

entry.title: A Generative AI-Driven Reliability Layer for Action-Oriented Disaster Resilience

author.name: Geunsik Lim

entry.summary: Introduces Climate RADAR, an AI-based disaster communication system reframing alerts as action recommendations using guardrail-embedded LLMs with personalized guidance across multiple interfaces.

entry.title: TelcoAI: Advancing 3GPP Technical Specification Search through Agentic Multi-Modal Retrieval-Augmented Generation

author.name: Rahul Ghosh, Chun-Hao Liu, Gaurav Rele, Vidya Sagar Ravipati, Hazar Aouad

entry.summary: Presents TelcoAI, agentic multi-modal RAG system for 3GPP documentation with section-aware chunking, structured query planning, and multi-modal fusion achieving 87% accuracy.

entry.title: Single-Pixel Vision-Language Model for Intrinsic Privacy-Preserving Behavioral Intelligence

author.name: Hongjun An, Yiliang Song, Jiawei Shao, Zhe Sun, Xuelong Li

entry.summary: Proposes Single-Pixel Vision-Language Model (SP-VLM) for privacy-preserving behavioral monitoring using inherently low-dimensional single-pixel modalities to detect adverse social interactions.

entry.title: ThinkTank-ME: A Multi-Expert Framework for Middle East Event Forecasting

author.name: Haoxuan Li, He Chang, Yunshan Ma, Yi Bin, Yang Yang, See-Kiong Ng, Tat-Seng Chua

entry.summary: Proposes ThinkTank-ME, a multi-expert LLM framework emulating collaborative expert analysis for Middle East event forecasting. Constructs POLECAT-FOR-ME benchmark for evaluation.

entry.title: The Triangle of Similarity: A Multi-Faceted Framework for Comparing Neural Network Representations

author.name: Olha Sirikova, Alvin Chan

entry.summary: Proposes Triangle of Similarity framework combining CKA/Procrustes, functional similarity, and sparsity similarity for comparing neural network representations across architectures.

entry.title: Interpretability of the Intent Detection Problem: A New Approach

author.name: Eduardo Sanchez-Karhunen, Jose F. Quesada-Moreno, Miguel A. Guti\'errez-Naranjo

entry.summary: Applies dynamical systems theory to understand RNN intent detection, interpreting sentences as trajectories in hidden state space. Reveals distinct solution structures for balanced vs imbalanced datasets.

entry.title: Conservative & Aggressive NaNs Accelerate U-Nets for Neuroimaging

author.name: In\'es Gonzalez-Pepe, Vinuyan Sivakolunthu, Jacob Fortin, Yohan Chatelain, Tristan Glatard

entry.summary: Introduces Conservative & Aggressive NaNs, novel max pooling variants that identify numerically unstable voxels and skip computations on irrelevant data, achieving 2x speedup in neuroimaging CNNs.

entry.title: Human-Aligned Enhancement of Programming Answers with LLMs Guided by User Feedback

author.name: Suborno Deb Bappon, Saikat Mondal, Chanchal K. Roy, Kevin Schneider

entry.summary: Studies whether LLMs can improve Stack Overflow answers by incorporating user feedback from comments, finding one-third of feedback is never addressed.

entry.title: What Do Learned Models Measure?

author.name: Indr\.e \v{Z}liobait\.e

entry.summary: Formalizes learned measurement functions as distinct evaluation focus, introducing measurement stability concept capturing invariance across learning realizations and contexts. Shows standard ML criteria insufficient.

entry.title: Gradient Regularized Natural Gradients

author.name: Satya Prakash Dash, Hossein Abdi, Wei Pan, Samuel Kaski, Mingfei Sun

entry.summary: Proposes Gradient-Regularized Natural Gradients (GRNG), integrating gradient regularization with natural gradient updates via frequentist and Bayesian variants avoiding explicit Fisher matrix inversion.

entry.title: Learning long term climate-resilient transport adaptation pathways under direct and indirect flood impacts using reinforcement learning

author.name: Miguel Costa, Arthur Vandervoort, Carolin Schmidt, Morten W. Petersen, Martin Drews, Karyn Morrissey, Francisco C. Pereira

entry.summary: Proposes RL framework coupled with integrated assessment model for learning climate-resilient transport adaptation pathways under uncertainty, considering direct and indirect flood impacts.

entry.title: Point transformer for protein structural heterogeneity analysis using CryoEM

author.name: Muyuan Chen, Muchen Li, Renjie Liao

entry.summary: Implements Point Transformer for CryoEM structural heterogeneity analysis, improving characterization of protein dynamics in complex systems with better human interpretability.

entry.title: SeNeDiF-OOD: Semantic Nested Dichotomy Fusion for Out-of-Distribution Detection Methodology in Open-World Classification. A Case Study on Monument Style Classification

author.name: Ignacio Antequera-S\'anchez, Juan Luis Su\'arez-D\'iaz, Rosana Montes, Francisco Herrera

entry.summary: Proposes SeNeDiF-OOD using Semantic Nested Dichotomy Fusion for out-of-distribution detection, creating hierarchical binary fusion nodes aligned with semantic abstraction levels.

entry.title: AutoRegressive Generation with B-rep Holistic Token Sequence Representation

author.name: Jiahao Li, Yunpeng Bai, Yongkang Dai, Hao Guo, Hongping Gan, Yilei Shi

entry.summary: First approach to encode B-rep (boundary representation) geometry and topology into a holistic token sequence for autoregressive generation using transformers. Enables sequence-based CAD model generation, bringing transformer architectures to 3D manufacturing design.

entry.title: WarrantScore: Modeling Warrants between Claims and Evidence for Substantiation Evaluation in Peer Reviews

author.name: Kiyotada Mori, Shohei Tanaka, Tosho Hirasawa, Tadashi Kozuno, Koichiro Yoshino, Yoshitaka Ushiku

entry.summary: Proposes WarrantScore for evaluating substantiation in peer reviews by modeling warrants (logical connections) between claims and evidence, going beyond simple claim-evidence detection.

entry.title: Unsupervised Text Segmentation via Kernel Change-Point Detection on Sentence Embeddings

author.name: Mumin Jia, Jairo Diaz-Rodriguez

entry.summary: Introduces Embed-KCPD, a training-free text segmentation method using sentence embeddings and kernel change-point detection. Provides first dependence-aware theoretical guarantees for KCPD under finite-memory sequences common in language.

entry.title: LegalMALR:Multi-Agent Query Understanding and LLM-Based Reranking for Chinese Statute Retrieval

author.name: Yunhan Li, Mingjie Xie, Gaoli Kang, Zihan Gong, Gengshen Wu, Min Yang

entry.summary: Introduces LegalMALR, a retrieval framework combining multi-agent query understanding with LLM-based reranking for Chinese statute retrieval, addressing implicit, multi-issue legal queries.

entry.title: Superpixel-Based Image Segmentation Using Squared 2-Wasserstein Distances

author.name: Jisui Huang, Andreas Alpers, Ke Chen, Na Lei

entry.summary: Proposes image segmentation method using squared 2-Wasserstein distances, combining superpixel generation via optimal transport with distributional distance-based merging for handling strong inhomogeneities.

entry.title: StealthMark: Harmless and Stealthy Ownership Verification for Medical Segmentation via Uncertainty-Guided Backdoors

author.name: Qinkai Yu, Chong Zhang, Gaojie Jin, Tianjin Huang, Wei Zhou, Wenhui Li, Xiaobo Jin, Bo Huang, Yitian Zhao, Guang Yang, Gregory Y. H. Lip, Yalin Zheng, Aline Villavicencio, Yanda Meng

entry.summary: Proposes StealthMark for verifying ownership of medical segmentation models using uncertainty-guided backdoors that are harmless and stealthy under black-box access.

entry.title: LGDWT-GS: Local and Global Discrete Wavelet-Regularized 3D Gaussian Splatting for Sparse-View Scene Reconstruction

author.name: Shima Salehi, Atharva Agashe, Andrew J. McFarland, Joshua Peeples

entry.summary: Proposes LGDWT-GS for few-shot 3D reconstruction integrating global and local frequency regularization via discrete wavelet transforms. Introduces new multispectral greenhouse dataset.

entry.title: Cross360: 360{\deg} Monocular Depth Estimation via Cross Projections Across Scales

author.name: Kun Huang, Fang-Lue Zhang, Neil Dodgson

entry.summary: Proposes Cross360 for 360° depth estimation using cross-attention to integrate less-distorted tangent patches with equirectangular features, addressing global-local consistency.

entry.title: AGE-Net: Spectral--Spatial Fusion and Anatomical Graph Reasoning with Evidential Ordinal Regression for Knee Osteoarthritis Grading

author.name: Xiaoyang Li, Runni Zhou

entry.summary: Proposes AGE-Net for knee osteoarthritis KL grading combining spectral-spatial fusion, anatomical graph reasoning, and evidential ordinal regression for uncertainty-aware predictions.

entry.title: STARS: Shared-specific Translation and Alignment for missing-modality Remote Sensing Semantic Segmentation

author.name: Tong Wang, Xiaodong Zhang, Guanzhou Chen, Jiaqi Wang, Chenxi Liu, Xiaoliang Tan, Wenchao Guo, Xuyang Li, Xuanrui Wang, Zifan Wang

entry.summary: Proposes STARS for missing-modality remote sensing semantic segmentation using shared-specific translation and alignment to address feature collapse and overly generalized recovery.

entry.title: Source-Free Domain Adaptation by Optimizing Batch-Wise Cosine Similarity

author.name: Harsharaj Pathak, Vineeth N Balasubramanian

entry.summary: Proposes source-free domain adaptation via optimizing batch-wise cosine similarity using neighborhood signatures to mitigate noisy neighbor effects without source data access.

entry.title: OTI: A Model-free and Visually Interpretable Measure of Image Attackability

author.name: Jiaming Liang, Haowei Liu, Chi-Man Pun

entry.summary: Proposes OTI, a model-free visually interpretable measure of image attackability based on intrinsic image properties rather than model-dependent gradients or perturbations.

entry.title: Advancing Structured Priors for Sparse-Voxel Surface Reconstruction

author.name: Ting-Hsun Chi, Chu-Rong Chen, Chi-Tun Hsu, Hsuan-Ting Lin, Sheng-Yu Huang, Cheng Sun, Yu-Chiang Frank Wang

entry.summary: Combines advantages of 3D Gaussian Splatting and sparse-voxel rasterization by introducing a voxel initialization method that leverages Gaussian priors to place voxels at plausible locations with appropriate level of detail.

entry.title: Bridging Supervision Gaps: A Unified Framework for Remote Sensing Change Detection

author.name: Kaixuan Jiang, Chen Wu, Zhenghui Zhao, Chengxi Han

entry.summary: UniCD is a unified change detection framework that handles supervised, weakly-supervised, and unsupervised tasks through a shared encoder and multi-branch collaborative learning mechanism for remote sensing imagery.

entry.title: Masked Depth Modeling for Spatial Perception

author.name: Bin Tan, Changjiang Sun, Xiage Qin, Hanat Adai, Zelin Fu, Tianxiang Zhou, Han Zhang, Yinghao Xu, Xing Zhu, Yujun Shen, Nan Xue

entry.summary: LingBot-Depth treats depth sensor inaccuracies as 'masked' signals and uses masked depth modeling with visual context to refine depth maps, addressing geometric ambiguities from hardware limitations.

entry.title: UPLiFT: Efficient Pixel-Dense Feature Upsampling with Local Attenders

author.name: Matthew Walmer, Saksham Suri, Anirud Aggarwal, Abhinav Shrivastava

entry.summary: UPLiFT demonstrates that iterative upsampling methods can achieve state-of-the-art dense feature upsampling with lower inference cost than cross-attention-based approaches, using local attenders.

entry.title: Spatial-Conditioned Reasoning in Long-Egocentric Videos

author.name: James Tribble, Hao Wang, Si-En Hong, Chaoyi Zhou, Ashish Bastola, Siyu Huang, Abolfazl Razi

entry.summary: Studies how explicit spatial signals influence VLM-based video understanding in long egocentric sequences, introducing Sanpo-D dataset and evaluating depth fusion impact on spatial reasoning.

entry.title: QualiRAG: Retrieval-Augmented Generation for Visual Quality Understanding

author.name: Linhan Cao, Wei Sun, Weixia Zhang, Xiangyang Zhu, Kaiwei Zhang, Jun Jia, Dandan Zhu, Guangtao Zhai, Xiongkuo Min

entry.summary: QualiRAG introduces training-free RAG framework for visual quality assessment that leverages latent perceptual knowledge of multimodal models for fine-grained spatiotemporal quality understanding.

entry.title: Depth to Anatomy: Learning Internal Organ Locations from Surface Depth Images

author.name: Eytan Kats, Kai Geissler, Daniel Mensing, Jochen G. Hirsch, Stefan Heldman, Mattias P. Heinrich

entry.summary: Proposes learning framework to predict 3D locations and shapes of internal organs from single 2D depth images of body surface, trained on synthetic data from full-body MRI scans.

entry.title: Larger than memory image processing

author.name: Jon Sporring, David Stansby

entry.summary: Addresses larger-than-memory image analysis for petascale datasets, showing that performance is I/O-bound and proposing streaming architectures that work with both slice-based and chunked representations.

entry.title: From Cold Start to Active Learning: Embedding-Based Scan Selection for Medical Image Segmentation

author.name: Devon Levy, Bar Assayag, Laura Gaspar, Ilan Shimshoni, Bella Specktor-Fadida

entry.summary: Proposes cold-start sampling strategy for medical image segmentation active learning that combines foundation model embeddings with clustering and proportional sampling for diverse initial training.

entry.title: Scale-Aware Self-Supervised Learning for Segmentation of Small and Sparse Structures

author.name: Jorge Quesada, Ghassan AlRegib

entry.summary: Proposes scale-aware SSL adaptation integrating small-window cropping for fine-scale structures, demonstrating improvements in seismic fault segmentation and neuroimaging applications.

entry.title: Splat-Portrait: Generalizing Talking Heads with Gaussian Splatting

author.name: Tong Shi, Melonie de Almeida, Daniela Ivanova, Nicolas Pugeault, Paul Henderson

entry.summary: Presents Splat-Portrait, a Gaussian splatting method for talking head generation that disentangles static 3D reconstruction from dynamic lip motion synthesis for more realistic animations.

entry.title: Multimodal Privacy-Preserving Entity Resolution with Fully Homomorphic Encryption

author.name: Susim Roy, Nalini Ratha

entry.summary: Introduces multimodal framework for privacy-preserving entity resolution using fully homomorphic encryption for government and financial institution data matching.

entry.title: Real-Time, Energy-Efficient, Sampling-Based Optimal Control via FPGA Acceleration

author.name: Tanmay Desai, Brian Plancher, R. Iris Bahar

entry.summary: Presents FPGA-optimized MPPI implementation for real-time sampling-based model predictive control, addressing energy and latency constraints on battery-constrained autonomous mobile robots.

entry.title: Quantum-Inspired Episode Selection for Monte Carlo Reinforcement Learning via QUBO Optimization

author.name: Hadi Salloum, Ali Jnadi, Yaroslav Kholodov, Alexander Gasnikov

entry.summary: Reformulates episode selection in Monte Carlo RL as QUBO problem solvable by quantum-inspired samplers, selecting episodes maximizing reward while promoting state-space coverage.

entry.title: PEAfowl: Perception-Enhanced Multi-View Vision-Language-Action for Bimanual Manipulation

author.name: Qingyu Fan, Zhaoxiang Li, Yi Lu, Wang Chen, Qiu Shen, Xiao-xiao Long, Yinghao Cai, Tao Lu, Shuo Wang, Xun Cao

entry.summary: PEAfowl improves bimanual manipulation through multi-view VLA with explicit depth prediction and spatial-aware query injection for 3D-consistent representations.

entry.title: How Information Evolves: Stability-Driven Assembly and the Emergence of a Natural Genetic Algorithm

author.name: Dan Adler

entry.summary: Presents Stability-Driven Assembly framework showing information can evolve through differential persistence alone, implementing evolution as emergent genetic algorithm without predefined fitness.

entry.title: DiffusionCinema: Text-to-Aerial Cinematography

author.name: Valerii Serpiva, Artem Lykov, Jeffrin Sam, Aleksey Fedoseev, Dzmitry Tsetserukou

entry.summary: Proposes DiffusionCinema, using diffusion models to interpret natural language prompts and generate UAV flight trajectories for cinematic video recording.

entry.title: Universality of Many-body Projected Ensemble for Learning Quantum Data Distribution

author.name: Quoc Hoan Tran, Koki Chinzei, Yasuhiro Endo, Hirotaka Oshima

entry.summary: Proves universality theorem for Many-body Projected Ensemble framework, showing it can approximate any distribution of pure states within Wasserstein-1 error.

entry.title: Conditioned Generative Modeling of Molecular Glues: A Realistic AI Approach for Synthesizable Drug-like Molecules

author.name: Naeyma N. Islam, Thomas R. Caulfield

entry.summary: Presents AI-assisted drug design for Alzheimer's using ligase-conditioned generative models to design molecular glues promoting targeted degradation of amyloid beta-42.

entry.title: E2PL: Effective and Efficient Prompt Learning for Incomplete Multi-view Multi-Label Class Incremental Learning

author.name: Jiajun Chen, Yue Wu, Kai Huang, Wen Xi, Yangyang Wu, Xiaoye Miao, Mengying Zhu, Meng Xi, Guanjie Cheng

entry.summary: Defines new task of incomplete multi-view multi-label class incremental learning (IMvMLCIL) and proposes E2PL using prompt learning to handle missing views and emerging classes.

entry.title: Authority Signals in AI Cited Health Sources: A Framework for Evaluating Source Credibility in ChatGPT Responses

author.name: Erin Jacques (York College, CUNY), Erela Datuowei (Teachers College, Columbia University), Vincent Jones II (York College, CUNY), Corey Basch (William Paterson University), Celeta Vanderpool (Teachers College, Columbia University), Nkechi Udeozo (CUNY School of Public Health), Griselda Chapa (York College, CUNY)

entry.summary: Introduces Authority Signals Framework for evaluating source credibility in ChatGPT health responses across four domains: author credentials, institutional affiliation, vetting process, and reach.

entry.title: RAICL: Retrieval-Augmented In-Context Learning for Vision-Language-Model Based EEG Seizure Detection

author.name: Siyang Li, Zhuoya Wang, Xiyan Gui, Xiaoqing Chen, Ziwei Wang, Yaozhi Wen, Dongrui Wu

entry.summary: RAICL converts EEG signals into waveform images and uses vision-language models with retrieval-augmented in-context learning for seizure detection.

entry.title: Explaining Synergistic Effects in Social Recommendations

author.name: Yicong Li, Shan Jin, Qi Liu, Shuo Wang, Jiaying Liu, Shuo Yu, Qiang Zhang, Kuanjiu Zhou, Feng Xia

entry.summary: Addresses explainability in social recommender systems by quantifying synergistic effects across multiple social networks using graph information gain. Identifies subgraphs embodying synergistic effects.

entry.title: MultiVis-Agent: A Multi-Agent Framework with Logic Rules for Reliable and Comprehensive Cross-Modal Data Visualization

author.name: Jinwei Lu, Yuanfeng Song, Chen Zhang, Raymond Chi-Wing Wong

entry.summary: Proposes MultiVis-Agent, logic rule-enhanced multi-agent framework for reliable multi-modal visualization generation with mathematical guarantees for system reliability.

entry.title: GCFX: Generative Counterfactual Explanations for Deep Graph Models at the Model Level

author.name: Jinlong Hu, Jiacheng Liu

entry.summary: Introduces GCFX, generative approach for model-level counterfactual explanations of deep graph learning models, providing comprehensive understanding of overall decision-making processes.

entry.title: Attention-Based Neural-Augmented Kalman Filter for Legged Robot State Estimation

author.name: Seokju Lee, Kyung-Soo Kim

entry.summary: Proposes AttenNKF, attention-based neural-augmented Kalman filter for legged robot state estimation that compensates for slip-induced errors through learned attention mechanism.

entry.title: Unheard in the Digital Age: Rethinking AI Bias and Speech Diversity

author.name: Onyedikachi Hope Amaechi-Okorie, Branislav Radeljic

entry.summary: Analyzes structural biases against atypical speech patterns being encoded into ASR systems, arguing that AI mediating access to opportunity compounds exclusion of diverse voices.

entry.title: Optimal Use of Preferences in Artificial Intelligence Algorithms

author.name: Joshua S. Gans

entry.summary: Applies information design methods to determine when separating preference-free training from post-processing preference application is optimal, introducing diminishing-value-of-information condition.

entry.title: A Regularized Actor-Critic Algorithm for Bi-Level Reinforcement Learning

author.name: Sihan Zeng, Sujay Bhatt, Sumitra Ganesh, Alec Koppel

entry.summary: Develops a single-loop, first-order actor-critic algorithm for bi-level optimization where the lower level is MDP policy optimization. Avoids expensive second-order methods and nested loops through penalty-based reformulation.

entry.title: On the Effects of Adversarial Perturbations on Distribution Robustness

author.name: Yipei Wang, Zhaoying Pan, Xiaoqian Wang

entry.summary: Analyzes the tradeoff between adversarial robustness and distribution robustness. Shows adversarial training can increase reliance on spurious features but also identifies conditions where both types of robustness improve.

entry.title: A Cautionary Tale of Self-Supervised Learning for Imaging Biomarkers: Alzheimer's Disease Case Study

author.name: Maxwell Reynolds, Chaitanya Srinivasan, Vijay Cherupally, Michael Leone, Ke Yu, Li Sun, Tigmanshu Chaudhary, Andreas Pfenning, Kayhan Batmanghelich

entry.summary: Finds that existing SSL methods underperform hand-crafted FreeSurfer features for Alzheimer's biomarkers. Introduces R-NCE framework that integrates FreeSurfer features while learning additional augmentation-invariant information.

entry.title: BoostFGL: Boosting Fairness in Federated Graph Learning

author.name: Zekai Chen, Kairui Yang, Xunkai Li, Henan Sun, Zhihan Zhang, Jia Li, Qiangqiang Dai, Rong-Hua Li, Guoren Wang

entry.summary: Addresses fairness in federated graph learning through BoostFGL framework. Identifies three sources of disparity: label skew, topology confounding, and aggregation dilution; proposes boosting-style mechanisms to address each.

entry.title: Finite-Time Analysis of Gradient Descent for Shallow Transformers

author.name: Enes Arda, Semih Cayci, Atilla Eryilmaz

entry.summary: Provides finite-time convergence analysis for shallow transformers trained with projected gradient descent. Shows width scales only logarithmically with sample size and optimization error is independent of sequence length.

entry.title: Provably Robust Bayesian Counterfactual Explanations under Model Changes

author.name: Jamie Duell, Xiuyi Fan

entry.summary: Introduces Probabilistically Safe Counterfactual Explanations (PSCE) with formal guarantees under model changes. Uses Bayesian principles to ensure CEs remain valid with δ-safety and ε-robustness.

entry.title: Provably Learning Attention with Queries

author.name: Satwik Bhattamishra, Kulin Shah, Michael Hahn, Varun Kanade

entry.summary: Studies learning transformer parameters with black-box query access. Shows O(d²) queries suffice for single-head attention; extends to multi-head with head dimension r << d.

entry.title: Theory of Minimal Weight Perturbations in Deep Networks and its Applications for Low-Rank Activated Backdoor Attacks

author.name: Bethan Evans, Jared Tanner

entry.summary: Derives minimal norm weight perturbations needed to change DNN outputs; applies to backdoor attacks. Establishes provable compression thresholds below which precision-modification backdoors fail.

entry.title: FedSGM: A Unified Framework for Constraint Aware, Bidirectionally Compressed, Multi-Step Federated Optimization

author.name: Antesh Upadhyay, Sang Bin Moon, Abolfazl Hashemi

entry.summary: Introduces FedSGM, a unified federated optimization framework addressing functional constraints, bidirectional compression, local updates, and partial participation. Provides convergence guarantees.

entry.title: Is BatchEnsemble a Single Model? On Calibration and Diversity of Efficient Ensembles

author.name: Anton Zamyatin, Patrick Indri, Sagar Malhotra, Thomas G\"artner

entry.summary: Shows BatchEnsemble tracks single model baselines in accuracy, calibration, and OOD detection. Members are near-identical in function and parameter space, indicating limited capacity for diverse predictions.

entry.title: 3D Molecule Generation from Rigid Motifs via SE(3) Flows

author.name: Roman Poletukhin, Marcel Kollovieh, Eike Eberhard, Stephan G\"unnemann

entry.summary: Proposes SE(3)-equivariant flow-based generation for 3D molecules treating them as rigid-body motifs. Achieves 2-10x reduction in generation steps with 3.5x compression in molecular representation.

entry.title: Better as Generators Than Classifiers: Leveraging LLMs and Synthetic Data for Low-Resource Multilingual Classification

author.name: Branislav Pecher, Jan Cegin, Robert Belanec, Ivan Srba, Jakub Simko, Maria Bielikova

entry.summary: Shows LLMs are better as data generators than classifiers for low-resource multilingual scenarios. Synthetic data from LLMs trains smaller models that outperform LLM direct classification.

entry.title: Memory-V2V: Augmenting Video-to-Video Diffusion Models with Memory

author.name: Dohun Lee, Chun-Hao Paul Huang, Xuelin Chen, Jong Chul Ye, Duygu Ceylan, Hyeonho Jeong

entry.summary: Introduces Memory-V2V for cross-consistency in multi-turn video editing. Uses external cache of previously edited videos with accurate retrieval and dynamic blending.

entry.title: Curate-Train-Refine: A Closed-Loop Agentic Framework for Zero Shot Classification

author.name: Gaurav Maheshwari, Kevin El Haddad

entry.summary: Proposes agentic loop where LLM curates training data, analyzes errors, and synthesizes targeted examples for lightweight text classifiers. Outperforms zero/few-shot baselines across four benchmarks.

entry.title: I Guess That's Why They Call it the Blues: Causal Analysis for Audio Classifiers

author.name: David A. Kelly, Hana Chockler

entry.summary: Introduces FreqReX tool using causal reasoning to discover frequency-space features sufficient and necessary for audio classification. Shows causal features align across different model architectures.

entry.title: BanglaRobustNet: A Hybrid Denoising-Attention Architecture for Robust Bangla Speech Recognition

author.name: Md Sazzadul Islam Ridoy, Mubaswira Ibnat Zidney, Sumi Akter, Md. Aminur Rahman

entry.summary: Presents BanglaRobustNet, a hybrid denoising-attention framework for Bangla speech recognition that integrates diffusion-based denoising with speaker-embedding conditioning for robustness across demographics.

entry.title: Noise-Robust AV-ASR Using Visual Features Both in the Whisper Encoder and Decoder

author.name: Zhengyang Li, Thomas Graave, Bj\"orn M\"oller, Zehang Wu, Matthias Franz, Tim Fingscheidt

entry.summary: Proposes dual-use of visual features in both Whisper encoder and decoder for noise-robust audio-visual ASR, achieving 35-57% relative WER improvements.

entry.title: Structural Complexity of Brain MRI reveals age-associated patterns

author.name: Anzhe Cheng, Italo Ivo Lima Dias Pinto, Paul Bogdan
